text: Soooooo amazing. Lobster grilled cheese is awesome, tacos to die for and lobster Mary's are the best!!!

Don't believe the pictures they have on the walls, actual lobster roll is much smaller than advertised. That being said, it wasn't horrible. Not a good deal for those from New England, but anyone will enjoy these!
Just become my favor sandwich here. I love lobsters. Although the portion is a bit small, but it's full of well cooked lobsters.

Pleasantly surprise. While fast food seafood conjures a certain amount skepticism, the food here is of decent quality. Staff was welcoming and informative for 1st timers. Great flavor for a snack while shopping. Needs more tables and floor mopped more often. Will visit again.

The taste of the food is awesome, and the prices are a little steep, but you are eating "Lobster" and you are in the "Venetian Hotel" so eat here if you want to not have to. Seating are limited but there's plenty as long as its not packed here.

The one in the miracle mile is better. A lobster Mary here is crushed ice filled to the top with a little bit of vodka and filled with tomato juice. It's disappointing because I live here and there is no bang for your buck. There used to be a lobster shooter which was a shot of vodka and lobster Mary which was excellent but without that this place is over priced and skimps every chance they can. Really suck because I used to love it.

I absolutely love eating here. I come here whenever I'm at the Venetian. They have the most delicious lobster. It's a bit pricey, but it's sooo worth it. The seating is cramped near the register, but the bar to the left side of the stand is usually empty.

Yummy rolls. 
Worth the $17? 
Nope!!
1lb of lobster in every roll??? 
No freaking way!!

Service was 5 Star considering this is more of a take out kine joint.  I didn't expect such good service!  Staff was really friendly and helpful.  Their suggestions were right on!

The Lobster Roll Connecticut Style was good but kinda small for the price. (this is why I removed a star)
Chowder Fries had me happily confused.  Who woulda thought of putting chowder on top of fries.  Tasted so darn good together!!
The Lobsicle!!!  Let's just say Heaven on a Stick!!!
Blueberry Lemonade was yummy but would be even better with blueberry chunks (just a suggestion)
10 stars service , good food and very clean place :) I love this place , clam chowder must try
The worst customer service i have ever encountered. The general manager Lucia is very unprofessional and clueless. I would really recommend to skip this location. DO NOT SPEND YOUR MONEY HERE.

Craved lobster roll, and found this place in the Venetian food court. Place was packed; loud; and service was slow. But lobster roll was yummy. Buttery toasted roll housed lots of fresh-tasting lobster.
Husband and I split lobster mac and cheese and a Connecticut roll and found them tasty. The lobster in the roll had a perfect texture too. Don't know whether it was the cheese sauce or the way it was heated that the lobster in that dish had a slightly less appetizing texture. 
I enjoyed the lobster mac and cheese a great deal, and although I've had better, this was quite good for the $12 price tag.
A good value for the money (and how often can you say that about an eatery in Las Vegas?)

I would give no stars if that was an option. Below average food. Tartar sauce in packages (ew) that don't open. Probably for the better. They don't have half of what is on the menu. Tables were dirty. Staff was not helpful and seemed to not really care. Save yourself and DON'T GO. You are better off with. McD's Filet O Fish...it's that bad.

I must say I came to yelp and checked reviews before I went to Lobster Me. Suffice to say, we all have a difference in opinion of what we like, so I thought I would share mine. 

Honestly , the service was great. The guy who served us was informative and helpful in our selections. I wish I could give it more stars for service.  I spent $23 for lunch, but hell - it's Vegas!! I was excited that it was in the Palazzo, where I was staying anyway, so it all worked out, or not...

Truthfully it was just OK. I love lobster rolls and I have had them from Maine to Newport, RI to Long Island, but this was really just okay... I had the Connecticut and it was flavorless...  Really... I had to sprinkle salt on it. Also, it was in a hot dog bun. Really! A small hot dog bun, filled with lobster meat, but not a lot of lobster.  I mean, a 1 pound lobster really isn't that big anyway. It was just really bland, which is unfortunate because I love lobster and it just was really disappointing. My friend ordered Lobster Grilled Cheese (which, honestly, just sounds gross anyway) but it also looked gross (not sure what part of the lobster was used) and it she said it was vile tasting and she couldn't really finish it. Even the drinks were mediocre.  I had blueberry lemonade which tasted nothing like blueberries or lemons and my friend had the cider which she didn't finish and threw away. Everything lacked flavor and was bland, bland, bland...

If you are ever in Long Island, go to Jordan's Lobster in Long Beach, NY. That's what I was thinking of as I sadly choked down my dry Lobster Me roll. Lobster NOT FOR ME for sure!!

Very nice change of pace. Light, flavorful and delicious. Had the classic lobster roll. Wife had the fish tacos. No complaints about either. Shared an amazing spicy lobster Mary. Would definitely eat here again.

Its a good restaurant. I passed here yesterday but I was full. Next day I came here for food which is very delicious. Somehow, the price is a little bit high but it's lobster.  The sandwich are awesome. I ordered original Maine style lobster toll with chowder fries and drink. The meat of lobster makes me happy because it has a lot. This is my last restaurant in Vegas.

Two Claws Up!

Okay, first of all...people who are complaining about the price and quantity need to get a grip. It's, uh, lobster. And lobster is expensive! So if you're looking for a cheaper thing, just go to Subway and get an imitation seafood sub.

When you see this place! Keep walking it's a TOURIST TRAP! The pictures will look enticing and you want something but trust me it's not worth your money! Go to a real lobster house to get some real lobster.

Very disappointed. Two of us had a lobster roll, a mac-n-cheese, and a soup to share and they were extremely greasy and bland that even with a help of hot sauce, we couldn't even finish one of them. Never ever going back to this place again.
This is my first time to Vegas , my friend told me I have to try this restaurant . It's so good and delicious ! Me and my friend ordered lobster roll , great service and super friendly

-Sunday afternoon (7/27), lunch time.

Having been born and raised on the coast of Connecticut, I can tell you that finding a good warm lobster roll there is a lot harder than you might think.  Most places only serve the cold version which tastes ok but there is something about warming it up that really brings out the flavor of the lobster.  I was pleasantly surprised when we came across Lobster Me, located right outside the Venetian's food court.  We had the Connecticut style lobster roll ($17) and the lobster and chips ($13).  The dishes came with a small side of coleslaw.  The roll is toasted and buttery and filled with chucks of fresh tasting lobster meat. The lobster and chips consisted of deep dried lobster chunks and beer battered fries.  I've had deep fried lobster once before as an appetizer at an overpriced steakhouse and the ones at Lobster Me were just as tasty.  The fries are crunchy and well-done.  The place has bottles of ketchup, Sriracha and malt vinegar on the tables for dressing up your food.  Perhaps I've been raised to like malt vinegar on fried seafood and chowder, but  I've often noted that seafood places here that know enough to offer malt vinegar (a ubiquitous condiment at seafood shacks throughout the northeast), usually know a thing or two about serving up authentic tasting seafood.  And this place is no exception.

Tip: Mix the ketchup and Sriracha together to make a spicy dipping sauce for the fries.

If I had to quibble about anything, it would be that the coleslaw doesn't have very much dressing on it and borders on being too dry.  I like my coleslaw creamier.  This however is a small thing compared to the taste of the lobster.  The place makes for a great lunch spot and I will definitely be back to sample more of their menu.

If you're looking for a kick ass Lobster Roll or Lobster Mac N Cheese... look no further than the Lobster ME... you won't be disappointed in the flavors that'll rock your taste buds... Lobster ME was recommended to me by a friend and I'm so glad I took him up on the suggestion. Daniela is the general manager but because of her passion for customer service, you'd think she was the owner of this place, she really cares about people.

The Lobsicle: a deep-fried lobster tail on a stick. You really can't go wrong with that. It's around $14 and it's good. Staff are great-- when I declined a beverage (I had a bottle of water in my purse), the girl at the register asked if I'd like a cup of water. The place is attractive and I like the concept. It's Vegas, and maybe you want luxury food, but you don't want to dress up and go out someplace with tablecloths and a wine list. Yes, it's a little expensive-- it's lobster. They aren't ripping you off, they're just serving you a specialty item. I've had McDonald's lobster rolls in New Hampshire (yes, they really have them there, in season) and those aren't the same price as a Big Mac either.
I ordered lobster roll and ordered a lobster Mac n cheese for my daughter. She loves it so much and finished it all by herself. The roll is kinda small but tastes good

Had the lobster mac&cheese and added bacon and chives. Hubby had soup sandwich combo. Portions seem small for the cost, It's definitely a bit pricey, which is the reason for 4 stars. However, everything was so delicious and we left with full tummies. We would definitely return and highly recommend.

The food was pretty good and the pricing was decent. It's nice to get a quick bite here and different from your typical food court joint. There was a wait for the lobster mac n cheese but I think we got it sooner than anticipated. I wouldn't mind coming back.

Lobster rolls are delicious and great in flavor. Environment is extremely clean thus making it an excellent place to eat. The  lobster grilled cheese is by far one of the best I've ever had definitely recommending Lobster me  !!!

First of all, when I came to the register I was not greeted with no smiles or any WORDS, Two Hispanic girls looked at me as if I were bothering into their conversation about what they did last night!!!! I am extremely upset, I felt ignored and unwelcomed, finally after me staring at them and when it was convenient for THEM to talk to me they asked me "what do you want" I ordered the lobster roll, I got it New England style and the meat was tasteless and had a texture like it came out of a CAN. They told me it was fresh and from Maine but I have been to Maine before and it is DISRESPECT that they even say it is FRESH when it is really FROZEN. Once I was done talking to the small Hispanic girl who was still extremely rude and did not give at least the minimum of guest service. I head over to the small space they consider a dining area which is compact and packed and they were even missing chairs! The tables were dirty and filled with leftover crumbs from previous guest. I observed that the cashiers did not wash their hands and just served food after handling money and being on their PHONES. THIS IS THE DIRTIEST AND WORST SERVICE PLACE I HAVE EVER BEEN, I WILL NEVER RETURN HERE AND I HOPE NO ONE EXPERIENCES THIS AWFUL PLACE!
P.S LOBSTER ME MANAGERS, YOU NEED NEW EMPLOYEES WHO ACTUALLY WORK AND GIVE GOOD SERVICE!

It was $15 for a deep fried lobster tail which I think is a decent but not great price.  This is Vegas and this is the Venetian so expect higher prices.  

It was really good but smaller than I'd anticipated for $15.

Me and my husband ordered the Cajun roll with fries and a drink. It was a little pricey but totally worth it. The roll they put the lobster was perfect and the Cajun lobster wasn't hot just added extra flavor which is just how I like.
I love these guys. Quick, tastey, & not a burger! Vegas is full of great burgers but this is a stand out break from all of that.

A friend and I had the lobster tacos and lobster salad. The portions aren't big but it's enough for lunch. Everything was fresh and the lobster delicious. Locals get a discount. I'll definitely eat here again when I'm in the neighborhood.

Good quick eat in the Venetian. Everything tastes good, but the portion size is underwhelming. The lobster rolls are barely 6 inches, so don't expect a true Maine style roll. The chip portion with the roll is good, but they barely half fill the cole slaw cup. I mean, what is your cost on cole slaw? Give me a full cup.

I had the Beltway. The flavors are good...the lobster was a little over done, as you'd expect from pre cooked meat that is heated back up. The roll was fresh and the seasoning was good. The amount of meat for the roll size is pretty good.

If you want lobster, it's a good quick bite, but for $20, you'd do better to hit a happy hour at any of the other places. I'm glad I went, but I don't feel any urge to go back again this trip.

We ate there 4 times on our recent trip to Vegas. We were a party of four and enjoyed each meal every time. Although it is "not a cheap" fast food option, it is LOBSTER! Loved the lobster roll and chowder! Definitely would go again.
Not bad for a "fast food" lobster joint.  Got the Maine style combo.  Fries were very good.  Lobster roll was good.  It was a seasoning that was a little off. Service was good.

GREAT!  Had the Connecticut and the Lobster Mac and Cheese. Outstanding! If you're a Lobster fan then this is the spot, especially for the price...for the sized portions you get it's surprisingly reasonable.

Yikes!  It's impossible to describe the abomination that these guys call a lobster roll.  Dry, absolutely tasteless, chewy little crumbles of lobster for nearly $30.  There was nothing on this bun that even remotely resembled lobster meat.  I would have complained on the spot, but had taken my order back to my hotel room.  A lobster roll is an incredibly simple product requiring just a few quality ingredients to yield a great result.  This thing was a horrible inedible disaster. Based on other positive reviews, perhaps this was a fluke....but I for sure won't try it again to find out.
Amazing food here. Had the original lobster roll and lobster tacos which blew me away. Hope they bring one too New York very soon. I would eat here everyday.

Clean cute space in the Venetian --- wasn't a planned stop but they had us at LOBSTER.  Ordered the original Maine lobster roll. It came with homemade chips and coleslaw. Everything was fresh and delicious.

Not the best lobster roll I've had but still pretty good. Lobster on the classic roll was fresh and full of flavor. Bread was fresh with a good texture. And the fries were crisp and tasty. Only knock was the price-it's Vegas but still, as somebody who knows what the same would sell for in New England I'm still getting over the sticker shock.  

But definitely worth a visit if you have a hankering for lobster on the strip
The worst customer service and unprofessional manager(Lucia) i ever seen in Las Vegas. I would recommend to skip this location and not to dine here. Awful, Ridicules and Unprofessional stuff.
I loved the product! Lobster was fresh and plentiful...and priced no more than any east coast outlet!
great food, the lobster is great. although, it's serving size may be too small, it is a great resteraut. recomand for people who want to eat a quick lobster meal.

Good variety in lobster roll menu. Rolls are 19 each plus another 4 for drink and fries. So pricey to me. However, substantial amount of lobster on roll. Atmosphere similar to fast food or quick eating. I would go back after trying other competition.
Always a pleasure eating at Lobster ME! From growing up in Maine and having lobster alot they do,a,great job! We go every time We are in Las Vegas! Yummy!

Great Maine lobster roll.  Don't go here if you don't want lobster or if you want ambience.  It's a no frills place to satisfy your lobster craving.  Price is reasonable.  My husband had the lobster BLT which he also enjoyed.
The food is phenomenal!! I could eat this every single day. Staff is very friendly and great

We live in Connecticut and visit Maine quite often. But i must say this place in The Venetian is absolutely capable of bringing the flavor in. awesome lobster rolls and sliders. also the cajun fries is a good catch too.
We ordered the Cajun Lobster roll and it was good. The server forgot our drinks.

Used to love this place but now is overpriced ($24)... mediocre lobster roll as my lobster was not fresh tasting... and the counter staff was less than friendly. I will be heading over to Luke's from now on.

Seafood is one of my favorite foods and the food is always great here and service is good, it's always clean and organized. One of the employees there, I think her name is Yvonne, she's always energetic and helpful so try and order from her if you can catch her working there during your visit! Overall the atmosphere here is enjoyful! Make sure to try the lobster roll!
Wonderful Lobster rolls and the tacos where excellent.  The best food court food I have ever had.
Are these guys still in business? Tried calling all of their locations. Bad customer service! Get some employees to answer your calls if you expect to grow your business! #FAIL

I try the original maine style roller here, taste good. A lot of lobster and very fresh. But undeniable expensive for a sandwich. You may have a try if you love lobster. Their service is OK, and they are really hot. Many people are here, you may not get a seat.

Decided to give this place a try based of the recommendation of a friend, and now it is a definite go to every time we come to Vegas. We got the Lobster Mac N Cheese and the Lobster ME Sandwich Cali Style while lobstering up our fries. We easily shared both dishes and chatted it up with some friendly guest at our table. It is a order first and seat yourself place and the staff was super helpful and friendly. The manager made it a point to interact with the guest to ensure everything was to their satisfaction.

how can you make a lobster not good ?????..... lobster me has found out a way ....
when we got there it was empty , i ask like 2 questions and the guy that was working there seem like he should of not been working there because he didn't know anything and he was very Rude !!..... i ordered 2 deep fryed lobster  tails .. and one lobster roll the warm one with butter ... the fryed lobster tails where  not season  at all !!.... learn how to salt and pepper your lobster ... i through i was going to eat sweet delish lobster... ..it needed SALT very badly !!!...
i don't understand why is there chinease hot sause on the tables and not tobasco  ... if your not going to salt the lobster then at least put SALT AND PEPPER ON THE TABLE ... i was searching all over for salt it was no wear to be seen ...so i dipped it in butter to see if it will help . it made it worse . there butter must be some cheap fake stuff ...
i had to ask for my drink 3 times ,,until i had to get up and ask for it again ... how can you forget a drink ,,keep in mine they was not bizy .... now on to the lobster roll.... yelpers there is only 1 size ,, there is not small or large .. only very small size lobster roll and also yelpers the pics on here are really old or fake because they don't put tthat much lobster on the rool and there is no giant claws in top on the sandwitch !!!.... i took about 2 bites and let me tell you this was not main lobster , or even lobster at all ... it had a very bad fake  taste   like imitation  !!!!!. pure bad tasteless seasonless ..even my wife said it taste like imitation crab meat no difference   i heard this place is good it was not , maybe the one at miracile mile shops are better , but this place was a waste of time not to mention money .. ...the only thing was good was the chowder frys that was it and it was a drizzle of chowder on them hardy any chowder on them  ,,.. i heard this place is good it was not , maybe the one at miracile mile shops are better , but this place was a waste of time not to mention money ..

Well this place was my first dinner in Vegas...I got here right before closing...I got the Conneticut...I asked for the lobster to be on the side so the bread didnt get mushy(that request was ignored) when I did taste my food...I was a little let down...I knew it was lobster...however it was too chewy almost like a hard boiled egg...I didnt get the "extra large" thing either...i ended up getting a 7$ sandwich at the gas station that had more taste and was around the same size as this "extra large" sandwich...maybe that applies to the meat and not this size of the bread...I dont know...I'd like to say I would come back but I feel like I was cheated out of 29$ in some ways...but I did try it and now I know...I like to concept of this place and the expanding menu...but I'd say try it for yourself but stick with a regular size and no soda or fries:-)

Not quite sure what's happened at Lobster ME. 9 months ago the lobster rolls were stacked to the brim with delicious lobster. I went for lunch today and there was hardly any lobster inside the roll. It looks like they increased the size of the roll, cut the amount of lobster, and then added greasy, fried potatoes. It used to be about the lobster. Now it's about cheap carb fillers. Better for the company's profits, I suppose. Don't recommend. Maybe try Luke's Lobster instead.
Came across this spot because Buchon wasn't opened yet.  Ordered the lobster roll, fish and chips, and the clam chowder.  Food was ok, nothing special to come back to.

Good lobster roll no filler all meat and cheaper then Ones in Maine $17 for a very good roll but $12 dollars for a 32 oz beer ? 
Good staff very friendly

Ammmmaaazzning customer service! Alesia I think was the name of the cashier who suggested the Mac and Cheese. Loved it! Can get enough of this place! Will be back for more! Super friendly staff, even the manager! Overall great place! The lobster rolls are pretty good too!

I ordered lobster roll and lobster mac cheese.  Very delicious. The best mac cheese I ever had. Sitting area is crowd but I ordered to go and enjoyed the food at the food court which is only 50 feet away.

Went to Lobster Me, my husband and I went to get a lobster roll once we got there we realize they had the lobster Grill  cheese sandwich so we went with that. It took a little minute for us to get our food but the store manager Jeffrey went above and beyond he came to our table let us know that they just rolled out a new menu and he apologized for the wait, I asked him how much was a fountain drink he end up giving me a Pepsi for the wait. Jeffrey also came and checked on us after we ate our food to see if we liked it. I love the atmosphere and definitely love Jeffrey customer service we recommend this restaurant if you're in Las Vegas

Whenever I'm at the Venetian, either watching a show or just doing a bit of Gambling I always make sure to stop by Lobster Me in the miracle mile shops.
Their Lobster roll is like being right back in the northeast and their lobster Mac n cheese always hits the spot for comfort food!

Lobsicle is delicious, you  can either deep fried or grill! You can also add $3 more for fries & drink or add $4 for soup & drink, it's really a good deal since the soup itself already cost $9. Enjoy!!

Walking through Venice/Venetian is an experience in and of itself. Surrounded by the plethora of shops, the sweet artificial river and Gondolas, you actually feel like you are in Italy. Due to my craving for seafood, I expected a fantastic lobster meal but I was not satisfied. For the $20 for the meal, my hunger was not satiated. Normally, I am not dissatisfied, but that day was an exception. The lobster was dry and the wait was long... I don't recommend this place despite its seafood allure!

Our plan was go to Todd English in Aria for the lobster rolls.  I had been craving them since a previous LV trip.  When we walked by Lobster Me thought it was destiny for my craving. I got the deep fried clam chowder and it reminded of the croquettes in the Netherlands except not much flavor and pretty greasy.   The lobster roll was a very good lobster roll.  It was pricey but you got a decent amount of lobster.  It wasn't mind blowing good or culinarily fancy but a good lobster roll.

Lobster ME is a food court stall located in the Venetian/Palazzo food court.  Just like everything on The Strip, it is overpriced and under seasoned.  I had a combo that was a traditional lobster roll, served with cole slaw, a drink, and a side of bisque.  With tax and tip, it was around $22 and not the best roll or soup I have ever had.  Normally, this sort of portion would be around $11 in Maine or even at a Brooklyn hipster joint.  But, compared to a sit-down restaurant on one of the upper levels, it is considered cheap because it is the food court.

I would probably not eat here again, since there are so many other options in the area.

Lobster me! Hubbys favorite! We always order the same thing, the lobsicle, grilled sandwich with lobster and lobster Mac and cheese! It's always good. Pricey but I think you get what you paid for. It's always fresh when ordering. Their cheese sauce for the waffle fries are really yummy! The only thing I that I will complain about and for the missing star is that there are not enough chairs and tables to sit down and eat. It was a little bit hard for us since we have 2 little kids and a stroller, we need some space to eat with kids and space for our food because the tables are really small and we usually order a lot, no place for our drinks  but overall and the food is really good. So worth trying their lobsters!
This place was so good been in Vegas for 4 days had it twice.. The Cajun lobster roll was the best I will be checking out where else there are lobster me

DROOOLS. this is to die for. Excellent lobster roll and very savory! I got the Cajun lobster roll combo and it was so delish I wanted more and more! Unfortunately, the portion is so little and the price is high. My roll was good but all I got was a big piece of lobster. Other than that, I didnt get like 2-3 big pieces as the other pictures but it was soo good! Portions are fairly small. The fries are yummmyyy! Very little portion as well. Great location since its like right around the corner from where I was staying at (The Palazzo) On the other hand, my friend got the lobster mac and cheese and that was okay. I thought it was very plain... not enough cheese!!!!! The lobster mac and cheese portion was okay! Enough for 1 person. I also got to try the clam chowder fries! It was gooooood!!  That was one of my favorite dish.

From: ChefDan the FlavorKing

DISCLAIMER:
 - If you only LIKE lobster, it's not going to blow your skirt up. On a budget? Don't do it.
 - If you're from New England, you might be disappointed....dunno.

And ignore reviews about price...IT'S LOBSTER! This amount of lobster and potato costs $32.00 in restaurants, much less Vegas.

This is my favorite meal in Vegas! As a chef it's easy to overpower delicate items like crab and lobster, and New Englanders found a way around that.

Now I'm not giving these guys credit for anything original. I'm giving them credit for bringing this to Vegas. Do either the Original but ask for it warm, or the Connecticut. The Diablo seemed too overbearing so didn't try it.

Lobster Tacos I was told were good. Wish I tried the Chowder fries and Lobster Mac.

On the second round I double-downed on the lobster for $10 more. It went fast but holy crap. This is lobster-heroine.

Awesome Lobster Roll ...It was the traditional  & it's now hot/warm it was delicious with some nice home made chip & a very light coleslaw. .very good but a tad pricy. ...a roll & a can beer was $27 bucks

Nothing special at all. Very disappointed. Lobster bisque was bland as were the truffle lobster and Connecticut lobster sandwiches. 

Definitely not worth the $50 we spent on lunch for 2 people.

What do they serve at Lobster Me?  LOBSTER!  This place is located in the Venetian on the second floor near the escalators near the floors 1-16 elevators.  Their menu consists of lobster rolls, lobster claws, lobster tacos, lobster mac and cheese, lobster grilled cheese, soups and hot dogs.  I ordered the lobster grilled cheese and it was quite tasty.  They added a good portion of lobster in the grilled cheese.  The prices are high and the size of the rolls are a little small but then again it's lobster.  You order your food, get a number, and find a table so this is more of a fast food theme restaurant.

This is one of my favorite places to get food fast on the strip. My favorite lobster roll is the cajun; it comes with cajun mayo and spices. It's like heaven after the first bite. The lobster mac n cheese is also very good. I wanted to try to the lobster bloody mary...don't do it. It was terrible, not worth it BUT the food is delicious. Worth trying if you like lobster and don't get the chance to get it very often.
Lobster roll The cajun was fantastic !!! the size of fish and chips was too little...but so fresh and tasty and fries are tasty too.  We recommand this place for lovers of lobster taste.

I had lobster roll & mac n cheese.
Maybe I expect too much for the food. 
Taste was ok. Service(cashier)was great.

Lobster roll is not worth to pay $19
Mac n cheese is better than lobster roll. Wish have more loster on it.

Travel is important.  And food is important.  Trying new and exciting food on your travels is of the utmost importance! And as for me, when travel allows me the opportunity to seek out and acquire a new spot for a lobster roll?  Now that makes me happy.  Happiness and lobster are very important!

Before departing on my recent trip to Vegas, a friend issued the comical challenge, knowing that I'm lobster roll obsessed, of finding "a lobster roll in the desert"!  Knowing Vegas is food mecca meant this likely wasn't a challenge at all, and a few seconds of searching on my Yelp app yielded not one but TWO Lobster ME locations on the Strip!  The Venetian location fit best into my plans for the day, so off I went!

Though located in what is described as The Canal Shoppes, if you're familiar with that stretch of stores, Lobster ME's location doesn't overlook the inner canal that the gondolas traverse, it's more tucked into a food-court-esque corner.  The employees are all SUPER friendly, and in a buttery mood I ordered up the Connecticut Roll combo, a roll of lobster tossed in warm butter, served up alongside steak fries and a drink. Yes this combo was $23, but anyone who squawks at that price needs reminding that lobster is a high end item despite being served in a food court. It's just a reality of the sammich! 

After ordering, you're given a number and can head back to the table, and my food was brought to me about 5 minutes later with a smile. Overall the lobster roll and fries were tasty, and while everything could have been a tad warmer, I was very satisfied! Is this the best lobster roll you're ever gonna eat?  No, but that would be a pretty crazy expectation. The lobster was real (not langostino, some places try to pull that fast one, but not here!), and was a touch overcooked so a bit chewy, but the flavor was nice.  Overall I was satisfied if not dazzled.  

If your next foray into the desert leaves you lusting for lobster too, Lobster ME is there to meet your needs! Just keep your expectations reasonable, and you'll walk away happy.

Well I realize these rolls are not for me. For a family of 4, I over ordered and we barely finished the food. The best item on the menu is the lobster tail on a stick. Don't waste your money on anything else.

Great location in the Canal shops of the Venetian. Great food but extremely over priced 17 bucks for a little lobster sandwich and 11 bucks for the lobsters grill cheese. If the price was slightly lowered it would almost intersect with value and taste for a 4  star value. But the service was casual and fast and the flavoring  was decent not memorable. Just fair. Your in Vegas so overspend and over splurge.

Lobster Me Las Vegas - Hey you're in Vegas Baby and whatever you want goes, right...So why not a Lobster Roll for lunch! As they say For The Love Of Lobster! 

Lobster Me Las Vegas is For the Love of Lobster the best spot to get your fix in Las Vegas. Their motto - The Best Lobsters are from Maine, Caught only when the time is just right, and be it simply bathed in butter or something a little more daring, there is nothing better than GREAT lobster. I couldn't say it any better myself and Lobster Me lives up to it in EVERY BITE.

For me it's The Venetian. Located in the Canal Shoppes it's a perfect stop on the strip for some of the best Lobster in Vegas. It's also set up so you can eat and run, because you're in Vegas and there is some much to do! You might be thinking....Lobster in the foodcourt? All I can say is You are missing out if you don't try it. It is definitely fresh lobster from Maine and amazing!

The menu is easy on the eyes and mind.  You will have your choice of.... yep, you guessed it LOBSTER. Lobster Roll, Lobster Tacos, Lobster Mac & Cheese, Lobster Cheese fries, and yes I can go on and on! Have that one person in the group that doesn't want lobster...that's ok, as they also serve shrimp, fish tacos, grilled cheese and the kiddo's can even get a hot dog!

My boyfriend and I shared the Connecticut Roll with the lobster me fries it was delicious and fairly priced! The workers there were very friendly and helpful as I was unsure of how big the roll was. Will definitely come back when I'm in town again.
Lobster mac and cheese was cold. Small portion. They did not even give us cole slaw. Will not return or recommend.

Oh not a good place at all. Ordered our food and waited over 15 min. Everything came out cold. A lobster roll is $19.00 it was less than 6 inches long on a tiny bun. Huge disappointment. The food did not have a good flavor and believe me i am from FL and know good seafood. Not worth 36.00 for 2 sandwiches...insane

Popped in for lunch, got the taco trio thing, was actually really good. It was fish, lobster and shrimp. I liked that they didn't make them all the same, so rack one was really tasty in ours own right, and the chips it cane with were over seasoned, but in a great way and also had a tasty cheese dip too. I plan on coming back again next time I'm in the Venetian ^.^
Great seafood quick! Had the taco trio and preferred the shrimp taco over the lobster. But really, everything was good. Lobster mac__cheese was good and not 'heavy'.

Horrid service and ridiculous prices. I cannot believe I actually just spent money here. Next time I will go to literally any other place in this food court. I understand that living and working and Vegas must be difficult. But that doesn't excuse your cashiers acting like primadonnas and snapping at me simply for dating to ask them a question about my order.

The mac n cheese is $15 and is literally like a plate of velveta mac n cheese with a few pieces of lobster thrown on top.

THREE WORDS: Lobster. Grilled. Cheese.
I remember watching a video on lobster grilled cheese (wasnt sure if it was from this place or not, but either way I was intrigued), so automatically I had to come here to try it out despite how full I was. My bf and I split a lobster grilled cheese and was so amazed by how great it was. The lobster was super tasty and the sandwich itself had a good amount of lobster in it. The cheese was so good and so perfectly cheesy. They had some scallions in it too, which added a great touch to the grilled cheese. I wish I had more of appetite when I came here so I could've tried more of their selection.

Loved it here! Sahar took care of us! Lobster lobsicle was wonderful. I had it both ways: grilled and battered. I think the grilled was my favorite. The drinks were wonderful! Really enjoyed my time here. Very friendly vibe.

We shared the Connecticut & Cajun Fries with a gigantic Sam Adams. The lobster was good & they boast a whole lobster in each sammie. Gotta love that. It was on par for other Lobster sammies we've had & good. Next time I'm totally getting my own. We usually share at new places because we seem to over order & are filled for the majority of the day other wise. But for this calorie laden yum I'm willing to bust at the seams a little.
Great lobster rolls.  It was my first time ever having one.  I can only imagine how they would taste in New England

Fried lobsticle! Git it git it. Not over battered/fried and plenty of flavor, don't even need to dip it in the butter. 

Their lobster mary was also good. Quite expensive, but also quite alcoholic, so that was A-OK in my book.

The lobster mac is INCREDIBLE. Get it; you won't have any regrets.

The lobster roll was sub par (but then again I'm spoiled since I'm from the SF bay area), so I would recommend it only if you've never had one before.

You order your food at the counter and they bring the food to you at your table. Very casual place and relatively ample seating. This restaurant is in a food court so you can swing by the place next door for dessert (if you have space left).

Came here for an afternoon snack while on vacation in Vegas. I had the original lobster grilled cheese and it was delicious! 

The bread was buttery and nicely toasted. There were also chunks of lobster and lots of gooey cheese oozing out of the sandwich. It was also really filling - i only ate half and saved the rest for breakfast the next day!

I love lobster. And I love Las Vegas, and really for me the Venetian is my fave hotel combining the fantasy architecture of Vegas in its heyday (gondola rides!) with elegance and great shopping. So what could be better than Lobster ME? It's like they knew I was coming and found a way to keep me coming back.  LOBSICLE!  My new love, my greatest love! Sweet gods of the sea, I needed this. Grilled lobster tail on a stick.  Totally reasonable price, amazingly tasty. Quick service, glitzy fun food, perfect for Vegas. Want to try everything on the menu.  Wish there was one home in LA!

Located in the Venetian shoppes area. This place combines good food like lobster with casual dining which is perfect for me. They take your order and give you a number and bring the food to your table. 

I had the lobster grilled cheese sandwich and it was good especially since I love crab more than lobster. The bisque soup was just ok. I also had the blueberry lemonade and it was to sour for my taste so I switched drinks with my husband and drank the apple cider and that was good. My husband said me about his lobster roll sandwich. 

I think this place is one of those places where you have to know what to order. It's a hit or miss kind of place.
I got the Maine lobster roll. It was packed with a lot of lobster meat. Very flavorful, the chips n slaw were very good too! I wish there was a lobster me in LA!

Terrible service! They are so slow, the orders were piled up ready to be served and the employees were just walking around with no sense of urgency. I saw the "cook" grab fries with his hands and pass them between containers. I ordered the lobster mac n cheese, and I got it after 20 minutes waiting. It was cold, chewy, and not appetizing. Save your money and go elsewhere.
Just get your credit card out and go wild! Everything is awesome here, from the lobster roll to lobster mac-n-cheese. You can't go wrong with anything on their menu. DELICIOUS!!! You're welcome ; )

Eat a lobster roll when in Vegas and you're broke with no money to spend on the buffet.  You'll come away satisfied with a taste of Maine but you're really in Nevada.  Pairing the roll on some Texas Toast was perfect as I was in a state of nirvana with crunchiness and soft seafood texture. After finishing my roll with fries, I left satisfied and full with energy to gamble and eventually buy another lobster roll.

I LOVE seafood so when I found out that there is a fast food place within the Venetian that's all about lobster I knew I had to check it out.

It's located in the food court but a little further down. Close to where the shops are. The menu is fairly limited but I guess there's so only so much you can do with lobster. The prices reflect standard seafood prices.

I had a new England lobster roll and requested it bunless since I eat low carb. The cashier suggested rolling it in lettuce instead and offered to replace French fries with soup. Very nice of her for going above and beyond for my dietary restrictions. Although my food came with buns tho... the food was good. Nothing mind blowing. But I was glad to have this option in the food court.

They also had several lobster drinks like bloody Mary's and micheladas.

I tried lobster tail sandwich. First of all the lobster was dried and taste less , Secondly sandwich is way small to what they show in picture and it's over prized for the quantity they serve. Service was bad and the place was empty during rush hour which shows how bad they are. I would never return to this place.
Lobster everything here is a good taste of veggies and lobster. Employees work very fast and the whole environment is nice around.

Fresh, fast, pretty good portions.  Gluten free options available.  Tacos are corn tortillas, not flour. Need to ask  questions to navigate the menu, and may need to ask twice, as the staff may not go into enough detail to communicate the items and there are not pictures of everything. 

All in all, pretty good. Not cheap, but hey, it's lobster, right?

I would give this a rating of 2 Based in the lack-luster lobster mac & cheese; however my wife did enjoy the lobster roll & the old bay fries were good. Back to the Mac & cheese... It looks nothing like the picture. It was a boat of Mac & cheese with one claw that was ripped into 5 pieces and placed on top. No lobster mixed throughout! Not worth it. Pretty disappointing.
The food is good.  Food is pricey for fast food but good and fast. That's what I like, quick and fast so I can be on the move.

Not bad for a lobster fast food chain, the food was good and reasonably priced.

Pros

Service: All the staff members were friendly and prompt with getting orders out as fast as they could. 

Prices: Affordable prices for lobster sandwiches and tacos without having to dine in at a fancy seafood restaurant.

Cons

Miso Sesame Roll: The miso sesame dressing was a major fail since there was no taste of miso or sesame in the dressing. The chunks of lobster meat however was prepped and cooked just right so I'll go for the original Maine style roll with just plain butter on the next visit. 

Lemonade: The lemonade was more sugar than lemon and it wasn't as fresh as it was advertised to be.

Looking to try something different?  I suggest you gice this place a shot.  Been here twice over the last few days and have been satisfied.   First visit I asked for sugfestions from the employee and took went with the Cajun Lobste Roll with a side of their seasoned fries.  The lobster roll was delicious and seasoned to perfection. Served in a toasted roll it was good to the last bite.  The fries were a great companion to the meal and made for a very nice lunch.   The meal was so satisfying that I made a return visit the next day and order another Cajun lobster roll along with the Lobsicle.  The Lobsicle, a grilled lobster tail on a stick, served with drawn butter was awesome.  Overall I highly suggest you give this place a try, but be wary of portion opportunities.  I know it's lobster but a slightly larger portion may go a long way.  I may give it another try tomorrow.

While waiting in line, starving, I was drooling and debating over which sandwich to go with and ultimately went with the classic maine lobster roll.  I pretty much always either get way too much food or not enough food, and of course this time I opted not to get the fries and drink for $4 more (In Vegas I know that's a steal, so I was mad at myself after I saw the size of the sandwich).  As others said, the potion size is tiny.  It said each sandwich  is a full pound, I obviously didn't measure it but it seemed small.  I feel that after so many people have mentioned the size, perhaps a "real life" size sandwich should be on display so people know what they're getting.  

Size aside, the meat was fantastic as was the coleslaw that came with it (BONUS)!  I have been debating between 3 and 4 stars since I had this, a week ago, but have decided on 3 stars (3.5 if I could) due to not only the size but due to the fact that there was only one girl getting the orders ready on the outside of the kitchen.  She was incredibly efficient, fast, friendly and you could tell she knew what she was doing...but it was BUSY. I watched her take off at least 20 orders at one time.  There really needed to be another person helping her...it was around 12:30 so it wasn't an unexpected rush.  Regardless, the food was great.  Next time around, I'd try a different sandwich (and hope it was as good as the Classic) and get fries and a drink so I could walk away full!

my friend and i got the same thing: the original lobster roll & apple cider. altogether a little pricey, but fine for a non-chain in vegas. there's not a lot of seating at all, and what is there is really close together. the apple cider was super good. lobster rolls were really good but way smaller than we expected for the price (and all the posters boasting how much lobster is in it....). the fries were not great; i thought they were really greasy. 

overall the lobster rolls tasted great, but it was a little expensive.
Original Maine lobster style roll is awsome!! Lines could be faster and seating arrangements are horrible. Other than that food is great!

My husband and I shared the Connecticut, which I don't recommend doing. They are very generous with their lobster, but 1 sandwich is definitely not enough for 2 grown people to share. A little on the pricy end ($17), but they do give you a lot of lobster. 

I've tried both the Original Maine and the Connecticut, and I prefer the Connecticut. The reason being is that the Connecticut is prepared warm with warm melted butter drizzled inside. The Original Maine is also yummy, however, it is prepared with cold lobster inside toasted bread (tastes much better with lemon squeezed on it). So depending if you're a cold vs. warm seafood person, you may favor one over the other. 

The Cajun fries are "okay." Nothing out of the ordinary, but not bad. This is place is not fancy, but a little more upscale/trendy fast food joint. Most likely will be coming back.
I've  been here a few times.  Im not a seafood person but i love their lobster Tacos. Its a small place so it may be hard to find a seat on a busy day.

I didn't have high hopes for this place since it looked like fast food but boy was I wrong!! I ordered the Old bay lobster roll combo. I have to say it was one of the best lobster rolls I've ever had. I haven't travelled to Maine or anything so maybe my experiences are somewhat limited. But who cares?!?? It was soo tasty. The lobster was served warm on a soft buttery bun. The lobster was topped with breadcrumbs which I thought was a nice touch. The lobster roll came with a side of old bay thick cut fries. They were good, pretty standard. I will definitely eat here again on my next trip to Vegas!

Not that great for the price. Small portion for the sandwich, lobster chowder was more like clam chowder, fish and chips was super dry it was like eating a wood chip! The only thing I liked was the chips the french fries and the water. Do not think I would be here again!  let me rephrase I won't be here again.

Heavenly! The Cajun Lobster Roll I ordered was served on a warm, toasty, buttery Texas Toast bread that was shaped like a hit dog bun. It was overflowing with sweet lobster chunks and seasoned with a Cajun spice that was made from a unique blend of herbs that offered just the right amount of flavor but wasn't too spicy and didn't overpower the natural lobster flavor. The roll was served with homemade chips that were crunchy on the outside and soft in the inside - delicious. The service was great! I can't wait to go back.

My partner and I took our dear leader out to lunch for Boss's Day.  Lobster ME had been booked marked for a little bit and on this occasion it seemed proper to pay it a visit.  There were some concerns about attempting to negotiate the Venetian during lunch time.  As fate would have it after parking in the garage and getting off the elevator, and getting off the elevator we were able to locate LME in the area of the food court with ease.

The set up is straight forward.  You order and find a seat.  The service was friendly and offered up their knowledge of the menu, and individual favorites.  I went in on an "Original Lobster Melt."  I found it to be...of course cheesy but was not lacking in lobster pieces and flavor.  I also complemented by sandwich with an order of "Chowder Fries."  These are freaking awesome!  Fries smothered in clam chowder, cheese w/ bacon!  

After eating our meal...we made or way out the area just as quickly as we found it.  While making our way out of the garage, I reflected on the meal and enjoyed it's rich and stuck to the ribs quality.  You can't eat like that every day but if you do or are thinking about it....give LME a shot!!

First of all, if you don't know how to smile shouldn't you be working in the back? No one needs negative rude people serving you while on vacation. Was really excited to try out the food cause it looks so delicious on pictures but it wasn't that great. Also, if there is a person in front of you, it would be nice to be acknowledged.

Ooof, yikes.  I was reallllllly excited to try this place when we came to Vegas, because I'm kind of obsessed with lobster.  But this place was really disappointing.  We ordered the lobster bisque and their lemonade, and both were just...bad.  The bisque was extremely bland, no flavor whatsoever.  It didn't even really have a lobster taste to it, it was just some sort of general "soup."  The lemonade, which I was also really excited about because I'm a lemonade freak, was wayyyyyy too sweet.  Like, made my tongue hurt sweet.  The employees here were very friendly however, and the service was pretty quick.  Maybe I'm an idiot and don't learn, but under the right circumstances I'd maybe come back to try their lobster mac and cheese or lobster roll, which seems to be their pride and joy.  But definitely stay away from the bisque, and don't drink the lemonade unless you like developing diabetes on the spot.

This place is in one of the hotels in Vegas in a small food court. It has all things lobster. However, as a mid court place implies, it was not the greatest. Then again, what silly person has lobster in a food court. Our mistake. The only thing that was kind of good was the lobster bisque. The lobster sandwich was lame with a small amount of lobster in it and the croquet was soggy. If you want lobster, don't eat it at a food court. Lesson learned.
Very good lobster rolls in a couple of different options - cold or warm. Line is a bit long. Many things a la carte so even though you think its cheap... it isn't really.
The food was great the service was great of course when you're by and lobster it's a little expensive but if you're on a lobster lover like me I would recommend it and I'm going back

The Connecticut is amazing! I didn't think it was going to be so good, but I ate that thing so fast. I literally died after the first bite. The diablo is super spicy. I thought I could handle it but the level of spice is like 10 out of 10. Think of the spiciest Indian or Thai dish and times that by infinity. The first few bites aren't bad until you finish the roll and you suddenly realize that your mouth is a furnace and you need milk quick. Don't try the diablo unless your stomach is made of steel. You'll have crazy poops. Portions are small but the fries helped fill me up.

Located just before you reach the food court in the Venetian by the gondolas, Lobster ME is better than it needs to be. Rolls approaching the $20 mark are not huge but packed with meat instead of filler, and served with kettle chips and a side of coleslaw- a $4 upcharge will get you fries and a drink. If you don't want a roll, the fish and chips features haddock and is a generous portion.

Service was quick considering their steady business. I appreciated the sriracha and other hot sauces available on the table to kick up your seafood. Add a Maine Root root beer to complete your order. Seating is somewhat limited, mosey down the hall a hundred feet for additional seating if needed.

Note that they currently have a promotion to join their email list and get free fries with your purchase. Not bad.

The ravings are real. Stop by for your lobster roll craving. Its def worth trying out. I was hesitant after going to all the other raving joints in vegas but this one will be worth hitting up. Prepare your wallets. Get the classic lobster roll, dont get fancy n try to get other things. Thats all you need
I've always wanted to try a lobster roll. it was on something like a hot dog bun,  dry and bland. I can check this off the food bucket list with a meh. disappointing for $30!

Had CT lobster roll with Cajun fries!! Very yummy!! 17$ for roll and 4$ for fries and soda. Only downside is the seating! It's to small!! Need more room for the masses of people! I thought the food was really good. It's like fast food lobster!!
Tried lobster roll and fried shrimp were amazing.... would definitely eat here again....
My favorite lobster roll place. Any of the lobster rolls are great. Also add the combo and get the blueberry lemonade and lobster bisque. The cajun fries are delicious too.

We got two sandwiches here with no  drinks, $45. My lobster roll did not have big claw pieces like the pictures, it was all very small meat and zero claws. Very dry and I had to ask for mayo. There was a lemon wedge includedbut it was underneath the waffle fries for some reason. Wife had the grilled cheese  lobster that had some small chunks of claw meat. Ok food, very friendly cashier, but not a cheap fast food option.

Some of the best lobster I've ever had! We got the lobster grilled cheese, Mac and cheese and lobster roll. Definitely coming back next time I'm in las Vegas. The manager Jeff was also very helpful with recommendations! Highly recommend!
Was so yummy!  I recommend Lobster me if you love lobster like I do. It's the real deal.

My wife and I love this place. Best lobster sandwich we ever had.  We ordered the Connecticut and lobster was huge and very fresh. We got the combo with lemonade and chowder fries which were also pretty good. Would definitely come back and try other flavours.

I'm literally standing here waiting for my food watching an employee on crutches work harder than anyone else.

Bravo Brian, you are rare

Located in the Grand Canal Shoppes this is a great place to get a quick bite to eat and still eat luxuriously. Lobster galore, prepared in a multitude of ways. Taco, grilled cheese, lobster on a stick, and lobster roll served cold with mayo or warm with melted butter. I chose the Connecticut which is served warm and melted butter, the lesser of the two evils. I enjoyed the roll and it's a great option if you are in a hurry and have serious shopping to do.

Lobster on a stick!?!?! Seriously all of my dreams have officially come true. 

Great chunk of lobster grilled to perfection with butter on a stick. I cannot say anything more other than you should go try one immediately.
The staff is incredible, and the food is even better! The Connecticut was warm, buttery and amazing!
Disappointed with the size of lobster roll. Very small. Macaroni was ok. Will not eat there ever again.

This was my first time eating at this location I ordered the deep fried lobster and the lobster on the stick and a lobster sandwich I informed the manager  the lobster lobster was ice cold in the middle the lobster sandwich they remade it but left it on the counter for 15 minutes the lobster macaroni and cheese was the worst thing I have a look that I would not recommend this location at all The only reason why I gave this a one star was looking over the sports bar other than that the manager at the time she was dizzy and confused she didn't even offer to remake my order or to correct it.

We were running a little late for a concert at the Venetian theater. The food court is in a super convenient location for the theater. It is just up the escalator from the entrance so it is ideal for a fast meal before the concert. I had seen the poster for Lobster Me on the walk into the venue and was excited about trying lobster as a fast food. This is a walk up counter where you place your order and then find the table. Then they bring your food to the table. They have a couple of different options for ordering the lobster. Since it was my first time here, the person behind the counter told us the most popular lobster roll is the Maine lobster roll. Decided to try that one. What you get is a small paper tray with the lobster roll, very small side of coleslaw, and about 10 homemade potato chips scattered on the bottom. in fairness the 4 or 5 forkfuls of coleslaw that made up the side of coleslaw was actually quite tasty. And the homemade potato chips were quite good. The lobster roll however, was not. The best way I could describe it was a little bit of shredded lobster in a sea of mayonnaise on what looked like a piece of toasted white bread that they called a roll. I am used to not getting a lot for my money when you eat on the strip, but 17 bucks for this I feel is a total rip off.

Very fun new food court style restaurant.  I don't live on the east coast, but do love lobster.  We had lobster rolls and the lobster bisque.  I've had  better bisque, but the lobster roll was very darn tasty.   If you are looking for a change and something a little different, give it  try.   Yes, it's pricey, but the word lobster should equate with $$.  It's not artificial meat.
So good!! Definitely worth your money. The lobster was warm and buttery and the bread was really soft. Highly recommend!

Food:  I ordered the original Maine lobster roll.  My fiancee ordered the clam chowder.  Both were pretty good meals.

Food rating:  4/5

Service  Service here is decent.  

Service rating:  3.5/5

Price:  Expect to pay about $12+ per item

Overall:  Good late night place to snack on.

Just had a great lunch but more importantly watched the team of Susan and Yvonne. The two performed impeccably during the lunch rush. The interaction is flawless, a choreographer couldn't improve the system they have. A must for a great lunch and a must see in action.
Worst food on the face of this planet staff was very disorganized and sloppy. The manger Kelly was very rude and unprofessional. I wouldn't suggest my worst enemy to waste there money on this dump

I had the lobster grilled cheese and my husband had the fish and chips. The grilled cheese was extremely rich. I got to a point where I just couldn't finish it. It cost $15 just for the grilled cheese and an additional $4 to get fries and a drink. My husband's fish and chips were "nothing special" and he said his fries were too salty. His meal cost $12 and an additional $3 to add on a drink. The table behind us got the Lobsticle, which is a lobster tail on a stick. It costs $15, comes with nothing, and is only as big as an index finger and middle finger put together. If I EVER went back I would try the lobster rolls. It seems like that was the decent way to go but still overpriced.

Fried lobster on a stick.. awesomeness. I ordered that along with a lobster roll and lobster mac n cheese. The stick was by far the best. The Cajun lobster roll was very good. The mac n cheese was ok. Not much lobster in it and the flavor wasn't anything extraordinary. But i would definitely go back for that lobster roll.

To be honest, I don't think I've had a better lobster roll, I just don't love them enough to justify giving them a 5*.

I had the lobster roll with a garlic butter and herb sauce. There was plenty of lobster and their fries were crispy and perfect as a side. The coleslaw was pretty average but that's not what I'm judging here.

The lobster bun was a good size and was perfectly golden brown. A nice, quick meal at a reasonable price considering its lobster and Las Vegas

First time diner/big time fan.  Got the Connecticut Roll (butter instead of mayo) Combo with fries and a drink.  Delicious and plenty to eat for lunch.  And all (including a little slaw) for under $25).

Counter service was friendly and efficient.  Seating is limited but not really a problem.

Decent lobster rolls. I've had better and bigger (that's what she said) but it isn't terrible, so if you've never had a lobster roll before ...you may think this is da bomb. But trust me.. There's better

I stopped in for a quick bite before heading back to the airport & I'm glad I did! I ordered the original lobster roll with fries & coleslaw. The bread was soft with a light crunch.....the lobster was well seasoned.....& the coleslaw was the best that I've had (next to my moms). The service was grade A & the food was even better. The atmosphere was rather lively & full of conversation. The employees were attentive & offered suggestions on local sights & shows. Overall my experience was good considering that this location is inside the hotel/food court.

Came for a quick dinner with the family.  I had the Cajun Lobster Roll with fries , and my husband had The Beltway Lobster Roll.  Both were delicious!  Don't let the small size fool you; it's packed with sweet lobster meat and spices. They need a franchise in Atlanta.

The staff was friendly but the lobster was waaaay over cooked. It literally felt like chewing rubber bands. If the name is LOBSTER Me..... There's really no room for error on a lobster roll seeing as it's the main attraction. I had chowder fries they were awesome. I wouldn't return due to the over cooked lobster. They got two stars because the staff was super nice.

This was an accidentally find in Venetian/Palazzo (I never know which is which or where I'm at). 

The sandwiches are ~$17 and are pretty small, about the length of my hand.  But they're filling and good so I don't have any issues. If you have a huge appetite though, it may not be enough for you! One of us got the combo for $4 (drinks + fries) and I didn't care for the fries. They say they're "beer battered" and it just makes the outer part so thick and crunchy, not my favorite. 

It was a good one-time try and a nice sandwich but nothing I'd rush back for or crave.

Loved it! My husband and I went to have lunch here twice during our recent visit to Vegas and its delish! We both got the lobster rolls (sandwiches) and loved them. The flavor is great and the amount of lobster on the sandwich is impressive. A must try.

As a lobster lover, I do love Lobster ME!!! Various flavor you can choose, I do suggest Connecticut lobster roll!!! And also clam chowder~~~ So if you visit Venetian, lobster ME is one of the best fast food  choices. The only con is the price is high.
The Lobster Roll & French Fries was delicious with generous portions.  Friends had the knuckle sandwich and they also said it was excellent. We were all disappointed with the Lobster Mac & Cheese.

Located at the main food court next to Houdini's magic shop

Really good lobster rolls, not great, but good especially for $18 for a small roll. Served 4 different styles, I tried the "original Maine" style which is served cold. I preferred it served hot but it was still good. The other styles I believe are served hot.

Lobster tasted really fresh and the garlic bun was really good. Only thing is that it needed more sauce, i believe it was a combo of mayo and something else but it was good, wish they put on more.

Way too pricey $18 for a tiny roll, it is really small and only enough for one person. It is good, but definitely not worth it in my opinion.

3 because the cashier was super cool and down to earth. Located downstairs 2nd floor from our suite in the Venetian, grand canal shops. 

Rolls was ok. Seriously though 20$ for chips and sandwich. Also ordered fish and chips. Crappy! Lol fries was bomb though no lies....

Subpar when considering the price of this place. I've had far better for cheaper in Los Angeles, which is not a cheap place to dine. All in all its a good concept that was poorly executed. Food wasn't very flavorful and very dry. There are much better dining options in Vegas.

Today I was at the Venetian and stopped in for a lobster roll. Fresh, tasty with plenty of lobster. Simply awesome. There's not much to say about the cole slaw. It has NO flavor. Service is helpful and friendly.
Fast food lobster - what could be better? I had the Lobster Mary for lunch...so perfect! Gotta love Vegas.

Little hidden gem. Worth finding. Friendly staff and good food. Next time will definitely try the grilled cheese lobster sandwich. The Cajun and original were awesome.  If you miss this one.  There is another in the mall next to planet Hollywood

Had the opportunity to eat here at both Vegas locations and both meals were the best I've had in a long time!

The concept here is simply amazing; simple dishes stuffed with a generous amount of lobster at a fair price. What else could you ask for?

The lobster itself tasted delicious. I tried the cajun lobster roll and the lobster grilled sandwich and they were both as good and both stuffed with lobster meat that was seasoned to perfection. The fries that I ordered with the cajun roll weren't anything special really but still good.

There's not really much else to say sbout this place. You simply have to try it if you are in Las Vegas and I promise that you won't regret it.

Love this place! Blueberry lemonade!!! 

I am a fan of grilled cheese so I love the lobster melt. They have a variety of different flavors for their lobster roll too. They give you big chunks of lobsters in all their sandwiches. It is a bit pricey, given that it is lobster, but it is worth trying, especially if you cannot think of what to eat and you do not want to travel far (if you're in the Venetian or Palazzo hotel). 

The clam chowder was also good. But I rather have the lobster melt that contains more lobster than the tiny clams that is in the soup.

They offer conbos too! So you can get a roll, fries (I recommend the chowder fries), and a drink for a certain amount. They also offer it for the lobster melt even though it is not listed, just ask them.
lobster rolls, cajun fries , fish tacos, lobster fries. all highly recommended. very good and tastes awesome!!!!! you won't regret it. bit $$ but worth your $$

Awesome Lobster Rolls, I ordered the "The Original Maine Style" and it was full of lobster and delish. Had it with a side of clam chowder which was also good. This place was amazing. I came here after the gondola ride at the Venetian. 

Look forward to coming here again in my next Las Vegas trip.

I was in the area and saw the place, and decided to try it out as I was having a really bad seafood craving that I had to satisfy. I really had no idea what I wanted to order, but luckily for me the manager on duty at the time Jeff was extremely friendly and recommended me some of the more popular items. I decided on the loaded fries, and let me tell you that it was nothing short of spectacular! I wasn't expecting to see so much meat on the fries, so for the price it's definitely worth it. Jeff made sure to keep checking in on me, and it really made me felt cared for, which is something I really wasn't expecting when looking for a quick bite! I will definitely be coming back!

I am not going to lie, I was hesitant to get a lobster meal at a fast food place. But I was so wrong about that because the food is absolutely amazing! The food in my opinion was actually far greater than some of the sit down seafood restaurants I have been to. Husband and I ordered the Cajun Lobster Roll and the Lobster Mac and Cheese. I am drooling just thinking about it because it was that good! The place was really busy though, and seating was limited.

This place was SO good!  I had the lobster grilled cheese, my husband had the lobster mac n cheese, and we split some chowder fries. The fries were insanely good. They were beer batter and had a perfect crisp to them. Then there was a good amount of chowder, cheese sauce and then bacon put on top. The crisp fries became softer but not mushy which is always a plus. The lobster grilled cheese had a lot of strong cheeses in it so you must be into that in order to enjoy.... which I definitely did.  There was a good amount of lobster mixed in too, unlike a lot of other places.  The Mac and cheese looked pretty standard which was shell noodles, cheese, and lobster sprinkled on top. My husband was really full after wards though. Maybe the noodles are heavy?  My children got their own kids plain Mac and cheese. They definitely could have split one! We will definitely be back!
Lobster roll had a lot of lobster. Great price fast service. Lobster chowder was alright not much lobster in it but the chowder fries were good. All in all a good place to eat

I like this place it's really good! 4 stars just cuz the space for this place is kinda small.
I tried lobster and chips which for it was a lobster tail on a stick and fries. I thought it was suppose to be chopped up lobster pieces... Oh well still good! I took so pics of the menu cuz it seems some of the pics on here are a year old!

Came back this year and the lobster meat was a lil chewy and felt less succulent than lobster should.

Still love those lobster chowder fries though.. even better this time!

The tables all looked and felt a lil sticky..I wish they'd update the dining area to be less fast-foodie looking.

I love lobster and the idea of a pound of fresh lobster was too tempting not to try. I got the Connecticut. This is the butter warm lobster roll in a classic Maine lobster bun.  I ordered mine as a combo with the fresh lemonaide. The roll itself had big pieces of lobster but not as amazing for the price as I expected the fries however were impressive. They were done perfectly and tasted the way fries should. The coleslaw was not remotely impressive. 

If you enjoy a lobster roll I personally thought the one I had at the Todd English pub near the Aria far and away better and less expensive.

Tried the lobster roll Maine style! AMAZING! Lobster is so fresh and goes perfectly with the buttery roll! The pickle was a huge surprise... very flavorful and crispy! Very yummy. 

I'm giving it a 4 start as the clam chowder wasn't very good... I expected more flavor.

This place is sooooo underrated. I was surprised how good the food was and not even expensive! I recommend all the lobster dishes! My favorite has Mac and cheese. I can't believe I haven't appreciated lobster this much before. It has a good variety of dishes so you can get just about anything and be happy with it.

Tasty tasty lobster! I had the Maine style lobster roll which I think was $16. That might seem like a pretty penny, but you get a lot of really good, tasty lobster meat in that. I'd rather spend $16 on a lobster roll than on a fancy burger. Super friendly and fast service. This was inside the Venetian and it felt a bit like a no frills food court. Not really a nice sit down experience but then again it's just supposed to be decadent fast food.
Bought the prince of Wales.  Lots of cheese lots of cucumbers was there lobster?? Couldn't taste it.  Overpriced and underwhelmed

This place is as good as you might expect for a lobster joint located in the middle of the desert. Meaning if you've ever set foot in the state of Maine, you won't confuse this for the real thing. But the lobster rolls are serviceable if you have a craving for lobster, like I did this afternoon. I got the "Beltway" (lobster, Old Bay seasoning, scallions, chives, drawn butter and Panko breadcrumbs on top) with fries. The lobster itself was just meh, a little chewy with none of the sweetness of fresh lobster. But the seasoning definitely made up for it. Being a Marylander, if Old Bay is an option, I'm gonna go with that. I've never seen this combo of flavors at another lobster roll place, and it's GOOD. That being said, if the lobster is fresh, all you really need is a little drawn butter on top. Fries are good too, crispy and well seasoned. Price point is about average - $18 for the sandwich, $4 more for fries and drink.

This place totally rips you off and doesn't care. Do not expect to get lobster tail meat. Your sandwich is only filled with claw and some body meat. The sandwich is small. About 5 inches. The food is expensive. A combo cost $25. Their website describes the lobster rolls as these flavorful, buttered,  and seasoned with herds of different blends. LIARS!!! I've eaten here twice. Both times the lobster meat had no trace of seasoning or butter. It tastes like it was just boiled, taken out of the shell, and that's it! Don't waste your money here. It's a shame. It would've been nice to have a good lobster roll place even if it cost a little more.

What's not to like about this place?!?! Nevada resident discounts, fresh lobster and a bunch of sides. Beer and wine plus soda to wash it down. Every time I'm in town I eat lunch here. Not cheap, but quality is great

My friend wanted a grilled cheese, I wanted a lobster roll. So we decided to come here for both of those treats!

My friend got a lobster grilled cheese which was $12, which in my opinion is pretty good, considering the amount of lobster I saw in her sandwich. My boyfriend and I each got our own lobster roll; I forgot which style but it was with mayo I think. They were good, but not amazing. The size was a little larger than I expected, but still not enough to get us super full. I was a little disappointed with the fries, considering it wasn't like the good East Coast style fries; they were like regular fries.

Staff was nice and the service was fast. It's a nice and quick place for fast food, but it is pricey, because of the lobster of course :)

First time I've heard of this place and so glad we stopped in. My comfort food is Mac & Cheese and I'm obsessed with Lobster so I thought why not? It was soooooo good. Def recommend this place and thought the portions were just enough!

had a late-night splurge while in vegas recently....wanted to try to lobsicles (lobster pops) as they sounded sooo good. we had lobster pop (fried & grilled) combo as well as lobster mac n cheese. lobster was fresh and delish! tho a little pricey it was a fun treat. we would do again ..... on a whim! ;-)

There is nothing more annoying than when a place changes the menu for the worse, that what these geniuses did. Looks like they also made the rolls smaller. Not sure why they would eliminate the chips instead of the crappy cole slaw, time to cross this regular stop off of the list
Great spot at the food court. Surprised at the size of the lobsicle though. Great service. The server came over to refill my soda.

Food was good, though not generous. The coleslaw cup was only half full, so maybe a quarter of a cup of slaw.  More bread than lobster.  I was disappointed that they didn't honor the yelp add for free bisque.

First timer here. I love clam chowder and I love fries! So I thought, why not order the chowder fries!
I was a bit confused on where to go to pick up my food. I felt awkward standing there so I went to sit down at a table. (I was lucky enough to snatch one because all the tables were taken.) As I sat there waiting for my order, I noticed how busy the place was. It must be very popular and I hope very delicious, I thought. I'm sure there was a line for Lobster Me, but it looked more like a blob than anything. There were people standing around, I wasn't sure if they were in line to order, to pick up their food, or just indecisively looking at the menu. Apparently, they called my name a few times. But I swear, I did not hear them clear enough! I heard an announcing voice, but nothing familiar enough to get my attention. I noticed the person who ordered before me already started eating his food, so I thought I would get up to see if my order was called. I think I waited another 2 minutes to find out that the bag I was staring at, sitting on the back counter, was in fact mines. 
Overall taste, I thought it was alright. Wished they were a bit more generous on the clam chowder, but that's just my opinion. Looks like there were more greens (cilantro and green onions) than the Chowder. I don't know if I would revisit. If I do, I'd like to try something different that is more worth the time.

UPDATE: Going through the photos that others had posted, my order of Chowder Fries looked super sad compared to the Chowder Fries from 2 years ago. I'm definitely disappointed now. I knew something wasn't right. What happened?

Good lobster roll, bread is buttery and good size portion of lobster.  However, not the best I have had here in Vegas.  While good, not worth a trip to the strip for me personally.  Money we'll spent though I went during restaurant week 20 bucks for a roll, fries and a brownie, but I probably wouldn't pay more than that for what it is especially the size of it is pretty small.

I'd have to say I prefer Todd English's or Double Helix Lobster rolls for the price and a bit more flavor.

Being from New England I was very excited to try this place. I'm so disappointed. First off he standard Maine lobster roll doesn't have anything in it except lobster and mayo. Maybe some salt and pepper. The lobster chowder had clams in it.  Another thing that doesn't normally happen. Too bad. This place had such promise.

Lobster sandwich NE style is / was very good - big chunks of lobster.  Sandwich comes with waffle fries :)  & slaw :(

Order at the register, pay, grab your #, find a table & they will bring you your food.

Omg sooooooo good.  Perfect meal for a drunk day.  Lobster Mac n cheese, excellent.   Lobster roll awesome.  Lobster Mary, amazing intro to bloody Mary's.   Great food but kind of hard to find.  Oh, and the old bay fries were amazing to.  Definitely check it out if you're in the Venetian!

Ordered the lobster me signature roll. The food was very bland and the lobster had absolutely no taste. The bun was big and the lobster meat was very little.i paid 24 dollars for this, I don't think it's worth even 10 bucks
There food is so delicious and mouth watering. There employees and manger were super friendly and helpful

Must-go place for Lobster lovers, we tried the signature lobster sandwich and lobster tacos, the lobster meats was offered in generous amount, accompanied with extra pickle cucumber and coleslaw, served separately in a fresh manner.
