Although we ate here at 10 pm, their still lobster tasted fresh...lobster tacos were flavorful esp with the Sriracha aoili...mmm...the lobster mac n cheese was ok...big chunks of lobster on top but the macaroni was overcooked. About their lobster roll, really packed with lobster only $17...cheaper than most I've tried but just as good. I got the original, cold with old bay seasoning...it wss too plain for me...i realized I prefer my lobster roll with some kind of dressing so I asked for the Sriracha sauce they put on their tacos...much better after that. The guy at the counter was very pleasant and helpful. Always with a smile.
Great lobster sandwich. Lobster was perfect and the bread was excellent. Fast service and great hospitality

I am always down to find a good lobster roll place. Since I'm here in Vegas why not explore what Vegas has to offer. Lobster Me is located inside the Venetian Hotel and structured like a food court. They have a variety choice of lobster to choose from. If you don't want lobster they also have some shrimp, etc. Some of the food items I find appealing are:

Lobster roll 
Lobster slider
Shrimp slider
Lobster mac and cheese 
Lobsicle

I ordered the Connecticut style lobster roll and clam chowder. The lobster roll was okay nothing special. I feel like it lacked lots of seasoning or something that would make the lobster stands out. The clam chowder was overly salty. It was just too salty that after 2 spoons I had to throw it away and clam chowder is my favorite soup. Pretty disappointed that this place isn't as good as the Lobsta Truck in California.

The one thing I don't like is the limited seating. You basically have to wait until someone get up on the table to get a seat. Plus there isn't anyone there to wipe down the table leaving crumbs and whatever mess left on the table for the next person.

We came here twice during our vacation and ordered the lobster roll, lobster bisque, and Lobsicle. The menu is a bit pricey, but that's because there aren't Maine lobsters in the desert.

Lobster roll (about $23)- chocked full of large pieces of lobster. Very flavorful and filling. 

Lobster bisque ($10) - Generous 12 ounce bowl of flavorful soup with chunks of lobster in it and served with a bit of shredded lobster on top.  

Lobsicle ($14)- It's a lobster tail on a stick. Can be ordered grilled or deep-fried. We ordered it grilled. Arrived on a small bed of cabbage with a slice of lemon and a little plastic container of butter on the side. Great flavor, but not very big. More of snack than a meal.

Good quick lunch.
Tasted good,had the cajun and cajun fries.
Roll was on the small side.

Wow...What a disappointment . Entering the casino you will see large billboards advertising lobster rolls filled to the brim with lobster. In reality, what you get is folded bread around a small amount of lobster. We ordered two of these sandwiches, one of which we made into a 'combo'. So for 4 dollars extra they gave you very small amount of french fries.  We paid $ 40 +  and left hungry.  Way over priced. Never again!!!!!

If you're a fan of lobster, you're gonna love this place. Must try the lobsicle (lobster tail on a stick) and the chowder fries. The rolls are a about $17, a bit pricier than most rolls, but nonetheless delicious and well-worth it!

I was there this past weekend and I didn't know what to order but this Asian blonde girl helped me out. She was super sweet and very energetic. It was a little busy but she worked well with me and didn't rush me when I didn't know what to get. She recommended me the New England Lobster Roll (delicious) Most food workers usually rush me especially when I eat on the strip when there's a high volume of customers. I could actually enjoy the food because of the service I was given. The price was a little high but worth it. Definitely would recommend to others and hopefully that cashier is there to assist others as well. People make the work place.

Every time my friends and I see this place we have to stop and get something even if we had it earlier.   It is that good, if you are a seafood lover.    

It's all about their Maine roll with a toasted bun, YUM!!! 

I wasn't really into lobster until this place.   Hands down, a must in Vegas!

After a swim and some sun, it's time for some lobster! Lobster roll, lobster Mac cheese and lobster grilled cheese sandwich. The lobster tasted fresh and meaty, but the grilled cheese came out burned on one side, leaving a very bitter taste. Mac and cheese was meh, a bit too dry for me since I like more sauce on my pastas. Overall, not worth the money.

Check in and upgrade to a fry combo for free ($4 savings). I had the Cajun lobster roll and it was delicious!!! Great seasoning and the roll was just right. Plenty of lobster. Fries were good as well.

The Maine lobster roll is a long time favorite of ours You can add a side of fries or Mac n Cheese for an extra dollar or two. What can I say, I'm addicted to Lobster.  They make a awesome Bloody Mary here, as well.
I should have read the reviews first, so I can't be mad. Small portions, expensive, crap service and watered down drinks. That's it in a nut

This will be the smallest most expensive sandwich you'll ever buy.

I ordered the Maine Style Lobster "roll": for $18 this is a small hot dog bun, sliced at the top, and filled with lobster:mayo mix that is quite tasty. You get a tiny cup of coleslaw and about 10 homemade potato chips with the sandwich (I'm not kidding, check photo I posted).

It all tasted good though. Real good.

I was in the mood for some seafood, lobster so I decided on this spot.  I ordered the Maine Lobster roll which comes with waffle fries, pickles & Cole slaw for $24.  Not bad.  The order taker Carolina was nice, friendly.  I also ordered a tequila sunset cocktail which came first = delicious, refreshing.  Gonna order another one.  Then the food came. The roll was good, still nothing tops the one I had in Boston.  The pickles and coke slaw and fries were all good too.  $34.64 for all of that for 1 person....hmmmm.  Not a budget eater's restaurant.  The spot was clean, good music, digital menu.

Came in for lunch and was disappointed. I got the 50/50 lobster/crab roll and the seafood tasted pretty good and fresh, but the roll was about 85% roll. The roll itself was a little over toasted, over buttered, and over seasoned and tended to overpower the seafood. Lobster was not very well deveined since i pulled out a poop tube from my roll. Waffle fries were tasty and incredibly hot when they arrived. Coleslaw was bland/lackluster and tasted just of mayo mixed with water. Pickle was boring. If there was a more reasonable filling/roll ratio (ie more filling), I'd try again, but now I'm wondering what to get as an after lunch snack after spending $24 after tip.

Hi!

My husband and I visited Las Vegas for the first time as attendees for The GameStop Convention. Since both my husband and I were craving seafood, we happen to come across LobsterMe. Being that it was our first time visiting, I have to say that Ms. Rosa made us feel very comfortable by sharing with us the specifics of the items on the menu. Even though there were a couple guests behind us, we have to admit it we loved her patience and caring attitude about our interest. 

How amazing to see a colleague of hers, Ms. Susan, who greeted us with a smile and immediately assisted the guests behind us.

When we sat at our table, within minutes a lovely lady, Ms. Carolina carefully rushed to our table to make sure it was clean and offered us beverages. How accommodating of her to acknowledge our presence during a busy day. Thankfully she was the one that brought the food to our table and again was attentive to our needs. 

Ladies, what a true example of extraordinary customer service. We will definitely come back to try the other items on your menu. Thank you!

Got the lobster roll.  Was really good but a little skimpy on the meat.  Fries really good.  Would come again seeing how we are locals.  Not as good as Maine Lobster Roll but not bad.  LOCALS GET 20% OFF. YOU HAVE TO ASK FOR IT.

Visiting Vegas from AZ & we went here on the last day for a quick dinner.  Oh my god!  If I had gone there earlier I would have ate every meal there.  I see others thought it was over priced but I thought it was perfect.  I had the traditional roll with mayo & it was packed with lobster.  The roll isn't huge, but that's fine, because the lobster is what you want, not bread.  $22 for lobster roll & a water.  Try getting that much lobster anywhere else on the strip.  You'd pay 5x that much.  Please open one of these in AZ!
Original lobster on a stick-delicious. Fresh and flavorful with a dip of oil. Tastes better than the lobster I have had in Boston, although it's small.

Have been waiting years to come here and it was not quite the perfection I had imagined.  Lobster roll was decent.  The bun was great and grilled on both sides.  The lobster meat was big and chunky but lacked flavor and seasoning.  There also was not enough butter so it basically was plain lobster on bread.  Too dry especially combined with fries.  We also shared the crab meat fries. That was a tasty combo with real bacon and a creamy sauce on top.  A little too much sauce for my liking though.  My expectations were too high but I would still eat here if no other lobster roll options.  I've had better lobster rolls from food trucks.

Fantastic and worth the price. Walked for about an hour to get to the seafood shack and was horribly disappointed. Came over here and got our food within 5 minutes and it's delicious. This place is awesome!

Food is always great! Service is great as well. They always make sure everything is what you expect. The lobster taste fresh and the chowder fries are just too good not to try! I stay and play in Venetian just because Lobster Me is here!

Two contextual pieces of info are critical: everything in Vegas is more expensive than it feels like it should be, and lobster is usually expensive anywhere. That aside, we ordered the Old Bay lobster roll and it was really, really good. Just as you might think, it tasted like a deconstructed crab cake (made with lobster). The chunks of lobster were a good size. The bread isn't a bun as you may think, but rather (very, very) buttered toast. 

It came with a couple forkfuls of coleslaw, which like the roll itself, didn't contain an excess of mayo (win!). We did wish the coleslaw were a bigger portion, as it complemented the lobster roll flavors nicely. It also came with very crispy housemade chips. 

Service was fast, food was good and the menu was clear: the rolls were all the same prices (no having to pick one over the other because of pricing differences) and the menu was easy to understand. We would come back.

Full disclosure I was born and raised in New England so my standard for lobster in general is pretty high. Ordered the lobster roll (Cajun style) and a side of fries. Pretty expensive lunch (about 23$) which in some cases I am okay with. However the portion and quality of lobster are just okay. Smaller watery chunks of meat and Cajun style means they just sprinkle Cajun spices on top. Fries and chips are both very well done though for what it's worth. Not extremely mad I made this my first lunch in Vegas, just not sure I would repeat it.

Was curious to try this place after having seen a friend post pictures of it on a couple of her visits to Vegas.  Finally got to try it and must say it was disappointing.  Perhaps it's this location.  I only recall having seen it in the Miracle Mile shops near Planet Hollywood, but now there's one in the Canal Shops at Venetian as well.

Was just looking for a quick snack in between lunch and late dinner, so shared the Connecticut lobster roll and added clam chowder soup.  The lobster roll tasted alright, but not really worth the $17 you pay for it.  At that price, it should come with fries included.  The clam chowder soup was pretty horrible.  It was really watered down and I think there was maybe one piece of clam in the entire bowl.  Definitely not impressive and probably won't be back again.

I recently stayed at the Palazzo and the Grand Canal Shops food court was my life saver during that weekend. Both the Venetian and Palazzo have big signs advertising the lobster roll so after seeing all the posters, I had to have one! I ordered the Connecticut style roll for $17 and made it a combo for an extra $4. I'm not sure if there was actually a pound of lobster meat in it but it was decent. The fries are pretty good but I was expecting a larger portion. The roll is overpriced for how it tastes because it's pretty bland. However, I was starving and it satisfied my craving. In retrospect, was the meal worth $23? Absolutely not.

Probably won't come back here based on how bland the roll is and how much it costs!

This is probably my favorite place to grab a bite to eat in Las Vegas. Not only in the food amazing ( I mean it is all lobster and crab so duh), the service is quick and pleasant. Jeff, the GM, always goes out of his way to greet us by name whenever we stop by. Will be returning for the signature lobster roll and the amazing craft beer selection (only $6! What!). A must try when you are in Vegas.
Solid 2 stars for me. Pretty mediocre. The lobster quality isn't great and the mac and cheese is made with fake velveeta-ish cheese. Wouldn't recommend it.

If you're looking for something fast and fulfilling, this place will do the trick. The food comes out fairly fast and fresh. We had ordered the lobster roll combo with a side of lobster mac. I love sriracha so we put that on my Mac n cheese, it was great! Eat it with the house made chips and it's a mouthgasm.

To say I'm disappointed might be an understatement. Being from the east coast and having quite the affinity for shellfish when I heard and saw pics about this place I was excited. Who wouldn't want a XL lobster roll called "El Diablo" that's warmed with spicy sauce? Or a lobster roll with Vietnamese ginger sauce on it? Sounds good right? Well being a local that doesn't work on the strip I make it a mission to avoid it at all costs, unless the occasionally family member visits and we do the tourist thing. 

So after about 20 minutes, the time it takes to get into the Venetian parking garage and walk to the spot I glanced up and saw a sign by the queue, it read 1 pound of lobster meat in every roll. Score! A pound doesn't seem like a lot but when it's lobster meat as my boy el guapo would say it is quite the plethora. Then came the oh crap moment, I glanced up and the lobster I wanted to try wasn't available. I wanted a "El Diablo" and to my dismay they had no XL sizes available on any of their rolls.  But the pictures from fellow yelpers look oh so good and filling!

My wife held me as I choked back my tears and ordered a CT roll. When I tell you this thing was small I mean it was small! Not what I expected based on their advertising and pictures from fellow yelpers. No where near a pound of meat in this, I attached a picture to show how tiny this was compared to a plastic fork. I scarfed it down in about 5 minutes and had to order the grilled cheese because I was not satisfied. So not only did they not have the type of roll I wanted but they also skimped me on the lobster meat!! Maybe it's a different size with the locals 20% discount? Or perhaps they are trying to cut corners by getting rid of their XL size and different flavors.  

On a good note the little I did get tasted awesome! The staff was super friendly and helpful and thank god for the 20% discount otherwise it would have killed us based on my second meal. IMO it's not worth it. So when you come here don't expect to get full and check out my pics compared to old pics and their advertising. I was legitimately disappointed :-(

I had the crab fries and it was a great portion and very filling.  I was really impressed as these types of chains have not come to Canada yet (at least that I am aware of).  Food was cooked to order - my fries were nice and crisp and not soggy at all.  The lobster sauce was to die for.  For sure a great treat if you are looking to fill up!

One of the less expensive dining options at the Venetian. Small portions of seafood are served on bread or fries. Tasty but very salty. Very overpriced. It wasn't terrible though. The Bloody Mary was 4 and was served in a small plastic cup with tons of crushed ice. It was VERY strong, so I enjoyed it more as the ice melted. I'm all about delicious Bloody Mary's and this was not my favorite. In my opinion, there are better places to eat and drink on the strip.
Jeff, the general manager is super cool and the food is amazing.  We are foodies and business people.  This guy / place knows how to create repeat business and loyalty.

Well, I can check this off my list!! Great experience, loved the Lobster roll - Maine/Cajun-Style!! My wife had this on our list of stops while in Vegas this weekend and it was amazing!! Drinks were kickin too!! Loved it, killed it!! Thank you Liza!! You Rock!!

Took home a lobster roll and clam chowder...lobster roll was full of lobster and seasoned perfectly ( it's all lobster and small amount of mayo- the perfect way to have a lobster roll) it's a little pricey ($19 for lobster roll) but you pretty much get a whole lobster on that roll so it's worth it. The bread was also good, not too buttery, a little sweet, and not too thick.  

The clam chowder was very good, almost as good as SAN FRAN WHARF (says a lot).  Not sure why all the semi-ok reviews I LOVE SEAFOOD and am very picky/ almost snobby about my seafood and this place was actually pretty good!  

Give it a try!

I ordered a surf & turf with no onions & told the Mgr and the cashier I could NOT eat onions or I get sick . Well halfway into the sandwich I bite into an onion and see 4 pretty good pieces of onion in my sandwich . I take it back to counter and the mgr acts mad at me for the onions . I don't want a new one since I feel sick from eating the onions so he says he will take off my sandwich . Not only did he NOT refund me my sandwich but he charged me for another beverage . Not going back there again .

I'm a big foodie and when I go to Vegas, I search out good restaurants and this happened to be one of my favorite meals of the trip! I had the classic lobster roll and my daughter had the the lobsicle and both were fantastic!! Like some of the other viewers stated a little spendy and I certainly could have eaten more so the portions are not big but the quality is there!! I would recommend this place and I would go back!!

Save your money and go to a different place. The register girl (I'm talking to you miss Asian with the fake, long blonde hair and fake lashes without a name tag to reference who was seen arguing with her manager) was rude and didn't bother to explain despite my questions regarding the items. She then didn't give me a number so my food wasn't delivered until I noticed 5 other people behind me had already received their food and I was still waiting. It's way overpriced and the quality of the lobster roll is mediocre. I had the traditional and it was barely lukewarm when it should have been served warm--as they indicate on their menu. You also get scraps of lobster instead of lobster chunks. BTW, I've had my fair share of Cousin's Maine lobster trucks and those are so much better and cheaper than LobsterMe. Pass if you can.
Great lobster rolls and the clam chowder is awesome.  It's a very casual place that offers big tables to share, picnic style so you meet people you don't know
This place was not too bad.  This place is decent when you are busy running around and need food.  Overpriced and decent tasting but not the best.

The food was very good and the staff provided friendly service. However, this is still a food court, fast food-esque spot, and the prices were just too much. My boyfriend and myself each ordered the connecticut roll and lobsicle and were happy with it; I just wasn't happy with the price for the amount of food that is served.

This was my first time at Lobster Me. To start my experience, I was greeted right away by cashier. The young lady went through the menu with me as therw was so many interesting choices. When I finally decided to the lobster trio. The flovors of the tacos were amazing. They are so different it would be hard to pick a favorite. There was a shrimp, fish, and lobster taco. It was a great price for what you got. The food arrived very fast. While eating the manager actually was walking around conversating checking on everyone.  Overall my experience was wonderful. I would highly recommend it!

I tried the lobster tacos and chowder fries and the tacos were one of the best I've ever had! They definitely did not skimp on the lobster! But I guess for the price they charge, they better not! I agree with the reviews that say their prices are a bit steep but the lobster tasted really fresh and not rubbery and the flavors were amazing! As for the chowder fries, it's more of a loaded fries with bacon, cheese, green onions, etc than a chowder on top but it was still good. I would recommend this place if you want something quick and delicious and have money to blow!
Pricey- but delicious. The lobster bisque was ok. Portions were small. The lobster roll was good but again portions were small. expensive for food court type atmosphere and food.
Rolls are great perfect amount of meat. the toast is perfect. Service is friendly and fast. Love coming here. Great staff

Coming from the East Coast, I generally don't eat Seafood when there is no ocean around. That being said, the portions are def more expensive than what they would be back home, but the lobster was good and seasoned well. The bisque was very plain. This time around I had the lobsicle and bisque. Next time, I will go for a lobster roll.

The Beltway roll and lobster bisque were delicious. I would definitely get them both again.

The lemonades were a disappointment. There is a sign that says they're freshly made, but the lemonade definitely tasted like a powder mix. I tried both the regular lemonade and the blueberry lemonade. They both taste stupid. Some of the worst lemonade I have ever had.  Hence, they lost a star from me.

Stick with their specialty.... the lobster rolls, and you should be satisfied. 

And as far as the price, I think they are pretty average for a lobster roll so I'm not sure what everyone is complaining about.

so not sure if its because i was hungry but this place was really good. what took it from 4.4 to 4.5 was the service. service was fantastic and they were slammed due to the convention in town.

lobster roll is second best i had. very fair portion. fries were fantastic too. not sure if they were hand cut. actually i dont think they were but still great. lobster mac and cheese was fine.

very pricey though FYI

jeans: OK by far
ORDER: at counter

I've gone here everyday while out in Vegas. Food is fast and service is courteous.  I saw a billboard ad for this place and could only hope the pictures of the lobster mac and cheese was as appealing on the advert. It lived to it's expectations on all accounts.  This is not your college staple mac and cheese!  There's lobster complementing it and it's delicious noodles in a cheddar sauce.  I can't imagine life before eating here, maybe everything was dark, drab and tasteless. The lobster rolls definitely hit the spot.  I tried the lobster tacos today and I'd like to think I have a new favorite here.  The fresh lobster and cabbage slaw on the corn tortillas are heavenly. I cannot recommend this place enough. Pricing is the norm for a casual fast food eatery on the Strip.  I wouldn't  call it cheap by any means, but value for dollar, it's a good eat here!
Wow excellent Mac n cheese. Wobbly tables tho. Definately coming again. Yelp is bothering me to continue to write. I'd rather eat

Walking through the Venetian you stumble upon this place in a food court.  It was a bit of a surprise to me.  Food court of the rich & famous!  I only wish they had a Mickydees there too so I could complain about having lobster in my teeth next to a dollar menu-nair..  Never would have though that something so pricey would compete for space in such an absurd location?

So yeah the lobster rolls are 17 bucks.  They essentially are a small 1lb lobster crammed into a single piece of Texas toast folded in half.  Your options are Maine style(cold) Connecticut (warm with butter & lemon) or spicy/Cajun versions of the two.  

What did I choose?  That's a no brainer.  Connecticut style of course.  There's just not a lot of meat on a 1lb lobster so it disappeared before I could remember to take a pic for you guys.  Oh man was it good!  The bread was toasty & soft.  The lobster was warm & buttery.  For being so small it was mighty dee-lish.  That's what she said.  No really, I split it with my girl & she did say that.  3.5/5 only because of the size.  You could double the lobsty for another 10$, but I would have to score it lower due to the price raising to 27$.

To offset the little L-Roll.  We also got the Lobster & Chips for 13$.  Chunks of tail battered and fried.  There was a decent amount in there.  Now the "chips" basically fries.  These were crispy and great.  Greasy as all Hell though.  For the value and novelty I'd say 4/5 solid

Service was satisfactory and generally nice for food court standards.

Price doesn't scare me, if I have a hankering.   I'll be back.

This is a nice place to stop for a quick bite to eat. I would never have expected to get such a good tasting lobster roll in such a short amount of time. I had the Beltway with the house made chips and coleslaw. The downside is that the sandwich is small and pricey.

This location is much much busier than the location inside the Miracle Mile shops.  I love Lobster ME but I felt like there was slightly a lacking in the flavor profile compared to the other location. Ordered Cajun lobster rolls and lobster Mac and cheese.  Lobster Mac was good but the rolls needed a little more Cajun seasoning.  Be prepared to awkwardly wait for a long time to get the orders. It gets pretty congested since there isn't much space to stand and wait for the order.

It's a little fast food lobster place that is in the Venetian Casino.  It's good but I think the put a bit too much butter.  That's my preference though.  I'm sure others think is just fine. Good price for lobster though.

I really enjoyed the Connecticut lobster roll with fries and a drink. Service was fast, friendly and helpful. Total was $22.40 for the combo which was a bit steep in my opinion. 

I am from CT and it's hard to find CT style lobster rolls. This one didn't disappoint. I just wish it was bigger like the footlongs in CT. The fries were hot and very tasty and were a food compliment to the roll. I will definitely eat there again.

We had the lobsicles and were disappointed as they did not have much flavor.  Granted we are from Maine and are used to fresh seafood right from the boat.  We were hoping for a more flavorful experience.  Would not try again.

Do: 
- get a lobster roll. My friend had the Connecticut, and I had the Cajun with warm lobster. We both really enjoyed them, but beware... like other things at times, it's not as big as you thought it would be. I would say it was a 6-inch piece of Texas toast slit open and stuffed with lobster meat?
- get the fries AND drink combo. Fries are the same price with or without the drink, $3.

Don't:
- get the lobster mac and cheese. We ordered this a different day, and it's not tasty. The shells were overcooked, and the cheese sauce doesn't taste very real... it does the lobster part a disservice. Two of us shared it, and we didn't want to finish it.
- eat the coleslaw. Bleh. Go get fat on something else.

This place doesn't get 4 stars because the lobster had the taste that it was on the downhill and starting to turn. While we all know that it's frozen and defrosted, I don't think it was defrosted properly or used as quickly as needed since it starts to take on just the slightest bit of funk.

The lobster sandwich was the best sandwich I have ever had really good not to mention the lobster Mac and cheese was really delicious I will definitely come here again it was tasty a bit pricey 54 for a lobster roll and Mac and cheese but had another place same price for lunch and much rather have that

Oh wow, I should have eaten here a long time ago, it's that good!

This lobster joint is located in the Venetian food court. 

So if you've read any of my other reviews, you'll know that I'm a sampler; I like to sample many different items bcs tons of things sound so good to eat and I can't really make up my mind.  With that being said, I ordered the lobster roll (which comes with waffle fries, coleslaw and a pickle.  The lobster mac and cheese, clam chowder, lobster bisque (that one was for my sister) and a pineapple juice that they make in-house. 

They jammed pack that sucker with lots of nice pieces of lobster, and filled the box with lots of fries.  No cheap-o's here!  I also liked how they include the fries and coleslaw and I don't have to pay extra for it.  Then the mac... divine!  I don't like heavy cheeses and their cheese sauce is just nice, smooth and mild; perfect for me!  Again with lots of nice pieces of lobster!  The chowder however was a little disappointing, there was just too much potatoes... the clams were chopped really fine and I think I got 1 - 1/4 of a clam.  I had to savor that little sucker (no pun intended).  The oyster crackers were really good though.  
My picky sister actually enjoyed her bisque so that was cool.  And finally, the pineapple drink was quite refreshing.  

It took me 2 days to finish half of the meal (I had given the other half to my sis), there was that much food and I have a tiny stomach.  

Then for the bonus, employees of the Venetian receives 20% off!  Ding ding, now enters my mom!! Score!  Heehee

We love lobster. It is a little over cooked here. I really like my tiny lobster roll but it's really expensive here. We ordered the fish and chips, lobstersicle, and a Maine lobster roll. Hubby loved the fish, shrimp, and fries. But the lobstersicle was chewy and over cooked. For the $50 we paid it should melt in your mouth.
Line long but that was a good thing. Sitting terrible but hot tip go next door and sit at the bar. You must order a drink. Lobster roll Connecticut was outstanding. Would recommend for sure.

I am down to about one animal meal a week so I decided to "treat" myself to Lobster ME while I was at the Venetian. Wow, the line at lunch was crazy. It took 15 minutes to get my order and then there was no place to sit. It was very loud and the employees had to yell out your name. Maybe a microphone would be a good investment. I know it is located at a high end casino but ouch for 2 tacos for $17. The taste and consistency of the tacos were good and flavorful. The thing that creeped me out what that the taco was made mostly of lobster claws. I would have been satisfied with other parts of the lobster in my meal. Biting into a big lobster claw was a bit weird for me. Service was average you could see that they were feeling the heat of the lunch crowd. A friend asked me today how my experience was and I couldn't really give her a strong reason to go--

Tried it for the 1st time today and gotta say we enjoyed it.  Portions are kind of on the small size hence the 4 stars.  Luckily we were only looking for a snack and not a meal so the Connecticut lobster roll was able to hit the spot.  The bun roll was pipping hot and grilled to perfection.  The lobster meat was sweat and the butter really added to the overall taste of the roll.  We also ordered the chowder fries but that was a bit too salty for our taste.  Overall, a good place to get a snack especially if you are craving for lobster.

I had a very dissatisfied experience from lobster me at the Venetian Las Vegas. I spent close to $60 worth of take away food.
I ordered 2 lobster salads that had hardly and lobster in it and all green leaves. No dressing, and hardly any items to even call it a salad. Each cost $14 which I believe is a rip off to have received what I did. I have been there before so I had asked the staff before placing my order to put extra lobster and still nothing. 
We also ordered 2 lobster Mac and cheese that also had hardly any lobster in it, very disappointed.
If your hungry I wouldn't recommend going to Lobster Me.
Defiantly not waisting my money there again.
Get the chowder fries and get the warm lobster tastes better than the cold in my opinion. Pricey but hey I'm on vacation!

Lobster ME is one of the better options in this food court. The quality, price, and size of the lobster roll were about the same as the Cousins Maine Lobster food truck. Everything tasted fresh, and I felt like I was eating less salt than I would have at Panda or Chipotle. Would go back.

i love lobster me so i decided to get a lobster roll. i got the conneticut which was supposed to have butter. it was the size of a quarter and very dry. i payed $19 for this? came with a tiny amount of coleslaw which was tasteless. the chips were good. very upsetting.

As someone from New England, I know good lobster and this misses the mark. $20 for a tiny lobster roll with no sides is ridiculous, and it's not very fresh or seasoned well at all. Also very rude service. Not worth the money, don't go here, there are several better food places in Venetian!!

It's alright. 
Ordered the Lobster roll maine style ($17) add $6 for chowder fries and drink .

Lobsters cold, bun is warm. 
For the size and price I should of just went to a buffet.
Chower fries could use more chowder. It was pretty good.

I highly doubt I'm going to eat it again.

I decided to stop by again but this time with my mother for her birthday week since we were in Vegas.
This time I got a mago juice, crab  cake sliders, and a lobster roll.
My mom loved it which is good! She also said the portions are perfect to get full but not overstuffed. I did feel like the lobster roll was filled properly with enough lobster unlike last time. I also saw other customers with a perfect ratio of bread and lobster. 

The mango juice was delicious and I liked the crab cake sliders best. Next time I will try the lobster roll Cajun style. 

Update: so my mom is still talking to me about how much she loved my lobster roll much more than her crab sliders. Haha  for next time I know.

Enjoyed the diablo lobster roll and the clam chowder fries! We also ordered the Connecticut roll but it was mediocre. The staff was really friendly. It's a good place to come if want to go to a casual place and you're craving lobster rolls.
Lobsicle and lobster Mac n cheese is quick, easy and delicious! The lobster Mac n cheese though.. Is really really good!
#nom  $14 for a lobster roll and $19 for a lobstertail on a stick. A little spendy but it is Vegas. One of the better meals I had during my trip. Will gladly eat at again on my next visit. So good.

So good.  A little expensive for the food court, but seriously the best lobster sandwich I've ever had.  People rave about the Lobsicle as well but it was really late when we got there and they were all out.  I would say you must try it if you are in the Venetian.

The star of the show at this counter-service seafood place -- which is a completely mind-blowing concept to this Midwesterner -- is the LOBSTER ROLL.  The lobster grilled cheese is also good.  And so is the lobster mac-n-cheese.  

While lobster is not my favorite type of seafood, it's pretty darn good in roll form.

Lobster Me totally rocks.
The food is fantastic. They sure are not cheap with the lobster.
We had the Cajun Lobster roll, it had the right amount of spice, but too much to over power the great tasting lobster. They say it's over 1 pound of lobster per roll. It was fantastic.
Just as good were the sliders, great taste packed between great bread.
We also tried there signature LOBSICLE, it was a whole lobster tail on a stick, with a light batter, cooked to perfection.
The lobster tacos were good, it had great flavor.
Top it off with lobster Mary ,there version of a Bloody Mary with lobster.
I wish they open a location close to my house.
I can't wait to eat there great food again.
Lobster is not cheap but there prices are not that bad.
Treat yourself. Treat yourself. Treat yourself. Yaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaas
Horrible service, partial order was 45 min late, general manager or the staff were very unprofessional, got the order wrong for THREE times. Did not even apologize . Will NEVER BE BACK.

Let me start by saying the roll is good. Bummer is that it used to be great. I've gone to this place a couple times a year for the last few years and I've always thought, until now, that it was pretty amazing. This last time... not so much. There was still a good amount of meat and the fries were pretty tasty, but my favorite part of the roll used to be the butter sauce... and this time it tasted like nothing. 
Combine that with the ridiculously high price (over $20 after tax) of that roll and you get... a seriously overpriced but decent lobster sandwich.
If you have money to burn, it's ok, but if you don't, try something else.

A new star at Venetian, and at a food court nonetheless! They had a 2/1 offering on today only, mentioning "off the hook" so I went. Small eating area which was crammed with people so I took my order to go.
Pricey but worth it for the ultra-clean taste. Lots of peeps due to promotion so short line. I enjoyed the Connecticut sandwich, their standard  sammich. It comes with a side of cabbage with just enough mayo to hold it. 
The bread is cut from the top and grilled with the grilling on the outside. Easy mayo holds the lobster together and you taste Lobster and more Lobster. Very clean flavors. Squeeze a bit of lemon and you've got it. 
Can't wait to go back!
$23 traditional New England Maine lobster roll - lobster didn't come with mayo, very dry.  Not a good lobster roll.

My boys saw the poster for their lobster mac and cheese and after going around in circles for an hour or so we finally found it.  we ordered two lobster mac and cheese and a Maine lobster roll.  The poor girl at the register had to tell us that they were out of the lobster mac and cheese after already taking our order. Then we changed it to one hot dog then paid, only to find out they were out of hot dogs too. The girl was embarrassed - and I can tell frustrated - that most of the things we ordered were not available.  So I just told her to get me an extra order of the lobster me fries, which she said she would give to us for free since they were out of everything that we wanted to order.  

The Maine lobster roll was pretty good. I still would have loved to try the lobster mac and cheese. So only 3 stars cause they were out of everything, otherwise it might have been 5 stars.

So the lobsters on sticks were very tasty (we tried the fried and the grilled) and people there will us were really enjoying their lobster rolls. Also they had this delicious apple cider which I tried and thoroughly enjoyed. Next time though, I think I'll opt out of the regular fries for more protein as they were kind of dry but just my opinion because Hubby loved them.

Mall lobster at Planet Hollywood. Its pricey bit every damn thing in Las Vegas costs a butt-load of money. But the lobster rolls with a soup and drink combo is delicious. I like the clam chowder and fresh squeezed lemonade along with the melted butter lobster roll. Hits the spot every time.

Compared to all the other food court options, this place stands above the rest.  Price is just slightly more than the steak and shake burger combo, or the Nathan's hotdog combo, but....it's lobster!!!!
    I had an awesome lobster roll, the fries were great too.  Fresh squeezed lemonade, it was a great meal.

Great concept! I tried the Connecticut, and was not impressed. Every other flavor that my friends ordered, and unfortunately I only got one bite of the Cajun, Beltway, and the Miso sesame. Dangggggg. I missed out. The regular and the Connecticut are so so. But the rest are great for lobster lovers. The fries are top notch. Chowder fries, whoa.

We had the fish and chips for $12. Overall food taste and quality was very average, and the portion size was small. For the price, only three small pieces of fish and a side of fries were not worth it.

SOOOOOO GOOD!!!!!!!!!!!! 4 and a half stars all day long!!!! The only thing holding this place back is its limited size and seating. It is kind on in a food court area at the Venetian/Palazzo and there is not a lot of places to sit.

The classic Maine Lobster Roll was fantastic. I had the combo which was $21, but came with fries, coleslaw, a pound of lobster in the role, and a drink. Tasted great and was worth the price. Oh, and the fries were well above average.

My wife had the lobster tacos and they must have been great because they were gone before I could even ask to try a bite.  

It was something different, a little pricy but I feel it was worth it.

I really don't know why the Venetian hides their food court so far in the depths of the place that you almost give up looking for it. I've stayed in the Palazzo several time and even when you ask somebody who works there, you get wrong directions. I say all this to preface this message: DON'T GIVE UP LOOKING FOR THIS PLACE. It's totally worth wandering around for an hour trying to find it.  

Both my friend and I had the (Yelp checkin) special which is a lobster roll and a cup of clam chowder. Are they like what I grew up eating on the Cape every summer? No, but they definitely scratch that itch and for a pretty reasonable price, IMHO. It is Vegas after all and there's a ton of lobster in that wonderfully toasted bun.  Yum.

The best ever, well honestly I ate it so fast I don't remember. I wasn't drunk or staving... it was jus that good!

They are not shy with the lobster either! Get sum!
Best people, best lobster, and best TACOS!!! I love eating here every chance I get. Also need to try the beltway lobster roll with chowder fries and lemonade. Very worth it!
The Lobster roll is fantastic. The bread was perfect, and a very fair amount of lobster. The style with avocado and tomato was a winner.

Holy shit! LOL!!! This is the first time, in my life, that I have ever spent that much money in a food court! LOL!!! It was some of the best lobster I have ever tasted. We got two different lobster rolls, lobster mac n cheese and the lobsicle. The Lobsicle was, hands down, the best thing! All of it was fantastic....but the lobsicle was quite the treat!

OK, we all know everyone mac and cheese isnt good. Not only is theirs good the lobster was off the chain. Too bad i had to throw  away my leftovers bc this expensive hotel didnt have a fridge.  Well not that they didn't have one it's if you wanted to use it you had to pay for all the things inside it. Boy I tell ya Vegas has legal crooks. The Venetian Hotel is one of them

This location is conveniently located inside the Venetian. The concept of the place where it serves real lobster in most of their dishes is really awesome. I personally love lobster so I was excited to give this place a try. 

I went with my brother and mom and we all love lobster. We loved how they had a good variety of different rolls to choose from and other kinds of lobster dishes. We ending up each getting a different roll and to say the least, they were all delicious! We got one original roll, the beltway, and we got one that was more Asian styled with nori on it, but the name escapes me. I recommend the chips over the fries if I had to choose, and the fries are more expensive, so why need to pay more? The chips were very crispy and is everything I look for in a chip. I can't say the same thing for the fries, they were average at best. The rolls are kind of pricy, but with something like this, it's a treat that you should experience once in a while. I don't have the money to indulge on this every week, but it definitely is worth the experience!
Had the Lobsicle... It's lobster on a stick, grilled or fried, can't get much better than that. Wife had a lobster roll. We loved it. Will eat here again!

Since I'm a lover for lobster rolls, I decided to come here for lunch.  My husband and I decided to split a combo.  The lobster roll was ok.  I didn't like that the meat was chopped in tiny pieces (reminds me of canned tuna).  I also didn't like how the slit of the bun was just barely half way through the bread.  It makes me feel like they're trying to save on lobster meat.  With each bite we made, the meat fell out of the bun.  The chowder fries were ok.  Nothing to rave about.  For over $20, I was pretty dissatisfied with the portions I was given.
Wonderful service, quick but excellent food.  Definitely get the crab add on to the fries.  If you are looking for a low key place this is it.  New England chowder was amazing.

The lobster here is amazing and taste fresh. We ordered the lobster Mac and cheese and it was delicious, it was slightly soupy but the flavors were still present. I am not sure why have received low reviews they clearly deliver quality food and suffer negative comments from being a walk up counter restaurant.
Awesome!!! Fast servise , the lobster tacos are jummy!!! Annisa the server is so sweet an kind!!
I had never had a Lobster Roll and man was it good.  I will definitely be back.  Prices were average considering its Vegas.

Stopped by again today, because it's so friggin awesome!
Being from Maine I know me fresh lobster and this place is the bomb!!!
Everything on the menu is great and service with a smile always!!
Prices very fair to get fresh lobster in Vegas!!
We'll be back again and again!!!

What a pleasant surprise! I was staying at the Venetian and had an awkward span of time before dinner and a massive appetite that needed to be quelled. I got the loaded fries and expected very little crab meat on them, but WOW- they were loaded in every sense of the word. It was a good deal, just a few dollars more than the regular fries, and well worth it for the big chunks of meat, bacon, and decadent lobster cheese sauce.

Well, I ate here 4 times in 3 days, so I can't in good conscience give anything but 5 stars. I got the Connecticut roll every time...soaked in butter and completely satisfying. Got the fries one night as well, which were fantastic. Stay out of SLC please.

This is a great place to eat if you don't want to go to another Las Vegas restaurant that is far too loud and crowded.  In the food court tucked around a corner.  I always go with the lobster roll with butter but this time around I added the crab fries.  Holy crab, they were amazing and a absolutely worth the $2 upcharge.  It still isn't cheap because nothing in Vegas is but it is quick.

Quick place for fast food! Bit pricy. Overall, food was ok. Service was quick and staff were friendly. I had me the Lobsicle and it was pretty small - cost $14 for lobster on the stick. I wouldn't get it again.

What a huge disappointment.  We split a lobster roll and got 'The Connecticut' with fries combo.  The fries were very good, for sure and the reason for what stars I did give them.  The lobster however was the most over cooked lobster I have ever eaten.  It was so rubbery that it was tough to pull apart.  The staff was very friendly and helpful, very nice and respectful even.  They get a star too!

Extremely tasty with a variety of lobster rolls. The lobster chowder was also very good. Huge chunks of lobster in the lobster mac and cheese too. 

The atmosphere is normal for a new England lobster shop. Very casual with the food being the draw. I had a co-worker who passed on this place because he expected a sit down restaurant with table service... this isn't that.

My hubby is obsessed with lobster and we wanted to introduce to my son , well for a kid at least he tried it.But they do have a kids menu which I loved . The lobster subs are delicious.  The have a rasberry lemonade which is very refreshing. They have lobster tacos . The service is very good.I am very happy to have found another place to eat. For the place and price it was worth it.

The Maine Lobster Roll was on point! Delish for a quick lunch option. The lobster melt was the best grilled cheese I've ever had and I recommend the blueberry lemonade with a little water in it to dilute. Try it!

I was so excited to eat here! I love seafood and thought this was a great addition! 

I had the lobster tacos and I was sooooo disappointed. The amount of lobster meat was pathetic. It is soooooooooooooo ridiculously overpriced! Like crazy over priced for the amount you get. The tortillas where on the stale side. 

I'd rather cough up more $$ and go to a nice restaurant where you pay for what you get for! Almost $20 for tacos and stale chips! No presentation just average! The sauce is drowning the tacos that doesn't make them good! It's the quality of Del Tacos Shrimp or Fish tacos 

So disappointed, unless they fix it I don't see this place lasting sadly

A little pricey but it is seafood! It's an affordable option if you just want a quick bite but still want lobster. I recommend the lobster mac and cheese! 
You probably have to order to go since the seating area is pretty small.

After trying both the Planet Hollywood location and this one in the Venetian Grand Canal shops I would definitely make more of an effort to come here. The Planet Hollywood location did not offer the lobster melt and when I ordered it here along with the Connecticut lobster roll it was easily my favorite food item.

The cheesy melt and the buttery lobster are pure indulgence, but coming in a close second is the Connecticut lobster roll. It may be a basic roll but you really can't go wrong with buttery lobster on a toasted roll. I had tried the lobster mac and cheese at the other location which was just ok compared to the roll and melt. However compared to the lobster mac and cheese my mom ordered here on her last trip to Vegas it appeared that the lobster to mac ratio was higher then what I got at the Planet Hollywood location. My husband also got us the Wicked Lemonade and Blueberry margarita which were so refreshing and tart with the warm, buttery food.

It may be pricey but I would easily come here on every Vegas trip, even if it is a bit of a walk from our hotel.
Don't waste your time or money.  Lobster had very little flavor and lobster roll and minimal amount. Of  meat in it

I wish they had a chain location In San Diego, I would probably gain 10 lbs just by going to it. I love this place. I love how it is conveniently located in the Venetian & it is perfectly hidden in a way. My husband & I got really drunk on our last vacation there and decided to get a late night snack and being from Southern California We usually get carne asada fries. & this meal we ordered was so much better. It was criss cut fries topped with this amazing creamy cheese sauce chives and crab meat! It was amazing. We should have ordered personals/ we decided to share. I would definitely go back here to get the same thing we ordered the next time we go back because it was just that good. & obviously going on vacation you don't have the ability to cook so you have to eat out which is the best part! So glad we stumbled upon this place.

Stopped in and grabbed a surf & turf philly yesterday.

First, let me say that I got it to go, and took it back to my hotel (which is not where they are located).  By the time I got to it, it was about an hour later.

The sandwich was awesome.  The pickles were awesome.  The waffle fries were ok.  I imagine they're much better when not an hour old.  The only thing I wasn't a real fan of was the coleslaw.

All in all I would definitely eat here again and recommend it.  Looking forward to trying other things at some point.

I'm not a big lobster fan but this place was awesome. We got a Connecticut roll and the lobsicle and I was in heaven. I wasn't very hungry so I was just taking a couple bites from my partner's but ten we ended up getting another Connecticut roll. So much lobster, so much butter, so much goodness on my tongue. I'm glad my partner got sucked in looking at all the lobsicle ads everywhere cause it was definitely worth walking around the Venetian for 45 mins.
Ordered the "lobsticle", which was listed alongside other entrees. Laughably small (one tail). What is this, food for ANTS? Gave 2 stars because the 3 bites were in fact good.

What a treat finding this spot inside the Venetian food court! We were wandering along the I door river checking out shops and needed to grab a quick bite before the show when we stumbled on Lobster Me! 

My friend had never even had a lobster roll, so it was our destiny this day. After checking out the menu, and other peoples plates of course, we decided to share both a lobster roll and the cheesy lobster crab waffle fries. The roll was super tasty, but the fries were really the star of the show for us. The fries came out absolutely covered in chunks of lobster and crab, this delicious cheese sauce and topped with lil bits of green onions. It was killah!! Absolutely indulgent and pretty much all I wanted to eat at that point. Don't get me wrong the lobster roll was great too, I'm just a freak for cheesy sauce and fries. 

Certainly worth popping in to check this place out for a quick bite!

I couldn't resist the lobster chowder on the menu. I got a cup. The checkout and delivery was fast. The chowder was good but not the best I have had. Seemed to milky to me. I prefer it to be a thicker chowder but that's just me.

Pricey but worth trying! Had the lobster tacos and wife had the warm Cajun roll and both were awesome! It's something to try and it's different then most eateries. Will be back to try more the next time I am back at Vegas.
It's pricey but hey it's Vegas everything is pricey. You get real lobster and awesome fries. Enjoy!

Came here for a midnight snack after a show. Due to the prices being fairly high - $26 for a combo of a lobster roll, soda and chowder fries, we thought that this would be a decent fast food place.

Our food took almost half an hour to come out. Two other parties were served before us. It wasn't until we went up to the counter that they told us that the fries were being made. So although we are sitting 5 feet away no one bothered to tell us.

Once we got the food it was ok...maybe I would give the food 3 stars. The chowder on the fries was ok and the fries themselves were the best part. The Cajun lobster roll was dry and the bread had no flavor.

It's a fast food place so I guess you can't expect too much. But the fact that we waited so long for our food left a sour taste.

Me and my wife wanted some seafood and decided to try out Lobster Me. 

We shared our meals and had the Lobster Roll, Lobster Grilled Cheese and Truffle fries. The Lobster grilled cheese was by far the best item. Perfect amount of cheese and lobster and the bread was toasted perfectly which let you hear that perfect crunch in each bite.

The only thing that prevented this from being a perfect rating was the service. The cashier who took our order seemed to have to be a little upset and had a slight attitude. Also, when I ordered a water, she asked if I wanted a bot or cold one. Who orders a hot water in the middle of the day during summer time when its 110 degrees outside? Other than this everything was great and I would recommend any Lobster love try this place outside.

Lobster me! After a 5 hour drive and being starving we were looking for something to eat!! I really love lobster rolls so I had to try this!!

I ordered the lobster salad, lobster roll, and chowder fries.
Eh, it was super yummy because I was starving, but it wasn't anything special. I rather walk across the street and get Luke's Lobster.

I wasn't really feelin it.

Plus the employees didnt look like they were doing anything and the girl gave me a snooty look.
Probably won't come back! And I don't recommend this to anyone

For a minute I had that.. "Oh did I just spend $25 on one sandwich meal" moment but once I got over that I was feeling pretty blissful. Casual, food court style dining located within the shopping area of the Grand Canal shops. You order up front, they give you a number, then deliver to your seat when the foods ready. I came here after seeing a show because I was hungry again. I'm like a hobbit, second dinner is always welcome in my mind. 

I ordered the lobster roll combo with fountain drink, coleslaw, & fries. I'm a petite person so honestly by the halfway point I was already full. I liked that they did not skimp on the lobster. Really tasty, ton of flavor, & left me happily full afterwards. Not even stinky...sometimes lobster can be hit or miss for me. I would order the same thing again but I'm also looking to try some of their other menu items next time. I don't eat seafood often since I prefer my veggies but when I get that occasional craving I'd definitely come back!

Great food! My wife and I decided to eat here, since the Yardbird was closed by the time we made it to the area. She was feeling "Hangry", and the Fish and Chips she ordered calmed her soul. Do I need to mention she loved the food, especially the fries? I mistakenly ordered the Lobster Mac and cheese, thinking it was a sandwich. The lady that brought us our food was more than willing to switch out the food that I actually wanted. Service was also fairly quick. In short, the Lobster sandwich and fries were great and satisfying. They even gave me a military discount, which is always a plus in a restaurant. So if you're in the mood for seafood and walking around in the Venetian, stop by here!
casual & quick.  the lobster salad was delicious & fresh.  I just wish the lettuce pieces weren't so big.

Love this place. I love that they give you the choice between rolls Maine style or Connecticut style. Personally, I love lobster rolls Connecticut style (warm + butter). The rolls are not crazy expensive and have a decent amount of meat. For a place in a food court these are pretty good. Not like having them in Maine with fresh lobster but this is a solid effort with reasonable prices without seafood that is sketchy.

Bad service. Bad food. A good lobster roll is hard to find & expensive. Which we lobster lovers know, & we will pay for a good lobster roll!  ..but add Vegas prices & you have yourself a waste of time here. The portion was extremely small. The taste was very average. You can pick up this mix of lobster at Whole Foods or similar. I was so disappointed smh. The service? The cashier was scrambling around looking so lost. Whew. It took forever to order! 

Avoid this at all cost. It's not worth the high dollar. If you just HAVE to try.....at least stop by when they're offering a special.

We had a wonderful lunch here yesterday. Started with the lobster Bloody Mary and it was excellent! We followed this up with two lobster rolls "Maine" style which were great and some battered fries which were awesome. The slaw that came with it was okay but not really needed. Also tried the lobster Mac and cheese which was the one weak point of the meal. The service was excellent and our cashier, drink maker, waiter Raul was terrific and made us feel like he really cared that we enjoyed the meal. So much better service than I ever expected at concept like this. We will return!

this is like a little chain.. fast food lobster roll place ;)... i thought it was pretty cool !

i love lobster rolls !

While in Vegas, my seafood craving kicked in again and I had to get me some seafood. Nothing heavy because I still had more places to see and more shopping to do. I decided to hunt for this place called " lobster me" which is located in the grand canal shoppes at the Venetian. It was kinda hard to find but finally stumbled on it. I decided to try the lobster roll which came with some homemade chips. For the meal and a bottled water, we paid $25!! Kinda pricey I thought to myself. But.... It was really good! I was kinda hesitant in case I get some fake crab meat that was just " called" lobster for $25 ,but it was real lobster. On top of that, it was nice big, sweet chunks. The way they mixed it with celery and mayo and whatever else they put in there, was just wonderful!

I wish I would have taken a picture of our food to show you how amazing it looked, but it tasted even better. You're in Vegas so everything is over priced, but we didn't think the prices were that bad! I got the shrimp tacos and my husband got the lobster bisque. We also got the lobster grilled cheese to share. Let's just say everything was so good we wished we had visited our first day because we would have went back everyday!! If you are a seafood lover, go here it will not disappoint! We always can't wait to go back to Vegas, but now we really want to go back to try other items on this menu.

Grilled Lobster Tail: 
- Flavor (4.5/5): The associate suggested grilled is the way too go and he was correct. The tail was cooked perfectly but it was pretty simple. It is served with a wedge of lime and some melted butter. 

-Pricing (1/5): The pricing is kind of outrageous for the amount you receive. We paid $15-16 for a tiny tail that was smaller than my hand. I feel they should give you a heads up. When we complained to them about the portion size, their response was they continually receive the same complaint.
Had a long wait for a small meal. The food didn't really seam like it was worth the price. It was an extremely small portion with basic flavor.

I stopped here for breakfast. I ordered the Connecticut lobster roll which cost $17. For it being a fast food restaurant, the lobster roll was better than I assumed it would be. The lobster meat is not as fresh as one you would eat at an upscale restaurant but neither is it not fresh. It was good enough to satisfy me. It had the perfect amount of butter and chives. It came with chips on the side and I enjoyed them. Usually, those kind of chips always taste very oily and flavorless but these were great. The price however does not match the quality of the food considering that at example The Optimist in Atlanta, Ga, the lobster roll goes for $18 & it's amazing or we can compare it to Cousin's Maine Lobster roll that costs $14.99 and it doesn't get more perfect than that... It's over priced but I understand that this is Las Vegas. Price aside, I was satisfied.

Honesty do not know what to rate this place! It was absolutely delicious lobster and absolutely expensive! $17 and $21 with fries and a drink. I shared the Connecticut lobster roll with French fries imagining a much larger roll but it was the tiniest of sandwiches. Not sharable but we made do since it was too late. The roll was delicious and left me wanting more! The bread itself soaked in the butter from the very juicy and fresh lobster. I will come back if I'm in a spending mood for lobster!

The Original Lobster Roll was pretty good, however it definitely didn't have enough lobster in the roll. For the price that I paid for it I expected there to be more lobster in it. And on top of that the roll only really had claw meat and not any lobster body meat in it. The price that I paid for it I expected a little more out of it.
Small but very tender tasty grilled lobster tail on a stick!! Served with melted butter and a simple lemon wedge ...purely delicious
It was great We had the Lobster Rolls Maine style, they were delicious.

Today, my family and I wanted to try this place for a while, my mom had been really excited. But once we got to our hotel suite, I noticed our subs were extremely small and small amount of chips. Looked like the sub roll was just sandwich bread. Good amount of lobster though. My mom whispered to me at the end, this is the worst dinner I've ever had.

While at CES 2016, I stopped by for a early brunch. Decided upon the Maine Lobster Roll with the clam chowder. The roll itself was decent with a good amount of lobster meat. The flavor of the lobster roll was pretty good but the bun itself felt a bit cold for my taste. The clam chowder wasn't really anything special, and the clams were a bit too chewy.

Overall, a decent experience but the above notes and the high price kept LobsterMe from getting a higher score.

Do not come here ! The rolls are dry not even buttered and have a bunch of unnecessary ingredients and sauces. If you want a halfway decent roll go to Luke's Lobster by fashion show mall they are cheaper and tastier.

Lobster Me's have been popping up throughout Vegas, and while it's not a dirt cheap quick service option like Earl of Sandwich, these rolls are filled with fucking lobster, man, so step up! I've paid up to $20 for a quality roll, and their Connecticut roll is right there with them. Fresh meat, good portion, didn't add the fries and didn't need to.

It wasn't terrible, but not great, especially for the price. My bread was not warm and toasty - it was actually a little soggy, and the meat was cold even though I ordered the Connecticut style roll. Waffle fries were good, but I wasn't trying to pay $24 for good fries.

Had to come get some before I drove back home. Ofcourse I got the Cajun lobster mac n cheese. They actually gave us alot of lobster but the spice wasn't there at all! :( However we did ask for the seasoning to add into our meal and that tasted wonderful. I love how creamy the cheese was and the meaty lobster.

Great grub. This is walk up joint in the Venetian Shops area. Great food but as expected Vegas prices. They are very proud of their food, but they have a reason to be. It is very good. I asked the guy if I had to get one thing he said the Lobster Tacos. I was surprised he did not say a roll since this is their premier item.

I went with his call and man, these things were great. What I would also compliment them on is that they don't skimp on the meat and it is not a bunch of nasty claw tip. It is the sweet meat. I devoured these and then went up to grab a roll. They were great as well, but If I had one regret, I would have gotten the Lobsicle. It looks like a lobster corn dog. Still wishing I had tried that. All in all I was very happy with this place. The staff was friendly and the food was great.

I got to Vegas really early in the day and barely any restaurants or food court was open before 10am. Decided to walk around the Venetian and see what we can find in there, and found a cute little lobster restaurant right across this italian restaurant.
Their menu was truly dedicated to lobster. Tacos, burritos, salad and even the famous Lobster Roll. The prices were very steep for most of the food choices but what do you expect? Vegas prices...
I opted for the lobster taco since they didnt have any fish that morning, which was fine. They were kind enough to hook it up with another lobster taco since the girl at the register had already charged my card for the total price of one lobster and fish taco but was later told by the cook in the back that their was no more fish. Kudos for being gracious enough to hook it up!
Got my two tacos that appeared pretty small looking, almost the size of a street taco or corn tortillas. but the portion of lobster and garnishes was an ok size just not enough...I pretty much wolfed both them down in four bites, thats how small these were and im not a big guy.
Overall, it was flavorful and tasty I just cant see myself to buy more at the prices they are asking. Ill definitely stop by again if im ever in the area, but it would only be a one time thing every visit to Sin City.

DIOS MIO LO ENORME DEL SANDWICH QUE ME COMÍ. Pedí el Lobster Roll "The Cajun" (que es langosta caliente con mayonesa de cajun y orégano) en un combo que vino con papas fritas y clam chowder (sopa cremosa de almejas con papas, panceta y apio). 

APENAS PUDE RESPIRAR. Se puede comer ahí (ya que lo llevan a la mesa) o take out. Yo pedí takeout porque estaba con un grupo de personas que comían otras cosas. 
La atención fue buenísima. De hecho se olvidaron de mis papas, fui a reclamarlas y me las dieron con trocitos de langosta como gratitud por olvidarse. 
Claramente merecieron la gran propina que les dejé. 
Muy limpio el lugar y muy organizado. Como todo restaurante gringo que tiene takeout o self service, te dan un control con un número que vibra al momento que tu pedido está listo (acá lo empezaron a usar hace poco, pero sumamente útil). 

Recomiendo todo!! 
Insisto: yo fui al de las vegas, no se cómo serán los otros locations.

If you enjoy seafood then Lobster ME should be the first place you go after getting off the plane, and the last place you visit before you leave. There's a good variety of crab- and lobster-themed menu items to choose from, so repeat visits are a must. 

The staff is very friendly. Jeff (the general manager) checked in everyone's orders and made sure everything was perfect. Which it was. 

Utterly delicious. 

(And they also have the "good ice" lol) 

Prices are reasonable--for Vegas--with most of the entrees+side costing $12-$18. Which is less expensive than Red Lobster and infinitely more tasty. 

Tl;dr: Food good. Eat much.
I had the crab fries, husband had the lobster mac n cheese balls. Food was very good. Service was terrible. Felt very unwelcome. It was around 2:00 on a Monday. Not at all busy or crowded.

One of the most expensive "fast food" meals, especially in Vegas.
But.... the lobster looks so good in the pictures!

Okay, reality is - the lobster is good, but you just don't expect to pay the $$ price for somewhere so casual. They don't really give you that much lobster either, but it is pretty tasty for the few bites you get out of it.

Connecticut style is the one I tasted and it was simple and good. Make it a combo to at least get some small bang for your bucks. Lobster bisque is decent and for drinks, you can try any of their different lemonades instead of a typical soft drink.

Not impressed- $17 for a "worlds best lobster roll" & it was seriously the size of a child's sandwich.  Also, it was overcooked.  Really??  They could do better I don't care how expensive lobster is!!  Go somewhere else and save your money.

If your up around the morning time and your wondering what to eat check out Lobster ME they open at 9 am! Came here around that time and it was my first time trying this place out. 

Ordered a lobster roll and some type of drink. The lady at the front was pretty polite and very nice. He food came out quickly and the lobster meat inside was pretty warm and tasty with the butter roll bread. 

I thought the amount of meat was enough and the size was pretty good. I wanted to eat something sort of light so I shared it. For me I want to try all the places in Vegas and I'm glad I stopped by here to check this place out. 

You might be thinking why would I get lobster in a dessert, but it's worth a shot to try it out! Any things possible in life, just enjoy the moment.
My boyfriend and I wanted to experience Lobster Me and I was good. Our sandwiches were stuff with tons of lobster and they didn't hold back. Yummy!

Try the el diablo. It was amazing. The coleslaw served with the food is also very good with some siracha. I would have given this review a 5 if my girlfriends "Conneticut Roll" wasn't so bland. However great service even after coming 20 minutes before closing and my food was awesome.

Was down at the grand canal shops last night and stumbled upon this place and my girl and I tried the grilled cheese with crab fries.

And OMG this stuff was bomb and totally worth my time and money. It does seem pricey at first but I mean it's lobster and lots of it. 

We will be back next time to try something else.

We had to visit the Venetian Casino and stores JUST to return visit LobsterMe. It had been two years since our first visit, but we didn't forget that yummy grilled lobster on a stick- lobstycle! Outstanding! And get a great lobster Bloody Mary to go with it

I walked up to look at the menu and the cashier is scratching her armpit. She turned to grab food and stopped to scratch between her boobs. Then she grabbed the order and took it to the customer. No gloves no hand washing. There is no way I will be eating here. Such a shame- the good looks great.
Be careful. They will hit you with extra charges and act like it was an accident. Ordered the lobster Roll and they charged me for avacados which I didn't ordered. Look at ur receipt

If you're expecting top-end Lobster Rolls and enough to fill you up, this is probably not your stop. If you're just crazing a decent lobster roll, that's what you'll get here. The best item I had here was the crab-covered fries.

For the price, I would look elsewhere if you value quality.

They have lobster rolls, crab rolls, crab fries, they have great service and they have a great location, you need to try it.
We were at the Venetain for several nights and the Canal Shoppes have some of the best food and you will not wait an hour to get in and you won't walk away poor.
Lobster ME is just great. The service is fast and very nice. All the items we had were great. You will love it and you should try it. Have fun in Las Vegas.

Definitely more upscale and better than most other food court options at the Venetian, but still pretty expensive for what you get, and I was still hungry after spending about $20. After a long day of day-drinking, I wanted some more substance but wanted to try this place out. I'm used to paying between $14-17 for a lobster roll at other places, but if you want it with fries & a drink, be prepared to throw down another $4.  But like most things in Vegas go, take normal prices for something and tack on 25-50% more.

I got the lobster roll Connecticut style which was good - the bread was fluffy, soft, and buttered, and there was a decent amount of lobster. I've gotten lobster rolls on hot-dog like buns, but this bread was actually pretty good/ I ate the sandwich pretty quickly, and thought it was tasty, but nothing I'd be writing home about or go out of my way for on my next trip to Vegas. The fries were hot and fresh, but for the amount of fries that you get - there were so few that you could count them - (maybe around 15 fries), you're better off just getting a lobster roll and getting fries at any other food-court establishment. The coleslaw was not memorable and was about 3 bites worth in a container that you normally get to hold ketchup.

They basically have all iterations for lobster things on the menu: sandwiches (cold with mayo, warm Connecticut style, Cajun, sliders), lobster fries, lobster mac & cheese, lobster grilled cheese, lobster tacos, and lobster salad. Basically multiple permutations of white carbs, cheese / butter, and lobster.

All in all, if you're looking for a quick bite to eat at the food court that is not pizza or burgers, this is a good choice. But for the price ($21 for fries + lobster roll), it's expensive and you can probably get something more filling at Grand Lux cafe or elsewhere at the Venetian or Palazzo. Save the lobster rolls for East Coast visits, and get something that is going to cure those hangovers or prepare you properly for a night out.

Most Lobster rolls are served cold, being that it was warm was a bit disappointing.  It was fresh, but lacked a bit of flavor. The waffle fries were absolutely perfect.  It is quite expensive, wouldn't go out of my way for it again

This was nice. I dined here twice last week.   I had the fried  Lobsicle. The service is variable. It depends on who is working there. (This is not good!).  My first time, they did not offer me the free refills.  The next day, I was offered fries and free refills at no extra charge.
So, the food is good but the service is questionable.  I recommend dining at lunchtime not in the evening.
Rip off if you get the lobsicle! Literally smaller than a hot dog. Everything else seems super duper tiny too. Lame!
The food was small for the price. A decent lobster roll but a far fetch from the real thing.

Awesome!  Authentic East Coast down to the apple cider and whoopie pies!

Open space just off Venetian Grand Canal food court, just walk up and order.   Casual, easy, welcoming. 

I have been told the lobster roll options are more expansive than the options at Planet Hollywood location.  We had been told what were the personal favorites of the person behind the counter: the Original Maine Lobster Roll and the Cajun Lobster Roll.  We split these rolls and they did not disappoint.  FRESH, quality lobster served on a toasted bread like bun.  The roll comes in a Large for $17 or an XL for $23.  The Cajun was not incredibly spicy, but enough to make it interesting. 

I would recommend for a casual specific food option for great quality lobster rolls while on Las Vegas Blvd.
these people that work here are so slow. literally waiting for one hour because they are taking forever for just one order. not worth it time at all~~

Uhmmm, they are just ok. I dont know if it applies to all their locations though. Had the lobster roll and lobster mac and cheese. The lobster roll would have been better with bigger chunks of lobster meat instead of small chunks/minced size, although the flavor was good.  The mac n cheese was a little runny for my taste since i prefer the sauce to be on the thicker side. I'll definitely try them again since they are good for a quick snack even if it's a little pricey.

This was better than Red Hook lobster at NYC! 
(I got the Diavolo)

What can I say for Vegas food court it was very good.  I'm a New England boy born n raised so I wasn't expecting much.  The presentation was very authentic all they way down to the New England grilled hit song bun slit topside.  Chowder was also great the lobster roll was good but I'm a bit jaded over the years I have had the absolute best the country has to offer.  Boston native and seafood expert price and quality was above average claw and Nicole meat no tail meat but I wasn't expecting that for under $20.  I would recommend it and also be back for the lobsterpopsicle  cute and original plating

Went to this place due to high reviews.. Ordered a original lobster roll & lobster salad

Taste of lobster is really brought out in the roll, these comes really good when served hot.. Though the size and meat amount is much smaller portion than I expected (the roll length is just a bit short compared to my hand, and I'm 5'3), so $17 is pretty expensive for what's served.. (As in the photo)

The salad, on the other hand, don't recommend these.. Due to sour & salty seasonings, can't really taste the lobster.. In any way, it doesn't worth $14..

First time ordering a lobster roll and it was delicious!! A whole pound of lobster in every roll and you can tell! I split a Connecticut roll with my boyfriend and we were very happy with it. It is slightly pricey and didn't really fill us up but the quality was great. A decadent way to tie us over to dinner.

2.5 Stars.  I would round up to 3, but can bring myself to do it even though the bartender was cool and kept wanting to make sure everything was fine.

Its so hard reading 4-5 Star reviews for anything because it just hypes up your own expectations.  When I read high reviews, I also read the low ones.  And unfortunately, I side with the low reviews here.

Main reason for the 2.5 Stars, just overpriced.  The food was not bad, but just not matching the price whatsoever. Many of the low reviews state the small portions, and yes, the rolls are small.
