Not tiny small, just small.  I don't mind small portions for high prices at all, it just needs to be high quality if its going to be a small portion if you know what I mean.  The lobster is not high quality.  I want to be clear, it is not low quality, it's just not worth $19 for a roll.  If you've had good lobster, you will know it once you bite into the lobster here.  

Where would I value this roll at?  $12.  But you know what, more power to them, go get your money LobsterME.  If people are willing to pay it, then you do you.  I applaud you.

The Chowder fries were not bad.  I agree the fries here are good, nice and crispy with good potato taste.  But $7 to add on the chowder fries and a drink to make the whole meal $26???

Hell to the NAW.

Every time I'm at the Venetian I stop by LobsterMe! Best Lobster Mac n cheese ever! The original Maine lobster roll is a staple and absolutely delicious. 

My favorite stop. Casual seating. Nice atmosphere out in the open courtyard. Walk up type street vendor feel with barstool and bench seating. Great for one to a huge party of peeps!

So... I was at the Venetian Towers for the recent Consumer Electronics Show and ended up eating at Lobster ME every day (as did my colleagues) after I had my first Lobster roll there. In all, I had the lobster roll (4x), the lobster melt (the French with Brie), the fries, the chips, the very yummy blueberry lemonade, the slaw (ate every bit of it) and the Lobster Bisque.

Lobster Me gets a solid four stars from me. The food was consistently good even though the place was slammed because of the show. The fries and chips were crisp, the bread nicely toasted, and the bisque surprisingly good for a place that's essentially Fast Food.

The Roll at $18 seemed a little expensive and looked small, but it was overflowing with the claw meat and it comes with chips made in the store (not ripples out of a bag) and a condiment sized bit of coleslaw - just enough. Upgrading it to a combo substituting chips for fries and a Drink ($4) is a no-brainer as the drink itself is $4.

The Melt uses tail meat but seemed a bit skimp but at $10, value isn't bad... and comes with the same chips and coleslaw. 

The Lobster Bisque was surprisingly tasty (again, for a fast food joint), and the lemonades were also tasty and not too sweet - the blueberry flavored lemonade was really quite yummy.

Service was excellent. I did not think I could "combo" a Melt and the register clerk informed me it was the better deal when I wanted both fries and a drink with it. They also honored the long (LONG!) expired coupon that was linked to their Yelp profile when I "checked in." Given the crowd and the noise, it was no surprise that they got an order or two mixed up, but they were cheerfully corrected.

I hope it is still there in the Venetian Towers next year!
Oh my god. I loooove this place.  The food is to die for! My favorite is the lobsticle. So Yummy. A bit pricey but I guess it's worth it.

Quick and delicious!

The lobster roll comes with so much lobster !
Would recommend getting the mac & cheese add on. Come with a lot of mac & cheese and its great for a late night snack if you have left overs!!

Don't be shellfish come and try this place. Even though it's a lobster place, the prices aren't too clawful, it just boils down to how much you order!

It was a gem to stumble upon on our day drunken roaming adventures in The Venetian. I get mad drunchies so when I smelled this place and saw a sign for lobster I had to stop by.

It's clean, the decor is pretty regular, but open to The Venetian's walk way. It seems like a poppin' spot, 'cause who doesn't like peasant food? (Lobsters used to be peasant food, the more you know) So seating can be kind of difficult to snag.

The employees are friendly, our cashier person hurt his leg so he was on crutches, but he that didn't stop him from being quick and smoothly maneuvering around.

We got the lobster chowder and the chowder fries. The chowder is delicious. Hot and flavorful with small bits of lobster, and a nice helping of potatoes and whatever the other ingredients were. Chowder fries were just fries drenched in their chowder, so really just order either one. I'd pick the soup.

It was a nice place to get a quick bite and just order a little, the cost wont be so bad.
Really nice little place in the middle of Venetian shops. We had lobster roll, lobster grilled cheese and lobstickle. Everything was delicious and fresh!

Got the Connecticut style lobster roll (warm lobster with butter), $17

The lobster still had a bit of that fishy smell to it so it probably isn't super fresh. They are very generous with the lobster meat but I don't think it was actually "one pound in every roll" as advertised. 

However, the taste and amount you get for the price is actually quite decent. A touch of lemon juice is just what it needs and the bread is delicious and really wraps the flavors altogether nicely.

The cole slaw that comes with it is delicious and made me wish I could order more of it as a side. The chips are meh. Bumped up to 4 stars for quick and friendly service. Despite the giant lines from CES they were able to handle it and get people's orders out in a reasonable amount of time.

I had been craving a lobster roll, so I came here  for my birthday meal. It was amazing! Everything was so fresh and tasty. I had the lobster roll with waffle fries, and I really enjoyed it. The portion wasn't very large, but it was enough to fill me up.

I went to Lobster Me last night.  My only complaint was the wait in line was pretty long but it was not the registers fault!  I think it was just a popular place!  I ordered the Maine lobster roll and paid three dollars extra for fries and a drink.  The cashier was super friendly!  He gave me a number and I put it on my table.  He immediately brought out my diet pepsi.  I felt badly I left without it but he didn't complain at all.  He was friendly to everyone!  After a bit my lobster roll came out.  It had some spices on top of the lobster, a smidgen of mayonnaise at the bottom of the roll, and the roll was exactly what I'd want in a roll- toasty with a little texture and still spongey.  I did wish the mayonnaise was spread out on the roll instead of all sitting in a glob in the bottom.  I ended up picking off parts of the mayonnaise globs since it was just all in the bottom it looked gross and I figured why eat it?  Then I had fries.  lol.  The fries seemed beer battered and I loved them.  I do not usually eat fries but I was treating myself.  A little bonus was my meal came with a touch of cole slaw.  The cole slaw was not too creamy or heavy- it was crisp and seemed very fresh.  The mayonnaise truly would be my only complaint about this place.  Service really was excellent and stood out at this place.  Just what I expect at the Venetian!

The food was great. I had a lobster salad. The lobster tasted fresh. My husband had a lobster roll and really enjoyed it. I also tried the lobster mary. I wasn't too fond of it, but everything else was great!

Pretty good spot! I like this is a bit better than the one in Planet Hollywood! I got the Cajon lobster roll, expensive at $19 dollars + you can add fries and a drink so $4 bucks more so $25 dollars for a complete meal with cold slaw.  This one also had the lobster melt which i don't believe the PH location has. You do get a good amount of meat. I would visit again when i'm in town! Good stuff here..

I'm keeping this review short and sweet because it'll mirror the size of their lobster roll. 

Tasted good.  Small roll.  Tease.  It was an $18 snack.

The fish and chips are horrible. Like other reviewers the order is 3 small pieces. tartar sauce is provided in a packet like ketchup.     The chips or fries were the only saving grace. Crispy and hot. Had clam chowder with the meal watery not that great. Didn't try the lobster roll maybe should've but figured fish/seafood would've been in their roundhouse. Seating was comfortable but this place pass

I've been drooling over Lobster ME posts that I've seen on Instagram for awhile now and finally got a chance to eat here when I stayed at the Venetian for a girls trip. Unfortunately my ass was slightly hungover so I couldn't even finish what I ordered, but all the items were delicious! I started with the lobster bisque which came with chunks of lobster. I really enjoyed the flavor and it definitely made me feel better. I also got the chowder fries to share with everyone and those were tasty. Crisscut fries are always appreciated and the presentation was definitely IG worthy. I'm hella mad I couldn't finish it! I'm also mad that I didn't have the appetite for one of the lobster rolls or grilled cheese sandwiches. Now I have to go back!
Tried the Lobster Mac & Cheese and it was very good.  Not a lot of seating here and bottled water was $5, eek!

My lobster was a little overcooked, prices are a little high, and the side of coleslaw was pathetically small. But the food was good (I had a beltway), and it was a nice treat to have a fat lobster roll, so far from maine.
Lobster Mary was disappointing. Smallest stick of celery over ever seen, not a bloody Mary. Keep walking not worth the novelty.
Ordered signature lobster roll, I dun like it as it is very dry.
Taste buds dancin' after a savory Connecticut style lobster roll. Generous portion, delicious flavor, reasonable price. Couldn't ask for more than that!

Worth trying! Short lines and good service. 

The chowder fries $7 and lobster melt $10 were really tasty. 

Lobster roll $18 (beltway) was okay, the lobster had no flavor. The lobster bisque was bad, it tasted like it had been sitting all day and too sweet.
Freaking awesome.  We went 3 days in a row and everything we tried was delicious,  the manager she is short and blond was so nice and genuine.  5 stars  for me
Really delicious food. How'd of thunk that you can get some great lobster from a 'fast food' joint. Wish they had one in the Chicago area.

Had the Lobster Mac & Cheese. They should have called it Mac & Cheese with some Lobster. Although it was nice and cheesy, it took away from the little pieces of Lobster.  Was expecting better. Should have tried the Lobstercicle or Lobster roll instead.

Hubby was very excited to find out Lobster Me had opened but he didn't stay happy long. The original Maine roll at 17.00 was about the going rate he said but nowhere near the quality of a Fords Fish Shack. Fords would have never served overcooked lobster! I got fish and chips and at 12.00 it has to be the biggest ripoff on the menu. I got a vat of fries and 3 rectangles of fish that were about the size of the Trident brand fish sticks in the grocery frozen section, I got mine with ranch instead of tartar sauce but their ranch was not good. I was happy to try something new but I liked this spot better when the coffee bean and tea leaf was still there. We most definitely won't be returning.

A heavenly experience. Lobster Me is a true gem tucked away amongst the shops of the Venetian--a must try when in Vegas!

The steep prices here (given that it's a food court-style place) is the only downside, but trust me, you'll be happy you paid the $17 for your roll!

Would recommend:

1. Connecticut lobster roll (the only warm sandwich on the menu) which is stuffed with a generous serving of delicious lobster on a soft, buttery bun. 

2. Lobster mac and cheese 

3. Cajun fries

Fast food lobster...only in America.

When I saw this and also realized I would be staying at the Venetian on my recent trip to Vegas, I knew I had to try it.

So random for it to be hidden away in this food court...almost too hidden. And while it's supposed to be fast food, the prices said "Vegas"; $32 for a lunch for 2! And that is without alcohol!

I had the lobster tacos...they were decent and flavourful. My friend had the lobster and chips - in fairness, the server did warn that there were only 4 chunks of lobster - but seriously? For $13? 

Overall I am happy to have tried it! But I'm the next trip to Vegas it is likely not worth a repeat.

We love Lobster, what can I say?  I mean our room is literally only less than 5 minutes away and walking past this place often.....I mean we were bound for a visit sometime!  

So finally, we came to visit during the breakfast hour and ordered the crab loaded fries!! Say with me, "awesome." Say with me again, "awesome" but this time rub your tummy!  We really enjoyed this dish!  It was actually a morning snack for us but we shared it and it was great!  What I loved most about this is the hot crunchiness of the waffle fries bathing in the lobster cream sauce.  The chunks of lobster with scallions and bacon just adds an extra special something.  Keeping the sauce on the bottom of this dish was a very smart choice; it keeps the fries crunchy!

We will definitely come back for another visit; wait a minute, we did come back for a second visit!  We even ordered the same dish!  You will definitely need to visit sometime!

Holy LOBSTER!!! Could it be i'm falling in love!!bive never been so excited about food!

Lobster ME is located in the Food Court. We couldn't find it at first....The Venetian is Huge!! I order the Lobster Roll and Lobster Mac & Cheese with a water. Yes!! Total Fat Kid! There's NO Way I was going to pass up this opportunity! I payed about $38 bucks for everything. 

The Lobster Roll wasn't huge, but it's packed with meat. The roll is toasted with a butter flavor, Comes with kettle chips---which I didn't care for. My lobster Mac & Cheese was amazing! I love, love, love this place!!! 

I went to TAO beach club with Lobster Gutt!!! No shame folks, no shame!! I wish I would've visited Lobster ME before leaving town. I shall return next summer! I may order a sandwich ToGo.... I also heard the Grill cheese is good.

Good place for a quick Lobster craving fix! I ordered the sliders which had lobster on one and shrimp on the other, both good and it was mixed with their cole slaw which is soo yummy and refreshing. There steak fries are also delicious and crispy.  My sliders didn't have that much lobster or shrimp but if you order the original lobster roll they stuff that sandwich with lobsters. One of the girls ordered the Mac and cheese lobster sandwich and she said it was tasty! 

Good place for a quick delish bite. They have alcohol and a Bloody Mary special that they put a lobster claw meat in there as well.

It was nice to see a place within the Venetian where I can get a quick bite without having to be waited on and still be able to enjoy good seafood. 

Tried the Cajun lobster roll and it was loaded with lobster meat and a Cajun aioli sauce which was not at all spicy. Also ordered a cup of NE clam chowder and an apple cider. The clam chowder was just okay - not as creamy as I would have liked it and a bit lacking in clams and potatoes in the chowder. However, the refreshing apple cider helped to end the meal in a more or less positive note.

Other than the price being ridiculous, this place is pretty good. 

The lobsicle which I got battered and fried was very juicy and succulent. Would only suggest that they use a different type of breading if possible. 

Also got the truffle lobster roll. Again was really good and flavors were on point. 

Good service from the cashiers on multiple requests.
food was very good, very fresh, very tasty, however the portions are very small for the price.  you may want to ask to see the role size to see if the portion will be big enough for your meal.

A great lobster roll, even though it's served warm, not cold. So damned good we almost went back there a second time, even with all the culinary choices we had in all of Las Vegas. If you love lobster, this is a must stop.

The food was amazing and for lobster a very reasonable price. I am not huge on seafood but this is some seafood I can get behind and enjoy. Servers were very pleasant and great at recommending some food options. Got the surf and turf and grilled cheese with lobster to split. Great experience overall.

Lobster Me.. Lobster Me That! Please don't buy that! 
I had the Lobster Grill Cheese it was very expensive and had no lobster mostly crab .

The lobsicle is great and the rolls are also very good. The fries need something to dip in (ranch or some other sauce). It is also a bit pricey for a fast food style place but it is lobster. Overall pretty darn good
Had a wonderful, delicious experience. Shout out to Cameron, who was professional, helpful, and hilarious. Thanks for your superb service!

We had the lobster bun. It was heaven stuffed in a bun! I was a little disappointed that spending that much money, we had coleslaw and some mediocre fries as sides. For the price, I will try something else next time but at least I can say o had one! There was a lot of lobster meat, so I'll give it that.

My first lobstah roll evah!  The staff were really nice and they were quick.  
They were good at remembering who ordered what.

Clean, fast and good.  In the Venetian Shops.

Caveat, this is no boston lobster roll. But it's also been at least three years since I've had some boston lawbsta (neptune oyster im coming for you this summer). 

The lobster roll was relatively small but still filling. Be warned that if you get any of the combos you will NOT get chips. Also don't ask the cashier if you can get the soup/drink combo w/o the drink for any cheaper because she'll tell you "yeah, I can charge you 9 dollars (normal soup price) for the soup." Ok lady, you could just give a courteous "no." We're all just tryna get by ok. 

The truffle lobster roll my friend got was probably the most flavorful but INTENSELY truffly. If that's what you're into though I would recommend that one. 

All in all a pricy and meh kinda meal. Service didn't make that any better either.

This is another new addition to the Venetian food court. 
I got the El Diablo roll as a combo that includes seasoned steak fries, small Coleslaw, and a medium drink. 
A large El Diablo roll is $18, add $2 for the combo. 
You get the equivalent of meat from a 1lb lobster placed in what looks like a grilled Texas toast roll. The El Diablo is served warm a small amount of marinara sauce that is spicy hot. On a scale of 1-10 , with 10 being hotest, mine was a 7.5. I personally would have add some Tabasco sauce, but I wanted to try it the way they made it The lobster was fresh by Las Vegas standards. The roll, coleslaw, and fries were also fresh. 
Service was very good, everyone was friendly. 
I really liked it, and next time I'll try the warm roll with butter. 
For dessert, they have a variety of Moon pies that I didn't try this time, but definitely will next visit.
The lobster was fresh and cooked well. Tasty place for lunch. Try the lobster mac balls. Tastiest balls I've ever put in my mouth

We ordered the Maine style and Cajun Lobster rolls. The sandwich rolls are $19 each so it's no your typical fast food place. The lobster rolls were  mouth watering delicious. I would definitely recommend this place.

5 stars for food, 4 stars for price (since it looks like fast food type place with no walls, in the middle of canal shoppe) 4 stars for ambience.

I've ordered main lobster, cajun style (menus says warm style) . It contained all real lobster. I might have order cold style, but didn't because the cashier told me it is mixture of lobster & crab. I got the sandwich combo which includes fries & drink for 5 dollars more, really worth it! Also ordered lobster bisque, this also contained huge lobster pieces. 

Price, all of this came out to be over $44!
I wouldn't mind paying this at a full-service lobster restaurant, but not at a hole in the wall type of joint with open spaces where everyone walking by my table is just transient saying the name of the joint loudly like a chant, and they are not even customers. Like I said the place has no wall! Look like a food court joint in the middle of canal shoppe, next to the Gondola Ride. Although staffs are super friendly.

I will go back at least for the lobstercicle!

This place is very expensive. I loved the Connecticut lobster roll and appreciated the big pieces of lobster in the roll. Definitely not skimpy. 

The only negative besides the price is how greasy the food is. About 30 minutes after eating the roll and fries my stomach felt a little sick.
Overpriced, salty, small-portioned joke of a shack. Wouldn't recommend at all. Chowder fries were decent.

I live and die by Yelp, and when I see that a place has less than 4 stars I wont eat there.

"Lobster Me" has changed my mind! How is this place only 3.5 stars?! It deserves much better!

I ordered the main lobster roll with fries and a drink. It was very tasty. The lobster was warm, the bread was fresh and the fries were spicy and crisp. 

The service is great as well, i'm sure they get many first timers coming to eat here. The staff helped me decide what to order, they were great! 

* The meal could be slightly larger, if you are really hungry I would suggest to order an additional side. 

Ill definitely be back!

The staff at this location are awesome and provide excellent service.

Pricing seems a bit high for the ambiance but the food and drinks deliver.  Locals can get a 20 percent discount.  The Lobster Mary was very flavorful and the full lobster claw was beautiful.  The bread on the lobster roll was toasted perfectly and the lobster was fresh and tasty but a little overseasoned.  They also have the best french fries.

Ahhhh Vegas.  I had a Connecticut roll with chips & a soda & water which was almost $40 FOR LUNCH but that was also my choice to stay b/c I seriously love lobster rolls and don't get to eat them often.  The food was actually pretty good, with HUGE chunks of lobster, not skimped on either for the sandwhich.  The CT roll was lacking a little on flavor as if maybe it didn't have much butter, (thanks for looking after my health) so I just got alittle extra mayo to add and it was fine.  It came with a small side of chips and a half full paper ramekin of coleslaw.  Even with the tasty sandwich, I don't think this was a fair price, but the staff was nice and food was quick so an extra star for what I feel should a 3-3.5 rating.

If you aren't coming here after an awesome night and hung over you are NOT doing Vegas right. My wife and I love the lobster rolls here. It's super delicious and it goes great with a cold beer. It's a little pricey, but this is Vegas, what do you expect?

One word to describe with place "Delicious"
I was on a get-a-way to Las Vegas this week and I wanted to check out Lobster ME. I was very happy with my lobster roll I ordered the Cajun Style which was a good choice! The staff was very friendly and attentive to there customers I would highly recommend eating at Lobster ME I plan to go back next time I visit Vegas!

Lobster everything! I really enjoyed this place. Cute little restaurant, just order and take a seat and they'll bring your food to your table.  I noticed they don't serve the lobster ice cream here? I got the Connecticut roll, about $17 and comes with a small side of coleslaw and house-made chips, which was good. It was nice, warm, buttery and the bread was nicely toasted.  They said there's at least a pound of lobster in each roll.  They had 4 other rolls on the menu that all sounded so delicious but I just got the one that was the most popular based on Yelp.  I had the lobster mac and cheese at the one in PH before and it was tasty as well and not bad for the price.  I had a bite of the clam chowder fries from my friend and they were good, just not for the price.  I did have quite a wait for my food because I saw them give my food to another customer. I was quite upset, since me and my friend ordered the same time and hers came out first and then mines was next but they handed it off to somebody else.  Maybe I was just hungry and cranky from gambling but I came up to the front counter after waiting 10 minutes after my friend got her food and told them I haven't got my order yet and they put in my order again and it came out about 10 minutes later to my table. Problem solved, the workers were really nice but the waiting game just threw me off but I'm sure I will be back when I'm craving a lobster roll.

Lobster me was a great discovery for me! I love lobster and shell fish and am working my way through everything on the menu! They staff was polite, helpful, and made great suggestions. They made a suggestion for the lobster bisque as a side with my 50/50 lobster roll and I loved it! I'm a big fan of the lobster mac and cheese and the lobster grilled cheese. If you couldnt tell I will be back!

OMG!
The lobster mac and cheese is so good!
The lobster tacos were delicious!
I stuffed my face here!
The lobster bisc was ok not the best but still good!

Order the tacos and thank me later!

My husband and I passed by this place after watching a show at planet Hollywood. We had seen pictures of the lobsicle all over the strip and were intrigued so we stopped in for a late night snack. We also notice the sign saying best lobster roll in the US so us being huge lobster roll fans, we had to test the validity of that statement. First off prices were very high.. But it's lobster so I guess that's normal. The lobsicle, which we ordered fried, was very good but super tiny. I did not like the lobster roll at all. Luke's in nyc is much better. The seasoning was weird and there wasn't a lot of lobster.

Best lobster roll,  lobster Mac n cheese, crab cake burger ever had. Their waffle fries are delicious and so is their salad. I suggest you try all.
I mean right from the presentation of the food to the freshness and taste they have it all under check. It's 5 star quality food served at a stall or a food court.

After hanging out in Vegas for a week and seeing Lobsicle advertisements all over, I decided to give this place a try. I got the fish and chips to play it safe and it was decent. You don't get that many pieces of lobster for the price but the basket was full of fries which was nice. For having special seasonings for their food offerings, I was a little surprised that their tartar sauce was in generic packets. Probably won't be back, but the food was decent so I have no real complaints about that.

My wife and I grew up on the East Coast and have eaten lobster and lobster rolls all our  lives.
My wife and I had the Connecticut roll. Worse lobster roll I've ever eaten. Lobster meat was minced, it looks nothing like their advertisement. It tasted and looked like the meat you get from the little legs and flippers. No claw meat. For $17, it's a rip off in my opinion. Lobster bisque was a bit of a thick consistency, with little lobster meat to speak of and a very bland taste. We will not return.

First time at this location, usually we visit the one at the Miracle Mile shops. I had The Cajun with coleslaw, fries and a coke. My gf had The Original with homemade chips and coleslaw.

Our rolls were loaded with tasty, juicy lobster meat!! Well worth the price! The bread was perfectly toasted.
this is not real Maine lobster. after on girl told us it was, another said "sometimes they get a Maine lobster in a shipment..." Lol not good for the price or for what you get.

Honestly died and went to heaven when I ate here. I am a frequent visitor to Vegas and was surprised to find this new place in the Venetian canals.

Lobster rolls are one of those items that I'm constantly in search of the ultimate experience. Quite often I am disappointed Due to having generally high expectations.

However this time I was not disappointed at all. The Service is fast and easy you order at the counter and take a number back to your table and once the meal is ready they bring it out.

There are number of items to choose from several variations of the lobster roll and several additional side items such as lobster and macaroni cheese and a lobster cheese melts and also lobster bisque and clam chowder.

I ordered the lobster roll with truffle butter and coriander and the fries with the clam chowder topping and bacon. It also came with a small coleslaw on the side.

The lobster roll includes a full pound of lobster. It was fresh it was tasty and it was delicious. The truffle butter was succulent and rich but amazingly what made it great was the bun which was slightly toasted and the perfect consistency. 

The fries with the clam chowder and bacon are a whole different world of pleasure I can't  recommend them enough. Absolutely mouthwateringly delicious.

The food came out promptly and the portion was ample. The price was aligned with expectation given the location and the fact that you're eating lobster. My meal for the upgraded lobster roll and the upgraded fries along with a soda was $26 with tax.

If you're in Las Vegas stop what you doing and going to eat here now.

Little food stall by the food court in the grand canal shops.  They specialize in Lobster.  

Serving sizes are small, but I guess the food is priced okay considering you are getting lobster. 

We ordered the Beltway Roll and Lobster Mac and Cheese. Total cost: $31.25.

The aroma of the lobster is great. The flavor is very good. 

With the lobster roll you get home made potato chips (not fries) and some cole slaw.

Overall a good choice but order a side because the serving sizes are small.


4 out of 5 stars.

We tried the original Maine style roll and the chowder fries and they were amazing!!  Was craving for it the very next day!!  The grill cheese and bisque was also super tasty.  Definitely going to be a regular stop when I go to Vegas.

Stubbled upon this place and since returning from Boston I've been craving lobster.  Husband and I ordered the Connecticut roll which is a basic lobster roll  but served warm and lobster is cooked in butter. 

Thoroughly loved it and great people watching. A little spendy but great. 
We split the roll which came with a side of coleslaw, also great... And Heineken, came to 26.38 FYI. 

Yum.

Holy Lobster! I lived at this place when I was in Vegas.  It was about 200 yards from my room at the Palazzo.  I had the Original and the Beltway both with fries and a drink which came to about $28.00 each.  The bread was so soft, fresh and buttery and full of lobster tail and claw meat.  The fries where hot and  good and they offer vinegar (I love vinegar on my fries). A must eatery while in Vegas.

All I can say is tasteless, nasty and expensive..don't waste your time. Lobster has no flavor which I assume is due to being farm raised and frozen. The bread is stale and bland...Chowder on chowder fries tasted like watered down 7-11 cheese sauce...to top it off our order came out wrong, they took the wrong sandwich back to sub for the right one  & just added butter to the top of the one sent back and pretended like it was the new re-made sandwich!! All this for a whopping $46.30 per person!! Such a waste!!!!

So, if I was going to die tomorrow...a few of their Lobsicles would be part of my last meal.  It's a fried lobster orgasm, plain and simple.  The idea is so simple:  a small (4 oz, maybe) lobster tail, shelled, impaled on a skewer and either beer-batter dipped and lightly deep fried, or grilled, and served with lemon and butter.  I think they must brine their lobster tails, since the flavor was outstanding and they were very juicy.  They don't overcook them at all; cooked absolutely perfectly.  I only tried the deep-fried version, but I had a total of 8 of them over the course of my six day stay.  A must-try...I'm hungry just thinking about it.
My second time visit here. Love everything, the lobster roll, bread bowl with clam chowder, fries. Awesome. Will come back again!

It's a little pricey, but you get so much lobster. I like that they let the lobster do the talking and it's not too heavily seasoned or globbed with mayo. The bread was perfect, too. All-in-all, I really enjoyed it and have no idea what people are griping about. Fries were excellent, as well!

WAY, WAY OVERPRICED!!

$17 for just a lobster roll? i.e. A hot dog bun with a little chopped up lobster in it? If you want a decent hearty amount of meat like you should get in the first place, you have to pay extra. Fries or anything else costs extra too! AND it's served on a paper plate with plastic utensils? AND it's in a fast food setting!

I had the lobster mac and cheese. It wasn't bad. But it was quite spicy, peppery. 

Mac and cheese is normally supposed to have a mellow cheesy flavor, but all I could taste was hot pepper. And there was only a small amount of lobster in it, all chopped and ground up. Not to mention it was served in a flimsy cardboard bowl and a plastic fork like you'd get at a carnival.

Yeah, lobster tastes good and all, But I consider this place a ripoff. They need to cut their prices in half in order for it to be a fair value.

So..after many months with the same menu, they FINALLY bring back tacos !!
Had the trio..libster, shrimp,and fish tacos.
As you see..put together sloppily, and served not so hot.
Taste wise..VERY GOOD !
Really busy today..more counter help needed, especially during busy times.
Prices are really high considering the amount of product that is actually given.

I got the cajun lobster roll as recommended by the cashier and it was soooooo good. Plenty of lobster!!! It was even better than lobster rolls I have had at fancy seafood restaurants. And at 18 dollars for a lobster roll + cole slaw + chips, this is a steal -- especially for Las Vegas where I expect everything to be overpriced!! I've never paid under $16 for a lobster roll anywhere!

The next day I ate at Bacchanal buffet at Caesar's .. But not going to lie, I would rather have just bought two lobster rolls instead! I would return again and again and again .......
First time here, and it was good with the people being very nice and helpful. The rolls are stuffed! They also have some interesting drinks. Would come here again. Had the Cajun !!

Very good, but very pricey.  Heaps of delicious lobster meat, but on a 4in roll for $17...it would be more justifiable if it was a 6in. Chowder fries were awesome, lobster Mac and cheese was okay...not worth it. Yes I would visit again.

$15 lobsicle tasted burnt (maybe dirty grill)? Is the butter real? Crab loaded fries with "lobster cheese" that is funny no lobster flavor at all. Crab i see it but no taste. Asked for tarter sauce and they had to ask a manager. Waited 15 minutes. Really wished i had just put the $27 in a slot machine.

I like this place a lot.  It's almost identical to Luke's Lobster except for the fact that they give you a lot more lobster in the roll.   I was surprised to see how packed it was in the roll.   This location does cost a few dollars more but they offer several styles of lobster roll instead of trying to trick you into getting a combo dish of shrimp and crab rolls.   Both spots are tasty but LobsterMe is more satisfying.   It's pricey but it's better than the alternative

If you're looking for a tasty lobster fix on the Las Vegas strip without paying outrageous prices you'll likely find in most Vegas strip restaurants LobsterME is the perfect place to go. Their lobster rolls are the best I've ever tasted, with soft yet crispy warm bread and more lobster meat than I expected! As soon as I finished the first one I had to try a second one!

Went here with my parents and boyfriend and paid about $85 for 4 tiny lobster rolls. The lobster didn't taste that great either and the seating area is so small 3 of us sat down on some uncomfortable barstools and my dad had to stand.

I ordered the Cajun style lobster roll, the meat was tender and cold. The mixture of mayo and Cajun seasoning was good. The bun was crispy and seared on both sides split down the middle to hold the lobster. My order came with a side of chips, dusted with a salty, ranch flavor. Overall, the roll was good but not as advertised. Online on there webpage, says each roll has 1 pound of lobster meat, that's the reason why we would pay $17 for an order. The sandwich did not come with 1 pound of lobster meat. The McDonald's lobster roll taste better than lobsterME and that's less than $10.

Lobster Me is a delicious spot to eat. They have delicious Mac and Lobster. Their Lobster sandwiches are mouthwatering leaving you wanting more. They have increased their prices due to the high demand at this location. It will cost you 23.00 for a warm Lobster sandwich and 17.00 for a cold one. The food is really good just not the prices. Seating is limited so you may need to find another seat in different area.

Not that great. and EXPENSIVE for the little pieces you get.
It's OK considering your in top dollar tourist trap alley.
If you're s fan of lobster, this is the place to be! Located in the Venetian Hotel, this $11 sandwich is nothing short of delicious. I highly recommend stopping by for a quick meal!
I love this place!  Nice snack and not very expensive. My favorite is the main style lobster roll and I really love the Lobster Mary.

This was just alright. I lived in ME so I ordered the Maine lobster roll and it wasn't the same. I don't believe the lobster was fresh either. The coleslaw  was bland and the chips were under seasoned.

Your one and only main ingredient is a premium ingredient that would taste amazing even if it were prepared just by boiling it.
How do you screw it up so badly??? 

I ordered the lobster bisque for $10 and the lobster Mac and cheese for $14 or so. Both were incredibly disappointing. The bisque was floury and salty and lacking in any lobster flavor. The pre-cooked lobster bisque from Costco tastes ten times better than this sorry excuse for a lobster bisque. 

The Mac and cheese tasted like something that was heated up in the microwave with a few small pieces of boiled lobster tossed carelessly on top along with some fried onions from a box. 

This place is expensive, but the food is so tasteless and poorly conceived. Totally do not recommend.

Chowder fries pretty good for 7 bucks. I am from Canada so we have a best poutine ;) so this wasn't bad. Friends got the mac and cheese for 6 and they said it was awesome (although it was just regular mac and cheese with lobster on top). Serving size is only ok and price is decent.
Food was a tad pricey but what on the strip isnt anymore my Maine style lobster roll was full of flavor and the fries were hot fresh my wife enjoyed the old bsy and liked that as well.

Decided to grab a snack with my buddy after a walk down the Vegas strip. Sat down and shared a lobster mac and cheese. Holy lobster it was amazing. The lobster tasted very fresh, the cheese was very creamy and it also got a slight hint of spiciness which gave the lobster a sweet kick in flavour. Made the whole dish so much more exciting! Highly recommended for lobster lovers!

If you are looking for any lobster dishes in Vegas, Lobster ME is the place.  My recommendations are lobsicle and chowder. In addition, every time when I go there, Yvonne always takes care of me.  She is very friendly and knows how to take care the customers.  I don't need to worry about my order when she is there.

Not a bad place if your craving for some lobster. Comparable to other similar restaurant with this concept. We had the lobster roll and all it was good. A bit on the small size. Not the best in town but not bad. The lobster Mac was really bad. The macaroni was over cooked to the point it was mushy and sticky. The flavor was not very good. The lobster and chowder was good. Chowder has good flavor but it's small for the price you pay after adding he lobster charge to it. Fish and chips were good. We also had the shrimp cocktail which was more like the frozen shrimp from Costco tossed in some seasoning. Can't say I would want to go back anytime soon but it's not a bad place.
Would have taken a photo but i ate it!!!!the Connecticut is delicious!!! Really good sandwich!!!
We got the chowder fries and beltway. Good food. We just expected portions to be bigger.

Had the Original Maine lobster roll combo w/ lobster me seasoned fries and it was delicious! Kids had the kids MAC n cheese and grilled cheese sandwich. Place is very family friendly, service was quick. I'll definitely be back next time I'm in Vegas.
Amazing lobster roll and Lobster Bloody Mary. Expensive but definitely worth it. The space is set up so you order, pay, sit and then your food is brought to you. They also offer a military discount.

So I was shopping at Planet Hollywood for some booty shorts and decided I needed a tasty treat for lunch . I ate at Lobster Me. It was the bomb! Then I went to the Grand CAnal Shops at the Venetian and what was there ? Another Lobster Me that's what. So BOOM! my chunky butt ate two of these rolls in one day and I'm not gonna lie. I loved them both!! Run don't walk here. Best lunch in town
So many items on the menu! Hard to choose just one. Had the 50/50 Dawg with side of the sriracha aioli sauce, amazing! And the waffle fries! So delicious!
Shared the lobster roll combo  and it was very delicious. Good amount of lobster. Nice staff. Total price was 24.90

This is the best lobster roll place I've ever been to. And the price is fair.
They have multiple flavors of lobster rolls. The Maine is the original flavor. Cajun is spicy and special. I like them both.
Clam chowder is usually very tasty in this kind of places. No disappointment this time either. The Lobster Bisque is light and good!

Okay, it wasn't too bad, but when I pay for Lobster Mac & Cheese, I expect somewhat fresh lobster.  Maybe not right out of the the ocean, but at least within a day.  The mac & cheese was good, but the lobster tasted like it was cooked a few days before.  It probably doesn't help that I had fresh lobster the night before. 

The seating area was fairly clean and the young lady at the counter was very friendly. I will probably hold off from eating here the next time I'm in Vegas and stick to the fresh lobster and homemade mac & cheese.

After whole day of shopping we stopped at Venetian and decided to try Lobster ME since we heard about it so much on yelp and 702 on the local tv. We tried lobster roll with classic English topping. Well..... sandwich was dry and portion was really small even for me. Better go and get lobster at some real restaurant. Criss cut fries was not impressive at all. This place has a great idea to bring lobster to kind of fast food but they need to improve their menu, quality and quantity because it doesn't match the price you pay for it.

What a killer concept for a girl that dies for some lobster. We had an early dinner snack with some lobsicles and they were delicious. I got mine grilled while hubby got his battered and fried. They are clearly making a killing because who doesn't love lobster, but holy crap for two tails almost $30! The only thing I can complain about is the cost, so it wouldn't stop me from another or trying something else there.

It's over priced for what you get. The lobster mac and cheese says the lobsters blended in but what you get is cold lobster thrown on top of Mac & Cheese. 

The only thing worth the money is the lobster bisque in a bread bowl.  

If you have money to spare you could eat here or save your money and eat at a sit down restaurant.

came here for a quick lunch during the GameStop expo and it didn't disappoint! It's delicious and really meaty. It's a pretty good sized roll. My husband tried the Cajun roll and loved it! I had the Maine lobster and was very happy with it as well. I had the chips and my husband got the chowder fries. I wish the chowder fries had a bit more chowder. The Asian kid who took our order was really nice and was more than happy to refill our drinks (we sat at the bar.) really yummy place and I didn't think the price was too bad for the size and how much lobster the roll had.
Lobster ME Signature Roll Cajun style was delicious!  Add the Cajun fries and it's pure delight.

Good food... although it doesn't look as you're getting a whole pound of lobster as they heavily advertise... but really delicious.
The freaking lobsicle is really good - although tiny...

Located in the Canal Shops of Palazzo/Venetian, and quick easy place to grap anything Lobster.  We tried the Grilled Cheese Lobster sandwich and the Lobster Roll.  Both were good, but would suggest if really want the flavor of the Loster, go with the Roll, as it is full of lobster meat and a light dressing, so the the flavor is really about the lobster on a nicely toasted roll.  The grilled cheese has a small amount of Loster, but a  lot of cheese, which makes a very nice grilled cheese sandwhich, with a hint of lobster.  This place is pricey for what you get, but it is in the midst of one of Vegas' premiere Hotel, Palazzo and Venetian.  Try it out, it worth a quick visit.

This is a great place when you want to grab a quick bite. The grilled lobster tail on a stick is genius and it was cook perfectly. I'll be dreaming about the lobster bisque till my next visit to Las Vegas. 
They also have a decent beer selection and you can see all the games on TV from the bar next door.

Was always skeptical about this place, but I have to admit this place was .com! I always had my orders to go so never had an issue. Bread is nice and soft, lobster is weighed for the perfect amount of meat each time. And come on, it's lobster!! So good!

I'm from Maine. 

Got Lobster ME roll New England Style. Lobster was 4.5oz and average tasting. The roll was cooked well. Butter on grill. The lobster was a bit underwhelming.  I'm not sure they add anything to it. 

The Taco trio. These where great. Lime zing to em. 

Fries were cold so I asked for fresh ones. 

NO TARTAR SAUCE! They really can't call themselves a Maine lobster place without it. 

It was good but I probably would go back for the roll. But I would get the tacos.

So.....I'd say more like 2.5, as I'd give it a second try, but there were some issues. First off, though, my fiancee enjoyed the lobster bisque, and I agree.....it was good.

Now, onto my lobster grilled cheese sandwich. Ample amount of lobster, which is always a plus. Usually.
It was just kinda.....bland. It was just there. Couldn't taste the cheese, and the lobster/crab was woefully underseasoned. The fries weren't cooked the best, and contrary to the sandwich, was oversalted.  Overall, not a good first impression.

Generous enough with portion and freshness, but seasoning/flavor could use some retooling.

I recommend this restaurant 100%! The crabmeat and lobster were delicious. The bread was literally melting in my mouth. Overall pure yammy! I suggest the Cajun sauce though. I tried both Sriracha and Cajun sauces and found that Sriracha is creamy and not that spicy. But that's more of a preference.

Ambiance: 2 - Definitely the worser of the two Lobster Me that exist in Las Vegas, this location is definitely not as good as the PH. However, this one does have a cute, almost private eating lounge that I really like. The restaurant is basically a fast food, take-out Lobster Shack, and looks accordingly with what it represents. 

Service: 2 - Service was good, but slow. I feel like if they took a shorter time preparing their sandwiches, they would get a little better reviews on the service side. 

Food: 1 - Taste at this location = not so good!! I ordered the Connecticut and I remember the sandwich at the PH being bigger, and also less dry. My lobster was so dry, it took away from the taste. Dryness of lobster usually results from overcooking and/or the amount of time spent preparing the sandwich. They might want to spend time correcting this! I would have liked to see a helping of buttery sauce with my sandwich.

The dryness was just so overpowering that eating fries and coleslaw didn't help--it actually made it worse. For spending such a hefty price on a very small sandwich that didn't even have a ton of lobster, I would have liked it to be prepared much better. Disappointed! =/
The only way to get fresher lobster is to fly to Maine charter a boat have him catch it cook it on the boat and eat it it's that fresh in that good
The place is over priced and mediocre at best. I could make better lobster mac and cheese with kraft products.

Had the lobster grilled cheese and lobster Mac and Cheese. Lobster mac and Cheese is decent creamy but had better for $14 with a tiny scoop of lobster it was ok.  Grilled lobster and cheese was in ok. For $14 not really worth the price rice. U get tiny bits and pieces of lobster ... Over priced for the amount they give u and it's almost like fast food place.

Not a fan. I got the Lobster Mac and Cheese and it was pretty disappointing. There were chunks of lobster which was awesome but it wasn't that tasty the Mac and Cheese was pretty subpar as well and was very heavy. It's enough to to put me off this place.

Came here with my wife for a small dinner and we had the lobster Mac and cheese which was great! Could have used a bit more lobster in it but it was delicious. The main thing we came for though was the Lobster Mary--bloody mary. We love Bloody Mary drinks and get one wherever we go so we have an idea of what we like. This Bloody Mary was ok and we personally did not think there was anything special about it. There was a small lobster tail in, but it made no difference. It sucked up the alcohol and turned out to be a tiny shot. Mainly alcohol, minimal taste of tomato juice, and only the salt rim was spicy. Wouldn't go crazy for it. Food was great though.
worth it. good taste and enough lobster, and very cheesey

As we were passing through the Venetian food court, Lobster Me, caught my eye. Anything with lobster or crab in the name will catch my eye. They're my favorite foods. They must be known for their lobster rolls because they had a whole menu board dedicated to it. They had the Original Maine Style, Connecticut, The Cajun, The Beltway, and the Miso Sesame. 

I went with the Connecticut, which was warm lobster meat tossed in melted butter. It came with house made chips and cole slaw. I also ordered a cup of lobster bisque, and salt and vinegar fries. 

The lobster roll was so delicious. I could taste the fresh, sweet lobster meat in every bite. It was worth the $18. The lobster bisque was also yummy. It had the right amount of cream and sherry in it. There were bits of lobster in every spoonful of soup. I didn't care for the salt and vinegar fries. It was sprinkled on top of the fries and not my thing. My husband loved it though.  I prefer good old ketchup. I would definitely go back for the lobster roll. I'm drooling as I'm thinking about it.
Lobster is very exquisite. The flavor of Mac and cheese is amazing. A bit expensive but well worth it.

Original Maine Style = Cold. 

Not just in tradition, but based on every review here. 

Mine was served warm. When I asked the girl working, she told me all of the rolls are served warm. 

I don't understand, why do 20+ reviews reference a cold roll when in fact none should be. 

Either way, roll was decent (as decent as a warm lobster roll can be), albeit pricey. 

I just wanted a cold roll :( I wonder what went wrong.

Executive Summary: Cute quick service restaurant in the Venetian Hotel/Mall that serves lobster on top of classic American favourites.

Value (Price/Quality): Poor. The price of this place easily tops over $20 when ordering a combo for a quick service-fast food type of restaurant. You're really paying to get chunks of lobster however at this price point you can easily go to other places in the mall or strip to have a better meal.

Customer Service: Good - no complaints. Friendly and will answer your touristy questions.

You'll like this place if: If you just want chunks of lobster on top of American favourites.

Don't go here if: If you're expecting gourmet style food or creative lobster menu dishes or don't like lobster!

Transportation: Free parkade attached to the hotel and bus stop outside on the strip.

Yelp Customer Bottom Line: If you like Lobster, try the Lobster Mac & Cheese. It's a big portion so feel free to share it with a friend.

Business Opportunity: Try Lobster Poutine (Canadian style)!

Change this places name to ROBster ME instead of Lobster Me.  18 bucks=4 inch piece of kings Hawaiin type slice of sandwich bread stuffed with 1/2 cup of so called lobster.  IF it were tasty it may even be worth it...but it tasted like the fake Japanese imitation Crab stuffed with mayo and butter in a 4 inch slice of bread.  FOR near frieaking 20 BUCKS!!!!  NO way in HELL returning to this piece of CRAP RIP OFF.  If you want to THROW $$$ away, gamble it at crap table...your odds of getting a return are better than at this joke of a LOBSTER  place.

Best Maine style lobster rolls in Vegas! The staff was friendly, everything was clean and the lobster rolls were amazing. This was my first time at this location as I had previously gone to the one at Planet Hollywood.
The salad is a bit weird, but the lobster grilled cheese and Mac and cheese is amaaaaazing. It is a must have.

Tried the signature lobster roll (Cajun style), Lobster tacos, and the lobster on a stick(forgot the name).  Lobster roll was very well done but didn't really like the filler waffle fries.  The lobster tacos were 3  per order and mildly spicy. The loser of the   3 was the lobster tail on a stick which was little tough but not horrible.  Best to stay with the signature items like the rolls.
Criss cut fries cold coleslaw sucked lobster was cooked well and A little on the dry side when I pay 25$ for a lo lobster roll the fries better be hot

I'm a loyal Lobster Me fan. This is my 5th trip to Vegas this year and We manage to eat a lobster roll from here everyday of our trip. I could eat this everyday if I had the opportunity too. I've been to this location 3 times on my last visit and the third time was a memorable experience. Great customer service from the owner, manager, and staff. I would highly recommend Lobster Me over any of the other places. Really wish there was one in Chicago but I'll be back in August for more.

Meh! So so so disappointed!  I had expected some sort of luscious lobster claws in between some amazing buttery toasted roll but sadly this was not an option.  Having looked at other yelp reviews and pictures I decided it was time to give this place a shot.  Boy oh boy was this a disappointment!  I didn't eat all day in anticipation for this killer meal we had been salivating over for months.  

Again, having seen the pictures posted on yelp I was under the impression that there would be multiple warm/hot lobster rolls.  Apparently they have changed their menu and now there is only one warm option with the lobster rolls.  They used to have 2 sizes of lobster rolls and now they have one.  There is a sign that reads "one pound of lobster in each roll". That was far from the truth!  My husband ordered the lobster roll and it was SO tiny!  I was shocked how small the roll was considering what we paid.  The bread was smaller than a home bought hot dog bun.  I opted for the lobster grilled cheese and upgraded to the chowder fries and a bottle of water for an additional $6.  My sandwich was $11 plus the $6.  The sandwich was tasty but not worth $11!  I liked the cheese on the sandwich but it wasn't oozing as one would hope when ordering a grilled cheese.  There was a small amount of lobster spread in between the 2 slices of what appeared to be Texas toast.  The chowder fries were so salty I really did not enjoy them and ended up throwing them away.  The chowder seemed like it was good but the cheese sauce was the salty issue!

In my opinion this restaurant is way overrated.  

You can gain easy access to this place by parking in the Venetian parking garage and veering right as soon as you see the signs for the food court.  I find it very crappy that this fast food joint gives you the option to tip when you pay with a credit card.  Fast food is exactly that, fast food.  The tipping option for fast food is an insult.  This is counter service not traditional sit down table service.  You stand in line to order for goodness sake!  There are a few tables to sit at but mostly counter seating or an option to sit along their long high top table.  This seating option would force you to sit with strangers.  Being that this is Vegas, remember what happens here stays here o.o

We paid over $40 for what seemed like more of a snack and not our dinner.

I have been to Las Vegas very often. Passed by this place numerous times. I just couldn't find myself to try this. I know that they serve Lobster, but for 14 dollars for a small Lobsical stick, I passed. Today was different. I got to the palazzo real early and no other place was open, so I gave this place a try. Long story short, the food taste great, but not worth the money you paid for. I probably come back from time to time, but I wouldn't say that I love it.

The customer service here was awful. The cashier was beyond rude. If you don't like your job, or don't want to be at work then don't show up. I ordered the lobster roll, "Cajun" style, and all I got was dry lobster topped with green onions. No flavor what so ever. I don't even think they added the butter, and they for sure forgot the aioli. This was the worst $25 spent.

I ordered the soup and sandwich combo. I asked for the Connecticut (warmed meat) and the bisque. The lobster meat was like warm at best while the bisque had scant pieces of meat. The broth had a very "floury" taste while still being thin. 

After reading the reviews, I found I could have gotten a locals discount. I was never asked if I had a Nevada ID or not. I returned to the register after I had finished, with my receipt and was given a refund for the local discount. 

All in all it was "meh" at best. I wouldn't bother spending $25 on a Luke warm lobster sandwich with pasty tasting lobsterless bisque with a lemonade to drink. I ended up deconstructing the sandwich, adding the lobster to the bisque, to warm it up, and dunking the bread in the broth.  I'm just glad I didn't have my kids with me or I would have spent more to be disappointed.

I wanted to grab something quick and simple without having to walk so far (since I was staying in the Venetian), so I decided to try the Lobster Grilled Cheese sandwich.  I liked it, but don't know if I'd choose to order this again on my next visit.  I think I would rather stick to one of the lobster rolls.

Lobster was tasty, but the sandwich was "extra small".  Considering what you pay for, lobster sandwich combo, it leaves you feeling like you only had apps instead of a full meal.  Thank goodness for the "hidden pizza" joint at Cos.  =)

The only reason this place is surviving its because its vegas. Main reason for the bad review - the quantity. For $27+tax the size of the lobster roll was unacceptable. The lobsicle is a joke at $14+tax. The cajun fries were burnt and dripping with oil. The seating area is also like a food court. Food quality was okay. Better spend your money at Red Lobster or Crab corner in vegas - if you want seafood that is priced accordingly.
Lobster rolls were amazingly delicious!  However the lobster mary was not impressive at all.  If you like a twisted tomato drink-- you might like it
I got the Beltway and it was delicious! Portions may be small for some people though, because I can't eat a whole lot in one sitting and I finished the whole thing.

Originally opened at The Grand Canal Shoppes in 2014, the location inside Miracle Mile dating back some three years prior, it was just past noon that a seat was taken at Lobster ME on Saturday, the Venetian Food Court even more packed than usual with several conventioneers and the Restaurant understaffed due to a manager being stuck behind a traffic incident on the I-15.

Embracing the quick-casual concept of places like Panera or Chipotle but said to offer only the best Lobsters out of Maine and Crab from Maryland, a bold claim for a food court counter in the middle of a city known for World Class Dining, Lobster ME is located just steps from the Grand Canal en route from the Parking Garage to the rest of the Resort and with hard to miss signage including a luminous Menu there is little to dislike about the layout featuring both reclaimed wood and buoys familiar to any who've been fortunate enough to dine at an actual Northeastern Lobster or Oyster Shack.

Greeted by a young man named AJ, he and another young woman doing their best to keep up with a heavy lunch surge including a couple who felt the need to ask at least three questions clearly explained on the menu overhead, it was after listening to him answer patiently for what felt like five minutes that the line finally advanced, a total of four items plus a bottle of water requested at a total charge of just over $50 including tax.

Giving each guest a number, seating at both the counter and nearby chairs occupied by visitors not necessarily eating Lobster ME's food, it was after less than ten minutes wait that AJ presented with the first of two handfuls of cardboard baskets, a first look at the 50/50 Lobster and Crab Roll showing it to be every bit as large as those in Connecticut or Maine and similar in price, the fresh Meat lightly tossed in Mayonnaise clean and sweet while the split, buttered and toasted Roll rivaled any found from Portland to Kittery and on down.

Doing an admirable job covering a lot of choices despite minimal space, the menu recently renovated and doing away with Desserts plus the "Deep Fried Clam Chowder" in favor of several new choices featuring Crab, it was most of the Roll gone that lunch moved on to Lobster ME's crispy Waffle Fries topped in Cheese, Crab Meat, Bacon, Green Onion and Ranch 'drizzle,' the last item completely unnecessary as it distracted from the quality of the Meat while the areas spared from it were entirely delicious.

Criticized for its value by some, the laid-back environment likely leading many to make false assumptions as not one item on the menu is more expensive than one would expect to pay on either coast, it was with three Tacos charged at about $6 each that taste buds were once again treated to fresh ingredients including Battered Shrimp and Fish that both overflowed their Shells beneath housemade spicy Aioli before finally finishing up with three "Fried Lobster Mac n' Cheese Balls," the golden orbs each nearly twice the size of a Golf ball and absolutely packed with picked Meat alongside tender pasta in Lobster Cheese Sauce with more on the side for dipping.

**** Recently upgrading the menu and presentation but doing away with Desserts, a decision likely made due to slow sales but nevertheless misguided as every Seafood Shack from Connecticut to Maine offers at least Soft Serve and Whoopie Pies, Lobster ME does an otherwise excellent job of replicating their signature item while also offering several additional novelties intended to appeal to diverse tastes.

First time at this place and food was delicious.  Husband and I shared The Connecticut and chowder fries. We paid about $26 and our meal came with a drink. Sandwich is a bit smaller than we expected but very good, stuffed with lots of tasty crab.If you are craving seafood this will definitely satisfy. Will be returning for more lobster!

Did not enjoy my lobster roll at all. I got it New England style and the meat was tasteless and had a texture like it came out of a can. This was a total waste of $24 and space in my stomach. The bread was fresh, but had no butter on it nor was it toasted or put on a grill. Tasted like someone opened a bag of bread and just placed a handful of canned lobster meat in it with a sprinkle of chives. Blah!

Read the reviews on here & was excited to try this place out..... But was completely disappointed. Food was over priced to begin with, but it was really bad when I took a bit of my sandwich & it tasted like the lobster had been soaked in kitchen cleaner. It made me instantly sick. I would never eat here again.

3 friends and I stopped by after shopping until we dropped. Seating is not the easiest unless you're alone, My friend and I ordered the Truffle roll [$19] and after being seated we were told they didn't have any more truffle. . . which was disappointing because it was the only roll that was appealing to me. Recina, offered to change our roll so we both ordered the Maine. Which does not look like the framed post on the restaurant wall BTW. Although the Maine roll was 17$, a little cheaper [i know 2$] we were not reimbursed or anything. nbd.

Each roll came with chips or fries and coleslaw. i had the Maine Roll with warm meat is quite bland, I'm a big fan of all things Lobster, i didn't squeeze the lemon on it until i was about half way. . .big mistake the lemon is a definite necessity! 
The lemon makes it perf! I tasted each condiment on the table with my roll. Ketchup was ok, Sriracha was funky but good with the Lobster, and Vinegar was alright if you like that kind of thing.

I was smitten when I had my first lobster grilled cheese at Planet Hollywood. Although that wasn't on the menu this trip, the lobster melt was an upgrade. The amount of lobster was great. It tasted fresh and succulent. The mac and cheese was to die for. It was creamy and full of flavor. I had some of my friend's chips, and they were tasty too. My whole party enjoyed it so much, they came back the next day before they left Vegas. The water they had tasted good and filtered, and that gets a star as well.

If you've been to lobster shacks in New England, you'll understand how they keep it casual. You pay about $17-19 for a lobster roll and good luck finding a spot to sit. This is why I like Lobster ME - it's all that but with shorter lines.

You get a 20% discount if you're a local. Sorry, tourists, go to a buffet instead.

Original Maine Lobster Roll:
Cold lobster in mayo and spices. The mayo they put is very light. Buttery roll. 4/5

Connecticut Lobster Roll:
Warm lobster with butter. Buttery roll. Simple but delicious. 4/5

Truffle Lobster Roll:
Chilled lobster with truffle aioli, celery, carrots and arugula. Probably the "healthiest" roll on their menu. Hint of truffle and not overly dressed. 4/5

GREAT lobster roll which lots of chunks of lobster. The one thing that was a huge disappointment was the lobster mac and cheese. I love the type of pasta they used for this, but the cheese and sauce was not good. It made the mac and cheese super heavy and unable to finish it.
Overpriced over hyped!! Average lobster roll for twice the cost!!! Don't waste your money!! Also they charge you $1 for tap water.
It's pricey but very good and flavorful. Must stop when I am in Vegas. Finally took the Wife here and she loved it. Will come back here next month

Enjoyable spot for a quick bite and well, let me acknowledge the fact that they are serving Maine lobster rolls which aren't available many places outside of Maine. However, the experience was lackluster. The lobster was good however not great. The description stated that it would be served warm however it was room temperature. The coleslaw and pickle were both crisp and delicious, the perfect accompaniments. As busy as it was, obviously a lot of folks may rate it more favorably nevertheless I'm sticking to 3 stars. I'll need to fly to Maine to try Bite of Maine lobster rolls which are rated 4.8 stars and probably cost less than $23 plus tax & tip. Then there's airfare...okay, I'll try Lobster Me again to sample the crab and shrimp choices because it's accessible, good and offers unique menu items.

What a rip off! I can't say that strongly enough! You pay 19 dollars expecting more than a piece of toasted Texas toast folded in half with maybe a couple ounces of lobster in it. What a joke! If I would have known how small it was for 19 DOLLARS, there is no way in hell I would have paid that. Very misleading.

Just don't do it...unless you love bland food then this is right up your alley.  Order the Maine Lobster roll and the lobster mac.  It looks amazing when you get it, wanted to sink my teeth in it immediately.  So I did and then began the stream of disappointment.  First neither had any flavor and only got it after I drenched it with Sriracha....your best friend here.  The way the lobster sit in the roll, which it actually sits basically on top of the roll.  They need to figure a way pack it better then my $24 sandwich meat wouldn't fall off the roll and land on the table.  I thought about the 3 second rule and then decided against it and left that lil guy there.  Its funny how I'm sitting here thinking how my subway sandwich last night was so much better than this meal.

Very tasty lobster tacos and fish ceviche. Especially for a takeaway counter in a food court. Good size portions not shy of lobster. Only weird thing - there was a piece of a stick in one of my tacos. Looks like a broken piece from a lobster pop? Still, I would def go back.

In my boyhood days I spend a lot of time in New England, specially Maine. The Lobstaa (Lobsters) are just one of a kind. But since past 27 years I live in West, Southwest and in mostly desert, I miss Maine Lobstaa Rolls. I was only so happy to find this place in Las Vegas, where they really fly in Maine Lobsters everyday and make the best Lobster rolls both ME and CT style. It pairs well with cocktails they have and my favorite is Casco Bay. Try out for lunch, a lobster roll and a drink with set you back around $30. But trust me folks that's the best money you will spend in a long time. I highly recommend this place.  Just don't take your selfie stick, because other customers will hate you.
Food was great. Will be back soon. Service was great. Love the lobster corn  and the lobster roll
is a ok,  expect to pay 40$ for two.  The food is good but the portion is small it dont feel like a pound of lobster on the roll like the ad say.

If you are looking for a lobster fix, but not looking for something fancy, this is it.

The traditional roll is just as I remember it from growing up in New England.  Not much mayo  (Good thing).  The lobster flavor comes through.  Best to get the meal deal for just $3.00 more you get the fries and a drink.  The fries are nicely seasoned.  

This is not an everyday place as it is about $20 per person, but good.
I love this place. It is such a creative way of eat lobster. And it tasted great. I put a picture in here so u can see they weren't cheap with lobster. .I just wish they had more of a menu. .

Lobster Me is lobster heaven! I know this is considered fast food, but it is really good.  My bf and I both got a fried lobstercicle. It was a nice sized tempura battered fried lobster skewer with a side of drawn butter. The lobster tasted fresh and was sweet and yummy. We had an order of Cajun fries,  mainly because it came with our entree. We also got an order of lobster Mac and cheese. It had quite a bit of lobster in it and the pasta was nicely flavored. We planned to go back the next day to try more items, but didn't make it. The food wasn't expensive and was pretty quick. The only draw back was that it was a bit crowded and there were limited seats. Since it is sort of food court like, when we did find a seat,  we had to clean it off ourselves.

Egh! Probably wont be coming back. At least not for lobster rolls. So before I used to pay about $22 for a lobster roll incl. Soda + fries. Now all of that is $30.31. Lol I'm not picky with money but I'm not gonna over pay. Thanks for taking out the salt in those fries to a moderate amount. Technically the food was good but a bit too much. A few changes to the restaurant. Which it does look nice btw. But the price... Youch! Lol

The guy at the counter was a little rude for a short guy. Lol i can get passed that. 

The Cajun lobster roll was good. The change to the fries is very nice. And as always the pickle is great to have along with coleslaw. But $30.31 for it. Well I'd rather give that in tips not for one sandwich. 

The shrimp roll was fried battered inside but very little amount of it for $18. The person I was with had it. Though I'm sure it was good.

I cant give 4 stars its pricey now and the counter guy kept staring at us. 

But it was great being a customer.

I was very disappointed went there Saturday May 21 at 2 pm sat at the bar for 5-7 minutes while the staff stood around, never coming to take our order or even acknowledge that we were there. We had to walk around the counter to another area to order 
We ordered classic lobster roll and a Garden Salad with lobster the cost was over $35.00. I never write reviews and always give restaurants the benefit of the doubt. But you only sell 1 product it should be good and plenteous, the lobster was flavorless and sparse on both the roll and the the salad didn't have more than an once of some shredded lobster. Way over priced.
Good dining -- actual lobster rolls! Good quality, even when compared to CT and ME. And real lobster bisque! Blueberry lemonade was amazing, to top it off.
Connecticut Lobster Roll is amazing! My favorite fast food ever! The chips that come with it are very yummy too!
AJ (I think) at the counter is really nice and treats customers great! Food was pretty good!

$33 (double meat) for a lobster roll with fries and coleslaw and a drink. The fries and slaw were fine but the lobster seemed a bit whack. Not a lot of flavor happening. If I would have paid $6 for the meal then we'd be talking maybe 4 stars. Even without the ridiculous price, I was thoroughly underwhelmed with this meal.
Had the original style maine style lobster roll, chowder fries, and lobster mac and cheese. The lobster roll was good. Chowder fries not bad. Lobster mac n cheese was awesome!
The lobster roll was really phenomenal. That being said, it was $19 and the lobster bisque wasn't all that good.

My son loves lobster. So when a friend of mine told me about this place; I took my son there. 

There was no line when we arrived , so we took our time to look at the menu. A blond hair Asian cashier stood behind the counter right by the register. She seem very impatient, instead of offering to explain the menu; she rushed us to order, and asked us twice "are you guys ready to order?" When there is no one behind us. 

She took our order, did not explain there is no drinks with the combo; so I had to walked up to the counter the second time to get drinks.. and that was not the end of the story. When our order arrived, my bread bowl turned out to be a cup of soup; when I asked the lady who delivered our food; she said well you only order a cup of soup; I did not want to argue, so I just accepted the order. 

As I turned around, another two ladies were arguing with the Blond Asian cashier about their orders; I guess she did not only screw my order, but someone else's too... 

Food was middle-core; but for the Eyes Rolling thing and bad attitude that we have received from the cashier? Thank you, but no thank you! We will never return to this place.

My girlfriends and I had just arrived in Vegas after a 5+ hours drive and we were starving! We wanted a quick, casual place to grab a bite to eat, and in that moment the giant "Lobester Me"  sign popped up; we decided to give it a try. I am a huge seafood fan so I was excited to try their roll. I went with the Cajun roll. It was a little on the spicy side, with the spicy mayo dressing and it was a little too sour/tart for my taste, due to the lemon dressing on top. I got their combo, which came with seasoned fries and a drink. Their fries were AMAZING! I will for sure be back here again, but will probably go with the original lobster roll.

RECENTLY I GOT LOCKED OUT OF MY OLD ACCOUNT. SO I CREATED THIS NEW ONE. WITH THE SAME NAME. PREVIOUSLY FROM MILILANI,HI.

Las Vegas, NV

So I had to work out side of Vegas for two weeks.
I did not know what I wanted to eat. A Lobster roll sounded great, so instead I ordered the Lobster sandwich. My daughter is in college, so you can image I have had my fair share of Lobster. Hate to say this. This was so bad tasting. It had a creme, cheese sauce on it. Also their was chives In the sandwich. It tasted very bitter. I  also sampled the  Mac , and Cheese. Shucks, It tasted like Velveeta Cheese. I did not get that because, I'm into a traditional southern Mac, and Cheese style.  I'm really  hoping the roll tastes great, and other people leave better reviews.

Pye E.

I'll never know how I had gone a full 31 years without having ever tried a lobster roll! I was down by the strip for a week-long convention, and a friend with me dragged me along through the Sands Expo Center, through the Venetian, to Lobster Me. First instinct was, "sounds yummy, but HOW MUCH FOR A LOBSTER ROLL?!" I'll save you a long tale and let you know that I basically tried to make it back there every day for the rest of that week! 

Lobster Me is a casual food court venue within the Venetian, adjacent to many other eateries. During convention lunch hours, the line can be long but catch them outside of these windows and you're golden! Their menu has a variety of rolls (lobster, crab, 50/50 (half crab and half lobster), but keep in mind that the lobster roll is the only one served warm. The 50/50 was good, but I had my heart set on a warm sandwich. The lobster roll can be topped with certain add ons, like avocado, chipotle aioli, etc, but I decided to be a purist for my first lobster roll - it did not disappoint! 

A friend got an appetizer called a lobscicle, which is exactly what it sounds like - a cooked lobster tail on a stick, served with butter, ready to be devoured! It looked amazing, but also pricey. On another day I tried the lobster Mac and cheese: great cheesy noodles, but I wish there was more lobster to noodles ratio, but I understand that would've probably driven up the price more. As for sides, I opted for a side of clam chowder (instead of the default fries), which in my mind rivaled the likes of Boudin's clam chowder on Pier 39 in San Francisco. The oyster crackers really make that soup dish! 

Definitely worth a try to see what the hype is about; I was glad I did! Try them here or at one of their other strip locations; none off-strip, as far as I know, but worth the price and worth the drive!
While in Vegas I visited this spot for lunch and got the lobster Mac & Cheese. Oh my God was it good. Cheese but light. Hit the spot perfectly. Delicious!!

My new must go-to next time or everytime I'm in Vegas. Came here twice during the same trip.

This is one of the better lobster rolls I've had. I'd almost compare it to the lobster roll I had at Connie & Ted's, but this one is better because it's the same size, but better price.

The lobster roll has a delicious buttery bread roll and the lobster is plentiful. Both chips and/or fries with the roll are really good (surprisingly since most of the time, you expect paired chips or fries to be a filler that isn't that tasty, and just serve as a plate filler). The chips and fries taste hand made and have good flavor.

Ordered and really enjoyed both:
- Maine style lobster roll (mayo-y, creamy and good)
- Conneticut lobster roll (buttery and warm and delicious)
- Clam chowder (decent soup)

Would love to try the other items on the menu next time. Wish there was a Lobster Me in LA.
Our first trip to Vegas, my cousin recommend Lobster Me. Never thought the food would be so so amazing. Good lobster rolls in an unexpected location while strolling through the mall.

Hubby & I went tonight which was our 2nd go round having been here back in August for a convention.
