The first time we were there....we got the Lobster Roll Connecticut Style....lobster was plentiful and tasty...I suspect because they'd just opened not that long prior to our coming is why the meat was plentiful.

This time around...Lobster not so plentiful.  This time I ordered the Maine original and if there was a 1/4 pd of Lobster...that was a lot!!!

The servers tried to explain to me that they used a pound sized lobster and got a 1/4 pd of meat from it...do I look like I live under a rock??

Hubby & I buy our Lobsters at Gelsons (A local gourmet supermarket in Los Angeles County)....bring them home & steam them ourselves.  We get a pound and a half each.  I know what a pound of lobster meat looks like...these were not a pounds worth of lobster meat in either Lobster Roll.....

I am more than willing to pay for a fair market rate...but I too expect what I pay for......Disappointed.....
Fast, fresh, delicious.  The lobster roll is chunky goodness and the old bay fried are a quality side and you get a lot for your money.

I would have to say for 4 pieces of small lobster meat this was very overpriced. Mine didn't look like the pictures posted or the menu. I got it to go so I didn't look at it till I got back to my room. It was ok tasting but prob not that good to go back again. I have had much better on the east coast for less in price and much more quantity.

Found this gem w/ some co-workers (yes, companies do hold corporate events out in Vegas!) back in April and loved it! So for another Vegas trip a few weeks ago being that we were staying in the Venetian I was able to hit this place up 2 times!!

Loved it! I think the Lobster & Chips is my favorite. One night I tried a sandwich, but I still prefer the Lobster & Chips. (The portions to price may seem small compared to the price needed... but it's probably portioned out appropriately anyways.)

They do have a few alcoholic drinks.. a few taps and a few mixed drinks. I think I may have had a blueberry margarita (or mojito) or something. That was good!

For me to go two days in a row to a place in Vegas... that's saying something. :)
Haven't a true Connecticut lobster since I moved away from CT. Their Connecticut lobster roll is the real deal. Delicious. Service was good.

Cute place for a quick bite located in the Venetian. I had the lobster grilled cheese and the lobster Mac and cheese. It wasn't the best or freshest lobster I've had but they were both delicious. The price is a bit steep but it is lobster and we are in Vegas. Quick tip, free refills on sodas!

If you are looking for some All American casual Seafood this is definitely the place to go to. Knuckle sandwich is unbelievable! We also had the lobster fries and my wife fell in love with those. Make sure you asked for the fried clam chowder , it is one of the most delicious Chowder's I've ever had ! Will definitely be stopping by next time we're at the Venetian.

Lobster ME is a fast casual restaurant in the Grand Canal Shoppes at the Venetian where you can get an honest to goodness lobster roll in the Las Vegas desert.  Because you're Vegas, expect some added trickery.  Purist may turn away, but it is a good location to grab a relatively cheap meal.

My Overall Rating - 3 Stars (Atmosphere, Service, Food, Return)

Atmosphere - It's located in the food court of the Grand Canal shops, and like many malls in Vegas, it's indoors so you can escape the heat.  You do have to venture in pretty deep to find it, and like many places in Vegas you'll feel like you're in a maze.  It has limited seating though, and you'll find many people waiting around for a table when it gets busy.   1/2 Star.

Service - Typical fast casual service here.  You line up, place your order, grab a number, and grab a seat (if one is free).  The staff was fast and friendly.  I didn't notice any dedicated staff members clearing tables, but in a busy food court with shared seating it is sorely needed.   1/2 Star.

Food - I can't believe I want to admit this but I really enjoyed my lobster roll.  I went with a traditional roll which came with plenty of chunky lobster and a fantastic butter/toasted bun.  I also ordered a side of chowder fries which I highly recommend.  You'll get big chunky fries covered with a chowder sauce.  It's like eating potato soup (the fries are the potato).  Now, this is Vegas, so while you can get a traditional roll like I did, the menu as has items like a Cajun or San Francisco (with miso sauce).  If you're into that, you'll like it.  Otherwise I recommend you stick to the traditional rolls. 1 Star.

Will I Return? - Yes.  At the end of the day, my quality lobster roll with fries and drink was about $15.  Not too bad for Las Vegas.  Now, seating can be limited during lunch/dinner time, but it's a nice stop if you're shopping in the Venetian.  1 Star.

My Yelp Rating Scale (Sum of all parts):
1 Star - Atmosphere - Is it a cool dive?  Perhaps an upscale place?  No matter the type, atmosphere plays a big part and I'll give a star if I like it or thinks it has great charm.
1 Star - Service - You can have a great meal with bad service.  But that's also what can make a five star joint drop to four.  It's important to the dining experience that service is great and on point.
2 Stars - Food - I'll award up to two stars for the food, since this is the main reason we dine out.  Sometimes the extra star is given for value, but it's really all about the food.
1 Star - Will I come back? - If I know for a fact I'll return, I'll give this a star. A place has to make an impression for me to return. 

Each Category can be given up to 1 star except food (2 stars) because I consider all these categories important to the overall dining experience.  I will sum them up to provide my final Yelp score.

First off, I am by no means no lobster connoisseur. Having only had a few rolls mostly in Boston finding on that compares to the east coast or real thing is hard to find this far away from the New England area. I was craving a lobster roll so I sought out this place as I had seen it before on a previous trip to LV. This place is over priced and yes yes....I know it's Vegas.
The lobster roll comes in four different variations: Maine "original" - naked w/ butter and served chilled
Connecticut - naked w/ butter served warm
Cajun - just with cajun spice
El Diablo - with a spicy tomato based sauce
All rolls were $17 except the El Diablo ($18) one.
The roll was definitely not worth the price.  They state that you will get lobster meat from a 1lb lobster. They do not look like the picture nor what you get on the east coast (large pieces of lobster). The lobster meat is diced so much that it's almost lobster "tuna fish" 
One can also order fries and a drink for an additional $3, or a cup of chowder or lobster bisque and a drink for an additional $4 or chowder fries and a drink for an additional $6. I opted for the drink and a cup of lobster bisque with a side of cajun fries. See picture below. It was what you would expect from a "fast-foodish" lobster joint in Vegas. Nothing to brag about.

For the none roll types, there were also a few other lobster options that sounded good but probably that is as far as it goes. 

- Lobsicle $14 a deep fried or grilled lobster tail on a stick.
- Lobster Mac and Cheese
- Lobster tacos
- Lobster grilled cheese

Overall, I'll have to continue sticking to the real deal over on the east coast when it comes to lobster rolls.

I wish I could rate this place higher. I think that I just went on a bad day at the wrong time. I have to be honest in saying that I went on May 5th due to a co-worker speaking so highly of it. 

I went with three other people. Of all food ordered:

Lobster chunks with fries
Fish tacos
2 orders of the lobster roll



First off, our "roll" was so greasy that you couldn't even taste the lobster. The two Of us felt so sick after a few bites. 

My friends lobster and fries looked like a kids meal. I actually felt bad for asking to go here for my birthday. The fish tacos looked good and my friend said that they were alright but it was less tacos and more fries. 

It was so bad that I will never go back. I hope they work out the kinks and maybe they have by now. I work in the hotel and eat out everyday. This was by far, the worst!

I've eaten a lot of Lobster Rolls, but I have to say this is The Absolute Worse One Ever and they are rude to top it off. 

It was dry dry dry dry omg $26 sandwich yuck

Loved this place! I am a big lobster lover so when I go out for lobster, it has to be practically perfect. This quick stop I must say had the taste of a five star restaurant. I ordered the Connecticut roll along with the Cajun fries and was in heaven with the first bite. The buttery lobster was so good as was the buttery toasted bread it was placed in. The fries had really good flavor and seasoned very well. It was a little pricy or being a food court mall stop, but worth the trip.

Lobster Mac and Cheese was very good and large portions. The Bloody Mary very tasty and again large portion. Yes, it is expensive, $30 for Mac&Cheese and a Bloody Mary, but what's not expensive in Las Vegas. Enjoyed everything!!
Who doesn't like a Connecticut lobster roll with a side of lobster mac and cheese. DUH!  Can it ever be bad! Good stuff. Go there.

Lobster Me was just OK for us.  I still think the lobster roll in Ogunquit, Maine is still the best and the freshest-tasting.  

We had a problem with the lobster bisque and Cajun fries arriving at our table.  The lady offered us a free lemonade.  That was nice!  Note:  The lobster bisque takes a while to prepare as it's soup in a bread bowl.  I'm not sure why it was taking so long.  Then, they forgot the Cajun Fries.  

Note:  You cannot charge the restaurant meal to your room at the Palazzo / Venetian.  That's too bad!  Another Note:  Go early for your meals 'cos they only have a few tables and chairs at their little restaurant space in the Grand Canal Shoppes.

After reading my Yelp buddies - Yolanda R. & Angel H.'s review about "Lobster Me"..........I quickly booked marked this place, as I knew the next time I was in Las Vegas, I really wanted to try a lobster sandwich roll.

Yeah, I know.........the sandwich has mayonnaise, and for you folks that know me..........I am a totally mayonnaise hater! But hey, we are talkin' about lobster here, and not a tuna sandwich! But wait........I do like tuna sandwiches......yeah, I'm kinda weird.......I know! Go figure?

So after landing in Las Vegas, I tell my homies - "'Eh, lets go to this place called "Lobster Me" for a lobster sandwich........I'm buying!" 

So off we went to the Venetian Hotel, and headed straight to the Grand Canal Shoppes where I quickly found this little food stand.

Lobster Me is located by a small food court within the Grand Canal Shoppes, the restaurant is basically a fast food lobster sandwich joint. You walk up to the counter, order your food & pay. They will give you a ticket number, then you will need to find an open table to sit down. 
When your food is ready, someone will bring it to your table.

What did we order here?
.
One of my friends & I ordered - The "Original Main Style" lobster roll which consisted of - Maine lobster meat with celery, chives and mayo. ($18.00 per combo).

And my other friend ordered - The "Beltway" lobster roll which consisted of - Warm Maine lobster tossed with Old Bay and shallot-chive mayo. Topped with butter-toasted panko crumbs. ($18.00)

My friends also ordered an Old Fashion Lemonade ($4.00) & a Blueberry Lemonade ($8.00).

What can I say about the grub?

I must say my lobster roll was DELICIOUS! Lot of chunks of lobster, and the seasonings with the lobster made it buttery good!
 
But if I could properly critique this meal, what I was really disappointed of.......... was the very small portions of food that they served, in comparison to what they charged you.

The lobster sandwich was delicious, but all so small. Funny when I see the picture on the wall menu, they make it look so big, then when you get your sandwich.............I'm thinking - "Where's the rest of my lobster sandwich!" Lol! 

As for the sides - (potato) chips & coleslaw..........the chips, I can pass on. I'm not sure if it was freshly cut & fried, but it was definitely not light tasting at all.........kinda soggy, if anything. The coleslaw serving was ridiculously small........it was just a pinch of coleslaw, about the size of a nut...........but of course, we are not here for the sides. We are here for the lobster roll!

Drinks were kind of on the expensive side...........$8 bucks for a blueberry lemonade? I'd rather drink a beer! Lol!

Overall, a neat little shop...........the lobster roll I'd give it a very strong "4", but I had to knock off a point for the puny portions that they served here.

For $71.35 - I got 3 lobster roll sandwiches, and 2 drinks.......worth it? I'm not so sure.......

Wayy too overprice for the portion you get! Some of my friends had more lobster meat than others. Not fair lol. Plus service looked a bit confused even with our numbers at our table. 

I wouldn't come back to eat here.

GREAT! i Loved the cajun roll! i go there alot they have THE BEST chowder fries, the best lobster grilled cheese, the best clam chowder! its just all great! if you want lobster this is the place to go! they even have a very delicious Lobster bloody mary!

Awesome place!   After a few hours of shopping,  I felt I needed a nice cool drink and passed by this place caught my attention!   I really liked the name and the great display picture of the Bloody Mary Lobster Claw!

I sat at the counter and a nice friendly girl came over,  so I told her I would like to order the drink advertised.  She made it quickly and first taste was great!!!  Very nice tomato flavor with a good amount of spices,  I ate the claw, plus it has a fresh lemon and celery stick!  Best part was the crushed ice, it really does make a big difference in drinks compared to ice cubes.  Overall very refreshing drink and I enjoyed my break, as my legs have been walking all day ...
The bread used for the lobster roll so soft and light! Allows for the full taste of the lobster. Wait staff recommended the crab waffle fries which were to die for. Lobster Me anytime!

My  friends and I overall enjoyed the food at Lobster ME in the Venetian, but it was nothing to write home about. I got the grilled Lobsicle. It was small, only about 5 bites start to finish, but the taste was incredible and super buttery. The salt and vinegar fries, however, fell short. I like flavor and was hoping the salt and vinegar would be strong, but they were hardly detectable at all. I guess if you like subtlety in flavors, you'd enjoy it. 

Later in the week I got the lobster tacos, which were quite good. They were decently packed with cilantro and cabbage and came with a small side of tortilla chips. My brother got the Maine Lobster Roll. He found it pretty okay but too expensive for the quality of food, and his side of coleslaw was tasteless. My boyfriend got the Lobster Mac & Cheese and absolutely loved it, though.

If you're in a hurry, don't stop by Lobster ME. There wasn't much of a line either time I went, but it took quite a while for our food to be ready. And everything but the fries was overpriced.

Having a lobster obsession for a bit, I was delighted to find an only lobster restaurant. The restaurant is located at the Venetian next to the canal. The price is great. 

I had the Maine lobster roll and it was divine. It wasn't enough food though so I got a lobsicle after. I wish there a Lobster Me in Los Angeles so I can go every weekend.
Amazing Bloody Mary! Hard to find but worth it! Not exactly cheap but totally worth what you get. Phenomenal good!!!

Not halfway bad rolls, tucked inside the back of the Venetian. Surely they can't compare to the real thing in Boston, but their original takes on lobster sandwiches and sides were appreciated. I tried their Maine-style lobster roll and chowder fries. The roll was decent, and had a good amount of lobster, but a lack of seasoning and mayo held the dish back. The chowder fries were solid, but also needed a little salt. Regrettably, I probably won't be back anytime soon. It's basically an overpriced walk up and order food court restaurant boasting big eats with little follow through. On the plus side, the service was friendly, and the place was clean.

I originally glanced over this place because of the 3.5 star ratings, but I'm glad we stopped by. After eating Luke's Lobster's lobster roll, we came here. Decided not to try their lobster roll since we just had one for lunch, so I can't compare how those were. 

Got the Lobster Mac and Cheese. A larger portion than I expected. Pretty good mac and cheese, and had huge pieces of lobster (and a lot of it) on top. It was cheaper than a lobster roll, and I feel like the amount of lobster was the same, maybe even more. Totally worth it and would get this again! This was one of my favorite meals in Las Vegas.

Tried the Lobster Tacos as well. If I stopped at the mac and cheese, I'd probably give this place 5 stars, but the tacos definitely brought it down a star. It came with two tiny tacos and a side of chips and salsa. The chips and salsa were pretty good (better than the tacos in my opinion). The tacos were a bit too small and the taste of the tortilla was too strong.

Very solid lobster roll.  Prices are reasonable, at $17 for a lobster roll with a couple chips.  The service was great, friendly staff and they deliver the food to you despite the food court setup.  Might have liked to try the Lobster Mac & Cheese, but only had one dish to get.  I suppose my only comment would be that they claim that there is a pound of lobster per roll, which seemed like a stretch.  All-in-all good stuff being served at Lobster ME though.
We tried the lobster roll and chowder fries.  Chowder fries were really good- never had that combo before and I was pleasantly surprised.
Oh my God.  The best lobster roll ever very delicious very fresh I will definitely try this again. Two thumbs up for lobster me in Las Vegas

Very close to 5 stars, but only been here once. I do enjoy some lobstah, and was eager to taste the delicacy in their lobster mac n cheese meal. It was yummy and had plenty of lobstah. There was even a kick to it, which was an awesome bonus. It's a pretty filling portion, and our party of 4 was very happy that we tried this place. 
Seating is limited, but the nearby food court has lots of additional seating, we just ordered to go and hoofed it a short distance to a table at the food court.

This review might be a little unfair because I just had a fantastic lobster roll from the foodie fest event  that just rolled up here in Vegas from the Lobster Lady truck. But here it goes.
LobsterMe's lobster roll was embarrassing bad. First it hardly had any lobster. I did only order the large but  the bread to meat ratio was about 3 parts bread 1 part meat, I would say less then 3 ounces of meat.  The roll was very dry, hard and a bit stale.
 The menu did look pretty interesting and I was planning on going back and trying some other items,  but I don't think I'll be going back. Honestly I felt like i was ripped off.

Okay, so first off I want to mention how much I enjoyed my Connecticut style lobster roll. It was nicely buttered on a toasted roll :) In my opinion, I enjoy the warm lobster rolls as opposed to the cold, Maine style ones. 

Anyways, it was really good. I had it for my breakfast actually and the place got packed in less than half an hour after we left. 

Definitely would come back for another bite.

One downside to this delicious roll is that it is a bit small for the price.

At first, the service seemed slow and inefficient. Our drinks didn't even show up on the bartender's computer, so he couldn't make them. The packets of tartar sauce are impossible to get into even without butter all over my fingers. But the manager, Malcolm, saved the day. He's the best part of the joint and made things right.  At $17 a pop for entree and $9 per drink, I'd expect a some decent fresh tartar sauce and full paper cups of cole slaw. Skip the fish and chips, lobster and chips, and the fries. Try the lobsicle, el diablo roll, and lobster grilled cheese.

Extremely impressed with Lobster ME at the Shoppes in the Venetian! 
Order at the counter, take a number and wait - great menu with fresh lobster, crab and other options. 
The lobster mex salad is a large portion with fresh avocado and toppings and a heaping pile of lobster salad! The lobster salad is perfectly mixed - not too much mayo and fantastic seasoning. 
The lobster crab roll is great, stuffed full of meat on a toasted roll. Definitely a good portion for a lobster roll with lots of crispy fries on the side. 
The fried lobster Mac and cheese balls are unbelievable!! 3 large balls of lobster meat and creamy Mac and cheese with an amazing cheesy sauce on the side. Totally worth it. 
Many sandwiches and roll choices, lots of sides and other options as well. 
Prices are to be expected in Vegas, but in comparison to order at the counter in the area, this is a bit pricey - while you typically wouldn't choose lobster in Vegas, if you're having a craving, I highly recommend Lobster ME - I'm from Mass and was not disappointed!!
I ordered the classic lobster roll meal and it was delicious!   You can get it with soup, chowder or fries. I got mine with fries and the fries were good too!

So I was Super Excited to see Lobster Me in the Venetian.  It was easy and quick.  I look for lobster rolls wherever I go and I try them all.  We ordered 2 different rolls (they had 5). The 2 rolls were excellent but extremely similar. Fries didn't come w the rolls just a few chips and slaw, which wasn't good. 
Price was a bit expensive and wasn't a combo.  18.00 up charge for fries and slaw, which was so tiny I had to send back for a little more and it wasn't even worth it.  
However , service was good.

I had the Connecticut Lobster Roll with Lobster Bisque, and my wife had the Prince of Wales Lobster Melt with Lobster Bisque, as well. I loved the big chunks of buttery lobster, and the melt was very flavorful. The bread on both the roll and melt tasted good too. We added a touch of Sriracha to our lobster bisque, and it was excellent! The staff was also really friendly and really took time to engage customers with small chat and provided drink refills. It was a really nice and relaxing time from shopping for us.

I wish that the seating here was a little different but it was a food court so keep that in mind. I ordered the lobster Mac which was decent and my fiancé ordered a lobster roll with fries. He says the lobster roll was very well made and the fries could've been cooked a little longer. All in all for a quick bite, this place is okay. Prices are a little high.

Great hang over food and also good for a quick bite to keep you hanging until you're ready to go out to the big Vegas style restaurants at night! The food is great and the service was also good! The servers helped me choose some great options! I understand it is Vegas and everything is expensive but compared to the size of my sandwich, I think the prices are too high! My only suggestion would be to make the entrees a tad bit bigger if they want to continue charging as much as they do. I also get it that they have made a name for themselves from the food trucks but come on,I literally finished my sandwich in 3 bites!

If you come to Las Vegas you have to try this place out, staff is friendly 
( they should be because this place is slightly expensive ) but it is very good... I took an Uber there twice to eat. It is in the middle of a mall, which is kind of ratchet but never less it's VEGAS!!!! Don't over order though because seafood wasn't meant to sit in a hotel. ( please don't get sick trying to store seafood)

split the CT roll w. my friend. we added the chowder fries and drink to make a meal of it. I had iced coffee already so I let him have the drink.

Our total was $25+ kind of on the pricier side, but it's LOBSTER!

I wish the CT roll was a tad bit bigger. I didn't like how the lobster was minced up so small, but it was tasty. Bread was extra buttery. Chowder fries were amazing though. Whoever thought to put chowder over fries is a genius.
Maine lobster roll, lobster mac & cheese , lobster ME.. Yummy! A must when in Vegas every time any day! Seriously ^.^ never disappoints

Located in the Venetian hotel, lies the most tender, juicy lobster shack around! They have everything lobster. Lobster subs, lobster sandwiches, lobster mac and cheese, lobsicles and much more! Whatever you're craving, they got it. What I love about this place is that they do not skimp you on lobster. Everything I've tried had huge chucks of lobster. Never dry, and always very flavourful. They serve their flavours a few different ways so you can have it how you like. The only thing that I do not like is how pricey it is! 1 lobster sub and 1 chowder...about $40 bucks. Better be winning big if you're pigging out here with the family!

I loved this place! Heard it from a few friends of mines and it was highly recommended, and there was no shortage of lobster! So much so that I nearly tapped out on finishing the lobster Mac and cheese on top of my lobster bisque and lobster roll
